v5.1.0.name: v5.1.0 (Argon/Boron/B SoM/B5 SoM/Tracker/Tracker M/E SoM X/P2)

entries.text: supports BLE GATT client, BLE central role and pairing APIs
Improve ADC accuracy
update rtl872x.tcl script for latest openocd version
wifi: add generic 'world' country code as not every country code is exposed through API
Increase power management thread stack size for Tracker M
Fix MCP23S17 driver to allow mirrored (shared) interrupts
usb: make sure CDC line coding struct is packed
hal: fix fetching of MAC addresses
Fix listening mode tests on trackerM
ApplicationWatchdog: fixes potential 2x timeout required to fire
Fix BLE control request channel sending malformed packets
Add workaround for TrackerM ota tests
Use new `prtcl` compile/clean commands for internal CI builds
Improve COAP message logging
HAL wiring api calls to access exflash read/write functions for OTP flash page

v5.0.1.name: v5.0.1 (Argon/Boron/B SoM/B5 SoM/Tracker/Tracker M/E SoM X/P2)

entries.text: Added APIs for hardware configuration for reading OTP format
Update demux driver and pinmap to support more latest hardware
Secures DCT initialization from getting interrupted between creating DCT file and filling it with 0xff to default state
Fix hal dynalib tables
Fix interrupt based tests

Deprecate/remove the PRODUCT_ID macro . Users may now use the same binary for multiple Products that share the same device Platform and Functionality. Including this macro will cause a build error and show the following message:
supply secure
Adds warning to some deprecated API's that will be removed in Device OS 5.x
PRODUCT_ID macro
remove setup_done flag and add deprecation notice
new API System.updateStatus()
Adds support for new platform esomx
Determine flash part at runtime
Adds support for BG95-M1, BG95-MF, BG77, and EG91-NAX
`System.hardwareInfo()` API
wifi: add dhcp dns info to wifi config
Additional state for firmware update checks
Use a custom content type with CID packets when resuming the session
fixes hardfault during low level USB peripheral initialization under an atomic section
Device unable to enter listening mode with button press
Return relevant error from control request to enter listening mode
hal: fix power leak on Boron
port newlib stdin/stdout/stderr memory leak workaround
fixes `interrupts()` API: should not clear pending interrupts
Ensure that RTOS context switch is performed in tight `delay(1)` loops
minor update sc-101315/device-os-manifest
chore/ci-less-frequent-cross-platform-build-checks
Update dependencies for ARM GCC 10.2.1
suppress certain reviewed GCC warnings [sc-100940]
feature/sc-100324/ci-build-cross-platform
Wi-Fi resolve test improvements
update-device-os-workbench-manifest-json
test-build-system-tune-timeouts
Allow overriding the platform ID on the GCC platform
Enable OTA updates on the GCC platform
Fix GCC platform on some versions of GCC; Fix building of wiring/api tests on CI
Update workbench buildscripts to 1.11.0
Stop ignoring device os scripts directory
Remove redundant toolchain overrides
Add stubs to allow setting common country code and channel plan in P2
Change PWM pins to better match e-series pinout for E SoM X. Fix other tests
Misc changes to tests from 5.x
disable RGB pwm channel(s) when running pwm tests
Streamline `.bundleignore` between 5.x and 4.x codebases
branch pattern changes for `test-build-system`
fixes race condition with `wiring/no_fixture` `TIME_17`
BLE Provisioning Mode
System.off() API support for unsubscribing from system events/handlers
CoAP Blockwise transfer for Describe messages
Enables stack overflow detection in all builds
Adds LOG_C_VARG() logging macro to support vargs from user apps
Adds os_thread_dump* introspection functions to wrap the FreeRTOS functions
Migration to CircleCI
Adds ability to override the panic handler in user applications
SystemPowerConfiguration::socBitPrecision(uint8_t bits)) API added
Thread/interrupt safety for system_event_t subscriptions
BLE: introduce wiring APIs to change ATT MTU
Dummy setup code should not return error
`acquireSerialXBuffer()` API support for UART
Support for SARA R510
Optional feature to use HSE/LSI as RTC clock source instead of LSE (external 32KHz XTAL)
BLE: Add ability to set and scan extended advertisement size (when using Coded PHY)
Enable GCC `-Wextra` when building Device OS to enable additional diagnostics provided by GCC. Fix issues uncovered
Refactor system describe/info JSON generation to reduce size and remove invalid modules from it
Add additional modem responsiveness check on warm boot to avoid triggering R510-specific initialization issue
BLE: fix unintialized `scan_phys` in default scan parameters, preventing scanning from working unless `BLE.setScanPhy()` is manually set
Avoid power leakage through ESP32 `ESPBOOT` pin
Fix parsing of JSON strings with more than 127 tokens
Clear module slots in DCT when preparing for an OTA update
Increase BLE operation timeout to ensure that BLE events are correctly handled and do not trigger an assertion
Fix occasional WiFI setup issue over BLE
Ensure that invalid modules are not presented to the cloud in System Describe message
BLE: Fix copy-constructor and assignment operator issues in wiring APIs
Fix hardfault handler to SOS again
Fix LittleFS truncate causing file corruption [#268](https://github.com/littlefs-project/littlefs/issues/268)
HAL - Only skip modules that fail integrity check from module info
256KB application support
Support for DTLS connection IDs
GCC 10 support
BLE LESC support
BLE 5 PHY_CODED (long range) scanning and advertising support
AB1805 native watchdog support
Support for SARA R410 05.12 modem firmware
Add an API to get the maximum supported size of event data
Cache ESP32 MAC address in persistent storage to improve boot-up times
Inhibit Cellular URCs before going into sleep to prevent them from triggering wake-up
Remove XIP support for accessing the external flash
Enable LTO
Trigger a compiler error when a function returning a value does not do so
Fix non-MBR-based bootloader updates
Do not reset the DTLS session on socket errors
Prevent ICCID querying errors when not connected to a cellular network by using airplane mode `CFUN=4`
Make sure to close all sockets when deinitializing WICED WLAN connectivity subsystem
Fix unexpected network connection establishment after exiting sleep mode when only `Network.on()` was called
Fix unexpected network connection establishment when the modem or WiFi initialization failes, but only `Network.on()` was called
Correctly restore network interface power state after waking up from `STOP` or `ULTRA_LOW_POWER` sleep modes
Fix the issue that the Particle.disconnect() doesn't clear the auto-connect flag
Fix unintended modem reset after an ongoing network registartion attempt is actively cancelled by the application
Fix `Particle.unsubscribe()` not preserving system subscriptions
Querying the value of an empty string variable causes an error
Remove `rssi` and `qual` from `Cellular.RSSI()`
BLE API consistency enhancements
Proactively attempt to recover from a number of failed cellular registration states
Battery presence detection when charging is disabled
Increase the maximum DTLS packet size and payload of the cloud primitives
Send modem firmware version to the cloud as part of the system describe message
OTAv3 protocol
ESP32 WiFi scanning support
`SystemPowerFeature::DISABLE_CHARGING` configuration option to enable or disable charging
`Network.isOn()` and `Network.isOff()` APIs to query the network interface power state
BLE legacy pairing
Query cellular signal while trying to register on a network
WiFi/GNSS/FuelGauge sleep wake-up sources
Configure multiple pins as wakeup source at a time
Reduce cloud keep-alive timeout to 25 seconds from 30 seconds
Improve I2C reset procedure to be less destructive and issue STOP condition as soon as possible
Perform PMIC/FuelGauge/RTC I2C bus reset on boot to avoid accidental writes after a non-graceful reset
System power management improvements
Update ICCID/IMSI to APN map with a new Kore ICCID prefix
Disable some of the elliptic-curves not in use to save flash space
Update LTE signal strength/quality parameters (RSRP/RSRQ) mapping to percentages
Improve warm and cold boot behavior
Custom logging categories for AT parser and GSM 07.10 multiplexer to differentiate between cellular modem and ESP32 on Tracker platforms
Reduce code size of GSM 07.10 multiplexer implementation making sure that ESP32 and cellular NCP client use the same template variant of it
Speed up modem power-on
Cache ESP32 NCP firmware version in non-volatile memory
Network interface management improvements
`SPI.transfer()` support for constant buffers residing in flash
Add characteristic discovery to `BleService`
BLE Scanned/Connected/Disconnected/Data Received callbacks in C++ style
BLE scanning filter
Build system parts with LTO enabled
Add more operators for `BleAddress`, `BleUuid` and `IPAddress`
Upate MbedTLS to 2.22.0
ESP32 NCP firmware updated to version 0.0.7
Use `PARTICLE_` prefix for LED defines in order not to pollute global namespace
Ethernet FeatherWing power state management
Changes how signal strength and quality percentages are calculated to provide a more accurate representation of signal conditions
Add workaround for Nordic nRF52840 anomaly 219 (TWIM: I2C timing spec is violated at 400 kHz)
Fix micros/millis/unixtime becoming non-monotonic [2a4fcb82b](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/commit/2a4fcb82b0968300b8a0227f665ffe94203f9f38)
Use `PIN_INVALID` when initializing SPI peripheral to avoid overriding the pin mode of the default CS pin on reinitialization
Make sure that ESP32 NCP power state is correctly initialized on boot
Increase `AT+COPS` timeout to 5 minutes
Fix Sleep 2.0 APIs taking up to 10 minutes to power-off the cellular modem while it's attempting network registration
Fix warm boot sometimes requiring modem reset
Fix external SIM getting stuck in initialization
Return `false` in `BlePeerDevice::getCharacteristicByDescription()` if expected characteristic was not found
Fix UART DMA RX transfer size issues causing DMA writes outside of the RX buffer
Fix `ChannelStream::waitEvent()` timeout calculation
Fix warm boot feature regression introduced in 3.0.0-beta.1
Disconnect from the server on OTAv3 update errors
Fix D0 alternate-function being unconditionally reset when calling `Serial1.end()`
Fix an issue with `BLE.scan()` deadlocking

v5.0.0.name: v5.0.0 (Argon/Boron/B SoM/B5 SoM/Tracker/Tracker M/E SoM X/P2)

entries.text: Remove undefined pins from esomx pinmap
P2 Support
Tracker M Support
Allow setting WiFi country code and channel plan
Implement HAL event group for UART
Implement APIs to set/get BLE address

Register without waiting for CSD connections
usart: flush DMA FIFO data when required
port newlib stdin/stdout/stderr memory leak workaround
Flash supports page write and other fixes
map ADC channels to the correct pins

fixes for attachInterrupt() / noInterrupts() / interrupts() APIs
hal: fix issue that uart rx dma may hang up.
hal: implement i2c sleep and fix the reset APIs
attachInterrupt() should not configure input pullup/pulldown/nopull
PWM HAL fixes
Disable direct logging in listening mode
Ensure task yield and system thread pump in system_delay_pump
deprecate tinker-fqc app

disable RGB pwm channel(s) when running pwm tests

device tree stubs

fixes RSSI regression on G350 (2G) devices
Temporarily increase IDLE task priority whenever a thread exits (calls vTaskDelete) to resolve a memory leak that resulted in device being stuck "blinking green" until reset in some cases.
Fixes mesh pub/sub socket consuming all packet buffers
Bootloader correctly re-imports the DCT functions from system firmware after its modification through DFU

Beginning with 1.0.0 release, Particle.publish() and Particle.subscribe() methods will require event scope to be specified explicitly. This means using `PRIVATE` or `PUBLIC` for `Particle.publish()` and `MY_DEVICES` or `ALL_DEVICES` for `Particle.subscribe()`.  Please update your apps to include the event scope to avoid compilation errors in firmware `>0.7.0`. Deprecation warnings for this change began with `0.7.0-rc.3`.
`WiFi.RSSI()` must be cast to `int8_t` when used inline with Serial.print() to produce correct results.  E.g. `Serial.printlnf("%d", (int8_t) WiFi.RSSI() );` Electron is not affected.

Fixes missing URCs for received data during TX or RX socket operations. This caused the modem not to be able to receive further data properly until it re-connected to the Cloud which it would do automatically but usually after a short or longer period of time.

`Particle.keepAlive()` API was broken since v0.6.2-rc.2 firmware on Electron where the System would override an early set User ping interval.  This required a workaround of updating the keepAlive after the System made a connection to the Cloud.  See issue #1482 for workaround.

Fixes SOS in 0.8.0-rc.11 and also ensures button and OOM events are handled synchronously. Previously in multi-threaded applications the button handling may have been delayed to run within the application thread.  Now it is always handled immediately and should be noted that it is called from an ISR, so it is not advised to dynamically allocate memory in button event handlers. () ()

Add dependency in `system-part-1` on 0.6.4 system-part-3 to prevent upgrades from 0.6.3 or earlier to avoid incompatibilities with these releases.
Downgrade bootloader functionality in 0.6.3 would enter an infinite loop after flashing system part 1 0.7.0-rc.X using OTA/serial. `particle flash --usb`/DFU was not affected.
Downgrade bootloader when downgrading from 0.7.0 or newer.
(https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1419)

(https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1418)
Sticker Rig support added for Electron manufacturing.  6-Digit device setup code added.  Firmware reset enabled on Electron.
Expands the device code from 4 digits to 6 digits for Photon/P1/Electron platforms
`[Photon/P1]` When using `SYSTEM_THREAD(ENABLED)` the TCPServer and WPA Enterprise connections were broken.
A call to `WiFi.scan()` when Wi-Fi module is off or not ready was resulting in a hard fault.
SoftAP SSID was not respecting the string's null terminator, 2 char SSID would appear as 4.

When using WPA Enterprise access point and constantly reconnecting to it, heap was becoming fragmented which resulted in inability to connect to the access point anymore. Also reduced overall heap usage.
Removed the `firmware-docs` subtree from the `firmware` repo.  Docs updates are made directly to `docs` repo again.
Added test for `RGB.onChange()` handler leak
Updates minimal ARM gcc version required to 5.3.1
Fixes build with `PLATFORM=gcc` on OSX with clang's gcc wrapper
`Particle.publish()` now able to use Future API
`[Photon/P1]` WPA/WPA2 Enterprise support added (PEAP/MSCHAPv2 and EAP-TLS)! [Photon/P1] Automatic cipher/security detection when configuring WiFi settings over Serial.
`[Photon/P1/Electron]` DFU transfer speeds increased! v100 bootloader is now 41% faster than v7 and 60% faster than the latest v11.
Added type-safe wrapper for enum-based flags for `Particle.publish()` which enables logical OR'ed flag combinations `PRIVATE | WITH_ACK`
Adds error checking to `WiFi.setCredentials()`, will return `true` if credentials has been stored successfully, or `false` otherwise.
Added an overload to `map()` function that takes `double` arguments.
`[Photon/P1]` Added support for setting a custom DNS hostname, default is device ID.
Adds ability to interrupt the blinking cyan cloud connection with the SETUP/MODE button.
`[Photon/P1]` Constrains `WiFi.RSSI()` to -1dBm max.
Removes `spark/device/ota_result` event and instead sends OTA'd module info as a payload in UpdateDone message, or as an ACK to UpdateDone.
Restores public server key and server address if missing
Use backup registers instead of DCT to store system flags to avoid chance of a DCT corruption.
Bootloader module dependency and integrity checks have been added to system-part2.  If they fail, the device is forced into safe mode and a new bootloader will be OTA transferred to the device.
Adds a verification and retry scheme to the bootloader flashing routine.

`[Electron]` Added CRC checking to the Electron DCD implementation so that write errors are detected. Added a critical section around flash operations and around DCD operations to make them thread safe.

`[Photon/P1]` New version of WICED adds CRC checking to the DCT implementation so that write errors are detected. Added a critical section around flash operations and around DCT operations to make them thread safe.
Cloud connection can be closed gracefully allowing confirmable messages to reach the cloud before the connection is terminated
Fixes possible corruption of event data in multi-threaded firmware
`[Electron]` `spark/hardware/max_binary` event was sent in error, adding 69 more bytes of data to handshake (full or session resume). Also fixes other preprocessor errors.
Sanitized `Particle.publish()` overloads.
Fixes potential memory leak and race condition issues in `RGB.onChange()` function.
Previously no null pointer checks on password argument of `WiFi.setCredentials()`.
Fixes divide by zero on incorrect parameters of `map()` function.
`WiFi.connecting()` was returning `false` while DHCP is resolving, will now remain `true`.
`[Photon/P1]` Default Wi-Fi DNS hostname changed to device ID, to avoid spaces in name which may cause issues.
`[Core]` Interrupts were disabled by default.
Makes `System.sleep(mode, seconds)` a synchronous operation in multithreaded firmware. This ensures the device is in a well-defined state before entering sleep mode.
Fixes Particle Publish flag implicit conversion issue. e.g. `Particle.publish("event", "data", NO_ACK);` was previously changing event's TTL instead disabling acknowledgement of the event)
Fixes LED indication when network credentials are cleared by holding the SETUP button for >10 seconds.
TCP Firmware will not ACK every chunk in Fast OTA mode now.
`[Electron]` `Wire1` was not working correctly.
Renamed `system_error` enum to `system_error_t` to avoid conflicts with `std::system_error` class.
Improves stability of TCP server implementation: 1) Update server's list of clients on a client destruction (thanks @tlangmo!), 2) TCPClient now closes underlying socket on destruction.

Previously, when entering Sleep-stop mode: `System.sleep(D1, RISING, 60);` while in the process of making a Wi-Fi connection resulted in some parts of the radio still being initialized, consuming about 10-15mA more than normal.
Fixes an issue with Serial when receiving consecutive multiple 64-byte transmissions from Host
Fixed system attempting to enter listening mode every 1ms when the SETUP button is pressed.
Fixes a stack overlap with system-part2 static RAM on Photon/P1
Fixes a memory leak when Thread is terminated
Fixes a deadlock in SoftAP, when connection is terminated prematurely
`[Electron]` Fixes the monolithic build
Compilation fixes for GCC platform
USB vendor requests should be executed on system thread instead of being processed in ISR.
Do not read or write feature flags from an ISR

Fixes a error when `<algorithm>` has already been included before the `math.h` header. Now we only include `math.h` when Arduino compatibility is requested. (math.h was not included in 0.6.0).

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1184) [Electron] moved cellular HAL and its direct dependencies from module 2 to module 3 to free up space (this is system-part3 was reduced in size, while system-part1 was increased)
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1167) [[Fixes #1036]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1036) [GCC Virtual Device] workaround for 100% CPU usage problem.
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1146) [[Closes #1040]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1040) Added asserts for checking that network calls are run on system thread.
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1134) [GCC Virtual Device] Error in socket_hal's socket_receive() logic caused random cloud connection errors.
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1225) [Photon/P1/Electron] Added support for custom LED colors in bootloader v11 (Safe Mode, DFU Mode, Firmware Reset).

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1227) [[Implements #961]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/961) [Electron] Added new API for hostname IP address lookup `IPAddress ip = Cellular.resolve(hostname)`
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1216) Improved Arduino Compatibility (now supported by default, added PARTICLE_NO_ARDUINO_COMPATIBILITY=y command line option for disabling)
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1217) Added Windows, Mac command, & Unix/Linux meta USB keyboard scancode definitions.
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1224) Allow the compiler to garbage collect USBKeyboard and USBMouse implementations if they are not used in user code, saving flash space.
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1225) [Photon/P1/Electron] Combined `LEDStatus` and `LEDCustomStatus` into a single class -> `LEDStatus`

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1221) [[Fixes #1220]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1220) [Electron] TIM8 PWM pins (B0, B1) did not work correctly in bootloader with `RGB.mirrorTo()`
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1222) Fixed bug in `String(const char* str, int len)` constructor when the string is longer than the specified length.
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1225) [Photon/P1/Electron] Fixed LED indication shown during device key generation (blinking white) introduced in 0.6.1-rc.1

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1226) [[Fixes #1181]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1181) [Photon/P1/Core] Process TCP `DESCRIBE` properly and return only one response, SYSTEM, APPLICATION, or COMBINED (ALL) describe message.  Was sending separate SYSTEM and APPLICATION previously.
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1230) Safe Mode event was being published unconditionally introduced in 0.6.1-rc.1
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1231) [Electron] fixes double newline parser issue on G350 introduced in 428835a 0.6.1-rc.1

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1190) [[Implements #1114]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1114) Added ability to mirror MODE/SETUP button to any GPIO, available from time of boot, active high or low.

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1182) [[Fixes #687]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/687) [[Docs]](https://prerelease-docs.particle.io/reference/firmware/electron/#setlistentimeout-) Added `WiFi.set|getListenTimeout()` | `Cellular.set|getListenTimeout()` to override the automatic new Listening Mode timeout (Wi-Fi = no timeout by default, Cellular = 5 minute timeout by default).

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1154) Added `low_battery` system event, which is generated when low battery condition is detected. This is when the battery falls below the SoC threshold (default 10%, max settable 32%).  The event can only be generated again if the system goes from a non-charging to charing state after the event is generated. The event doesn't carry any data.
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1144) Added tracking of ACKs for published events (see `WITH_ACK` flag for `Particle.publish()`)

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1135) [[Fixes #1116]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1116) [[Fixes #965]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/965) New Time API's! `Time.isValid()` | `Particle.syncTimePending()` | `Particle.syncTimeDone()` | `Particle.timeSyncedLast()`

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1127) [[PR #1213]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1213) Added support for runtime logging configuration, which allows to enable logging on already running system via USB control requests. Disabled by default to save flash memory space. (note: this feature is not fully baked with tool support)
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1120) [Implements #1059](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1059) [P1] Added extra spare pin to P1 (P1S6) with GPIO and PWM support.

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1204) [[Implements #1113]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1113) RGB LED pins can be mirrored to other PWM capable pins via `RGB.mirrorTo()`. Common Anode/Cathode LED and Bootloader compatible. See PR for usage.

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1205) [[Closes #569]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/569) [[Closes #976]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/976) [[Closes #1111]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1111) By implementing a centralized LED service and theme "engine" for system LED signaling, giving users the ability to apply custom LED colors and patterns for system events.
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1191) Added more Arduino Library compatibility
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1188) [[Implements #1152]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1152) Added SPI API's: `SPISettings` | `SPI.beginTransaction()` | `SPI.endTransaction()`
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1169) Updated system communication logging with new logging API

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1160) [Electron] Modem USART paused via HW_FLOW_CONTROL (RTS) before going into sleep with SLEEP_NETWORK_STANDBY. Receives and buffers small messages while system sleeping.

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1159) [[Closes #1085]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1085) [[Closes #1054]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1054) Added support for GCC 5.4.x
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1151) [[Closes #977]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/977) Added System events for cloud/network connection state changes

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1122) Attach to host even if Serial, USBSerial1 and Keyboard/Mouse are disabled, so that "Control Interface" that receives vendor requests is still accessible.

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1097) [[Implements #1032]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1032) When flashing (OTA/YModem) an invalid firmware binary (that the device ignores) it will post an event describing why the binary was not applied.

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1203) [[PR #1212]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1212) Automatic bootloader updates have returned to the Electron.  v9 bootloader has been added to firmware release >=0.6.1-rc.1 for Photon/P1/Electron.  After updating your system firmware, a new v9 bootloader will be applied to your device if required.  v9 includes support for SETUP/MODE button and RGB LED mirroring at the bootloader level of operation.  Also included are updates to USB DFU mode so that Windows users do not need to install separate drivers via Zadig.  Bootloader GREEN and WHITE LED flashing speeds (Firmware Reset modes) are faster now as well (you won't see these unless you have loaded user firmware to the Backup location).
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1125) Breaks on-going network connection when Sleep stop mode is called, thereby speeding up the time to entering sleep when using SYSTEM_THREAD(ENABLED).
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1186) Fixed issue where USB `Serial` might deadlock when interrupts are disabled while using `DEBUG_BUILD=y`

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1179) [[Fixes #1178]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1178) [[Fixes #1060]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1160) [Electron] Bootloader build was failing, fixed and added to CI.

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1158) [[Fixes #1133]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1133) [Electron] Before sleeping, now waits for server sent confirmable messages to be acknowledged, in addition to previous behavior of device generated confirmable messages being acknowledged.  Reduces data usage.
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1156) [[Fixes #1155]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1156) System.sleep(30) wasn't reapplying power to the network device after set time.
](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1147) [Electron] Fixed approx. -0.1V offset on FuelGauge().getVCell() readings

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1145) [[Fixes #973]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/973) `Particle.connect()` now blocks `loop()` from running until `Particle.connected()` is `true` in single threaded SEMI_AUTOMATIC mode.

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1140) [[Fixes #1138]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1138) [[Fixes #1104]](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1104) [Electron] Fixed modem USART and buffer handling

](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1130) Particle.subscribe() used with same events but changing scope between PUBLIC and PRIVATE or vice versa would potentially result in non-registered subscriptions.  This was also crashing the GCC virtual device with a segfault when subscription checksums were calculated.

Disabling multiple USB configurations (normal/high power) as this breaks composite driver on Windows. Fixes [#1089](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1089) Serial and USBSerial1 not working at same time on Windows 8.1 Pro.
Do not run the event loop from delay() when threading is enabled. Fixes [#1055](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1055)
Cancel current connection attempt before entering the listening mode with WiFi.listen(true) and also WiFi.off(). Fixes [#1013](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1013)

Free memory allocated for previous system interrupt handler  fixes [#927](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/927)
Fixes to I2C Slave mode implementation with clock stretching enabled

availableForWrite() was reporting bytes available instead of bytes available for write  and [#1017](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/1017)

USART 9-bit receiving. [#968](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/968)

DFU errors writing to flash silently ignored.
heap allocation not thread-safe. [#826](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/826)

Application thread continues to run in listening mode
`Particle.process()` called from the application thread pumps application messages [#659](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/659)
`Particle.variable()` supports `String`s [#657](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/657)

Simplified [Particle.variable()](https://docs.particle.io/reference/firmware/photon/#variables) API - variable type parameter is optional, and variables are passed by reference so  `&`'s are not required.

I2C will generate STOP and SW Reset immediately if Slave Acknowledge failure is detected (must use pull-up resistors), instead of taking 100ms. [commit](https://github.com/spark/firmware/commit/893aa523990752a2afcda4ffa5bba3f66e047014)
TCPClient unstable [#672](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/672)
Photon frequently SOS's immediately following cloud re-connect [#663](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/663)
`String.toLower()` has no affect on string. [#665](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/665)
SOS due to WICED socket handlers being called when socket is disposed. [#663](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/663) [#672](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/672)
Application constructors executed after RTOS startup so that HAL_Delay_Milliseconds() can be called. This may mean that `STARTUP()` code executes just a little later than before, but
Ensure bootloader region is write protected.
White breathing LED on exiting listening mode. [#682](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/682)
WICED not resolving DNS names with 4 parts (it was trying to decode as an IP address.)
SoftAP via HTTP would fail on Safari due to request sent as multiple TCP packets. Fixed WICED HTTP server.  [#680](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/680)
Retained variables are not persisting, even without reset or deep sleep. [#661](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/661)
Backup RAM enabled for monolithic builds [#667](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/667)
Pure virtual call on creation of low priority std::thread [#652](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/652)

v0.4.6.1.name: 0.4.6 Firmware Release for Core, Photon and P1

entries.text: separate [System Thread](https://docs.particle.io/reference/firmware/photon/#system-thread)
Hooks to support FreeRTOS (optional library)
Variables stored in [Backup RAM](https://docs.particle.io/reference/firmware/photon/#backup-ram)
(https://docs.particle.io/reference/firmware/core/#printf-) on `Print` classes - `Serial`, `Serial1`, `TCP`, `UDP`
`String.format` for `printf`-style formatting to a `String`.
(https://docs.particle.io/reference/firmware/photon/#end-) to release the I2C pins. [#597](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/597)
(https://docs.particle.io/reference/firmware/photon/#reset-) to reset the I2C bus. Thanks @pomplesiegel [#598](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/598)
(https://docs.particle.io/reference/firmware/core/#system-cycle-counter) to retrieve the current MCU cycle counter for precise timing.
(https://docs.particle.io/reference/firmware/core/#system-entersafemode-) to restart the device in safe mode.
`WiFi.selectAntenna()` setting is persistent, so the last selected antenna is used when the
Detect when the cloud hasn't been serviced for 15s and disconnect, so device LED state accurately
Compile-time checks for `Particle.variable()` [#619](https://github.com/spark/firmwarwe/issues/619)
Increased retry count when connecting to WiFi. [#620](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/620)
Setup button events
`UDP.receivePacket()` would fail if `UDP.setBuffer()` hadn't been called first. Thanks @r2jitu.
Default SS pin for SPI1 now set to D5. [#623](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/623)
Long delay entering listening mode. [#566](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/566)
Solid green LED when WiFi network cannot be connected to due to invalid key. (The LED now blinks.)
Storing more than 2 Wi-Fi credentials would sometimes give unpredictable results.
TX/RX pins did not work after entering listening mode. [#632](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/632)
Improvements to I2C for MCP23017 / Adafruit RGBLCDShield.
Incorrect wakeup time set for sleep. [#653](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/653)
`SPI.setClockDividerReference`, `SPI.setClockSpeed` to set clock speed in a more portable manner. [#454](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/454)
`WiFi.scan` function to retrieve details of local access points.
`UDP.sendPacket`/`UDP.receivePacket` to send/receive a packet directly to an application-supplied buffer.
Static IP Support [photon] -
UDP multicast support via `UDP.joinMulticast`/`UDP.leaveMulticast`. Many thanks @stevie67!
`waitFor(WiFi.ready)` syntax to make it easier to wait for system events. [#415](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/415)
Flexible time output with `Time.format()` [#572](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/572)
(docs/build.md#recipes-and-tips) section in the build documentation.
`Particle.function`, `Particle.subscribe` and `attachInterrupt` can take a C++ method and instance pointer.  Thanks to @monkbroc!
`UDP.setBuffer` to set the buffer a UDP instance uses for `read`/`write`.  and
`WiFi.setCredentials()` can take a Cipher type to allow full specification of an AP's credentials.
TCPClient (from TCPServer) reports remote IP address.
Configurable format in `Time.timeStr()`, including ISO 8601. [#455](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/455)
`Servo.trim(adjust)` to allow small adjustments to the stationary point. [#120](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/120)
Time set from the cloud accounts for network latency. [#581](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/581)
`String(Printable)` constructor so any `Printable` can be converted to a string. [example](https://community.particle.io/t/convert-ipaddress-to-string-for-use-with-spark-publish/14885/4?u=mdma)
Fluent API on `String` - many methods return `*this` so method calls can be chained.
Small values passed to `delay(1)` result in more accurate delays. [#260](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/260)
Bootloader does not show factory reset modes if a factory reset image is not available. [#557](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/557)
Listening mode re-enters listening mode after credentials are given.
String function dtoa() has problems with larger numbers.
System doesn't set color of RGB LED when `RGB.control(true)` is called. ,  and
WiFi.SSID() may not return previous network when switching.
System.sleep(5) not turning Wi-Fi back on after 5 seconds.
regression: floating point support in sprintf not compiled in. [#576](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/576)
SPI1 default clock speed was 7.5MHz, changed to 15MHz, same as for `SPI`.
TCPClient::connected() doesn't detect when the socket is closed [#542](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/542)
dfu-util: error during downlod get_status msg removed when using :leave option [#599](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/599)
A0 could not be used as an output [#595](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/595)
Reinstate CFOD handling on the Photon.
logging output [documentation](docs/debugging.md)
pressing 'v' in SoftAP mode displays the system version. FIRM-128
P1: API (compatible with Core) to access the 1MByte external flash.
Arduino compatibility macros for PROGMEM and more.
`RGB.onChange` handler receives notification of the current LED color when it changes. Can be used to match an external LED to the onboard led.  Thanks to @monkbroc!
Serial2 available on P1 and Photon (note: this also requires above RGB.onChange handler and two resistors would need to be removed on the Photon)
`Spark.connected()` et al. is now `Particle.connected()`. The former `Spark` library is still available but is deprecated.
`System.freeMemory()` API to determine the amount of available RAM.
`STARTUP()` macro to define blocks of code that execute at startup.
Retrieve the LED brightness via `RGB.brightness()`
More prominent color change on the RGB LED when there is a cloud connection error.
System.sleep() - 2nd parameter changed to `InterruptMode` from uint16_t to
Less aggressive exponential backoff when the re-establishing the cloud connection. [FIRM-177]
I2C Wire.endTransmission() returns unique values and [I2C docs updated](https://docs.particle.io/reference/firmware/photon/#endtransmission-)
Generate I2C STOP after slave addr NACK, I2C software reset all timeouts -  [commit](https://github.com/spark/firmware/commit/53914d809cc17a3802b879fbb4fddcaa7d264680)

Improved I2C Master receive method and implemented error handler - [commit](https://github.com/spark/firmware/commit/1bc00ea480ef1fcdbd8ef9ba3df12b121183aeae) -  [commit](https://github.com/spark/firmware/commit/5359f19985756182ff6511217cbcb588b3341a87)
`WiFi.selectAntenna()` default antenna is now INTERNAL. Can be called at startup (before WiFi is initialized to select the desired antenna.
System connects WiFi when Spark.connect() is called after WiFi.on() [#484](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/484)
(https://github.com/spark/firmware/blob/develop/docs/debugging.md) now working.
PWM issue fixed - 500Hz output on all channels [#492](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/492)
Tone issue fixed on D2,D3,RX,TX [#483](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/483)
SOS when registering more than 2 subscription handlers, and allow 4 subscription handlers to be successfully registered. [#531](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/531)
SOS on TCPClient.connect() when DNS resolution failed or when connection fails [#490](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/490)
`TCPClient::stop()` does not work on first connection [#536](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/536)
`TCPClient::connect()` does not close an existing socket. [#538](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/538)
TX/RX PWM randomly inverted [#545](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/545)
UDP.begin/write return values [#552](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/552)
Half-duplex mode on Serial1 via `Serial1.halfdupliex()`. Thanks to @prices.
`WiFi.connect(WIFI_CONNECT_SKIP_LISTEN)` allows application firmware to skip listen mode when there is no credentials.
System events
I2C methods now use `micros()` for timeouts rather than `millis()`, so I2C functions can be used in an interrupt handler. [#460](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/460)
`WiFi.listen(false)` to programmatically exit WiFi listening mode.
make is verbose by default. To silence, add `-s` to the command line.
`WiFi.connect(WIFI_CONNECT_SKIP_LISTEN)` starts connection but does not enter listening mode if no credentials are found.
Setup/Mode button now starts listening mode when WiFi is off.
`WiFi.listen(false)` can be used to exit listening mode (from an interrupt.)
LED flashes high-speed green when requesting an IP address via DHCP.
- `TCPClient.connected()` was not returning `false` when the socket was asynchronously disconnected.

Fix time being reset on wakeup. (removed WICED RTC init code that resets to default preset time in platform_mcu_powersave_init() within photon-wiced repo.) [#440](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/440)
`TCPClient.connected()` was not returning `false` when the socket was disconnected from the other end.
`strdup()` was returning garbage [#457](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/457)

`attachInterrupt()` should work on all interrupt pins now except D0 & A5. Please note there are shared lines as per the following issue comment : [#443](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/443#issuecomment-114389744)
I2C bus lockup when no slave devices are present by issuing a STOP condition after sLave send address fails.
`spark/` events not propagated to application handlers. [#481](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/481)
`sprintf` calls not linking correctly. [#471](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/471)
Photon/P1 sometimes did not start without hitting reset after a cold boot.
Disable LTO compile for user firmware since it causes linking problems (see `sprintf` above.)

unlocker-p1.bin - For the P1 PLATFORM ONLY! (For photon, see the 0.4.1 release.) This is used to remove write protect bits on flash pages so devices can be returned to factory condition and updated using JTAG. This is not necessary when using DFU to update system firmware.  To apply, download the file then run `dfu-util -d 2b04:d008 -a 0 -s 0x8020000:leave -D unlocker-p1.bin`. The unlocking happens automatically - the LED will be yellow during unlocking, then green when unlocking is complete.
EEPROM storage of custom data types via `EEPROM.put()` and `EEPROM.get()'
When the device is in safe mode, the LED breathes magenta
`attachSystemInterrupt()` allows hooking key system interrupts in user code.
(https://github.com/spark/docs/pull/49)
`UDP.sendPacket()` method avoids buffering data when the user can supply the entire buffer at once.
SoftAP setup can be done over HTTP
platform-neutral fast pin access
Serial2 support
The system firmware updates the bootloader to latest version
The system write protects the bootloader region.
UDP uses dynamically allocated buffers
`PRODUCT_ID` and `PRODUCT_VERSION` place these details at a known place in the firmware image
DFU mode and serial firmware update can be triggered by setting the line rate.
`Serial1.end()` [hangs the system](https://community.particle.io/t/changing-serial-baud-rate-inside-setup-code-causes-core-freezing-afterwards/10314/6)
Malformed CoAP acknowledgement message in cloud protocol.
`SPARK_WLAN_Loop()` was not linked. (Workaround was to use `Spark.process()`)
UDP doesn't send anything to the device until `UDP.write()` [#407](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/407)
Divide by zero now caught and causes a SOS.
Floating-point support for `sprintf()` reinstated
Fixed WICED DCT becoming unmodifiable
Fix UDP.parsePacket() not receiving any data on the Photon [#468](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/468)

Local Build: Specify custom toolchain with `GCC_PREFIX` environment variable ([firmware](https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/328), [core-common-lib](https://github.com/spark/core-common-lib/pull/39), [core-communication-lib](https://github.com/spark/core-communication-lib/pull/29))
Wiring: More efficient and reliable `print(String)` (fix issue [#281](https://github.com/spark/firmware/issues/281))
DFU: Add DFU suffix to .bin file
I2C: Use I2C polling mode by default
Listening Mode: Fix hard fault when Wi-Fi is off
LED Interaction: Fix breathing blue that should be blinking green
Cloud: [Secure random seed](https://github.com/spark/core-communication-lib/pull/25). When the spark does a handshake with the cloud, it receives a random number that is set as a seed for `rand()`
Wiring: Arduino-compatible `random()` and `randomSeed()` functions. [#289](https://github.com/spark/core-firmware/pull/289)
Wiring: Arduino-compatible functions like `isALpha()` and `toLowerCase()`. [#293](https://github.com/spark/core-firmware/pull/293)
Wire: added missing Slave mode using DMA/Interrupts and updated Master mode using DMA. New APIs `Wire.setSpeed()` and `Wire.strechClock()`. [#284](https://github.com/spark/core-firmware/issues/284)
Sleep: `Spark.sleep()` supports wakeup on pin change. [#265](https://github.com/spark/core-firmware/issues/265)
RGB: calling `RGB.brightness()` doesn't change the LED brightness immediately [#261](https://github.com/spark/core-firmware/issues/261)
Wiring: `pinMode()` `INPUT` and `OUTPUT` constants had reversed values compared to Arduino. [#282](https://github.com/spark/core-firmware/issues/282)
Wiring: compiler error using `HEX` with `String`. [#210](https://github.com/spark/core-firmware/pull/210)
System Mode: MANUAL mode breaks OTA udpate [#294](https://github.com/spark/core-firmware/issues/294)
New feature: `Spark.subscribe()` :+1:
Time now set by the Cloud when Core handshakes
(https://github.com/spark/core-firmware/pull/176)

1300.detail: There have been a number of community reports of devices losing their Public Server Key and/or Server Address.  Typically this is due to a power loss or reset during a critical flash write operation.

1307.title: Change DCT read access to lock()/unlock() or read-with-copy
1307.detail:
When using `dct_read_app_data` the returned pointer might become invalid in case a different thread writes into DCT causing a DCT swap.

Photon/P1 should have a critical section around flash operations and around DCT operations.

1309.detail: Core crashes when I2C is configured in slave mode.

1310.detail: math.h was being included, plus a check for isnan being a defined symbol. This will fail if `<algrithm>` has already been included before the header.

1311.title: Support for Twilio SIMs by default in system firmware [ch1537]

1313.detail: Compilation of the firmware currently fails on Mac OS.

1315.detail:
This PR fixes a regression introduced into current `develop` by https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1236, which allowed `Particle.publish()` flags to be converted to `int` implicitly.

@technobly, thanks for finding out this!

1316.title: Fix LED indication when clearing network credentials
1316.detail:
The LED doesn't blink rapidly when clearing network credentials.

_Note:_ This regression doesn't present in any of the releases, so there's no need to update the change log.

1317.title: Changed branch to checkout from 'latest' to 'release/stable'
1317.detail: Documentation still points at using the 'latest' branch which no longer exists.

1321.title: Fix misleading indent making PLATFORM_ID=3 fail

1323.title: Process USB vendor requests in system thread
1323.detail: Most of the currently supported vendor requests should be executed on system thread instead of being processed in ISR.

1324.title: Verify the bootloader was flashed correctly and retry if not
1324.detail: As a safety measure we should verify that when updating bootloader OTA or over YModem the copy operation from ota_module area to the bootloader area has succeeded and the bootloader image in bootloader_module area passes the checks. If not, there is nothing we can do but retry until it does.

1325.title: Minimize DCT usage in bootloader
1325.detail:
- Bootloader doesn't fit into its flash region on P1 with the newer WICED.
- Bootloader unnecessarily stores and updates system flags in DCT, potentially increasing chance of a DCT corruption.

1326.title: Rename system_error to system_error_t
1326.detail: C++11 defines `std::system_error` class which may cause global name conflicts with the firmware's `system_error` enum, especially in applications that abuse `using namespace std`.

1329.detail: As a safety measure we should verify that when updating bootloader OTA or over YModem the copy operation from ota_module area to the bootloader area has succeeded and the bootloader image in bootloader_module area passes the checks. If not, there is nothing we can do but retry until it does.

1330.detail:
Hypothesised write errors in flash that appear only after power cycle can corrupt the configuration data.
Flash access is not thread-safe.

1332.title: Updates recommended stable branch in compile error

1335.title: Fixes WPA supplicant cancellation
1335.detail: Connection attempt to WPA Enterprise access point isn't properly cancelled causing an unnecessary timeout.

1336.title: [USB] Fixes an issue with Serial when receiving consecutive multiple 64-byte transmissions from Host
1336.detail: With RX queue full, the device NAKs OUT (Host->Device) transfers. With `bInterval` set to `0` (1 ms) this causes the device to spend too much time in USB interrupt, not giving any processing time to the application/system thread to consume RX queue. For some reason CDC driver on OSX doesn't attempt to send any data after about 300 NAKed transfers. Closing/re-opening the port doesn't help either.

1337.title: Listening mode fixes
1337.detail: The system attempts to enter listening mode every 1ms when the SETUP button is pressed.

1338.title: Do not read or write feature flags from an ISR
1338.detail: Device panic (assertion failure) occurs when DFU mode is triggered via baud rate change.

1340.title: Fixes monolithic builds
1340.detail:
Fixes monolithic builds on:
- Electron (mainly broken by https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1184) Fixes #1339
- Photon (broken in `feature/photon/wiced-3.7.0-7` branch due to WICED upgrade and an oversight)

1342.title: Remove the firmware docs from the repo

1343.title: Fix endless IWDG reset loop
1343.detail: In order to minimize usage of the DCT in the bootloader, the firmware now uses backup registers to store system flags (see https://github.com/spark/firmware/pull/1325). This poses a problem when firmware is downgraded from 0.7.0-rc.1: bootloader enables IWDG and sets a flag in the backup registers, but an older firmware is unable to detect that IWDG is running since it expects IWDG flag to be set in the DCT. This causes the device to reset every 5 seconds.

1346.title: [Photon/P1] Fixes thread priority issues
1346.detail:
- Closes #1344
- Another known issue related to this is connecting to enterprise access points with `SYSTEM_THREAD(ENABLED)`

1350.title: Increase maximum supported number of simultaneously active TCP connections (Photon)
1350.detail: Currently, the firmware allows up to 5 TCP connections (sockets) to be active at the same time. With one socket used by the system to communicate with the cloud, applications can establish (or accept) only 4 TCP connections.

1353.title: Release/v0.5.4
1353.detail: Sticker rig support was not present in 0.5.3 electron firmware. This is needed for the firmware to be used in manufacturing.

1354.title: [Photon] Fixes WiFi.scan() hardfault
1354.detail:
A call to `WiFi.scan()` when WiFi module is off or not ready results in a hard fault.

See #1062

1355.title: Heap usage improvements
1355.detail:
1. Photon uses too much heap when connecting to WPA Enterprise access point
2. When using WPA Enterprise access point and constantly reconnecting to it, heap gets fragmented which results in inability to connect to the access point anymore

1357.title: Feature/ch3737 6 digit serial [0.7.0-rc.2]
1357.detail: Device setup codes should be 6 digits to reduce the likelihood of collisions.

1358.title: Updates minimal ARM gcc version required to 5.3.1
1358.detail: Currently, minimum ARM gcc version is set to 4.8.4, which will fail to build firmware starting with 0.7.0.

1359.title: Fixes build with PLATFORM=gcc on OSX with clang's gcc wrapper
1359.detail: `PLATFORM=gcc` builds fail on OSX with default gcc compiler (which is actually a wrapper over clang).

1365.title: Deprecate Particle.publish() and Particle.subscribe() invoked with default event scope
1365.detail: Beginning with 0.8.0 release, `Particle.publish()` and `Particle.subscribe()` methods will require event scope to be specified explicitly. This change will potentially break a lot of existing applications.

1367.title: Use the device ID as the USB serial number for Core
1367.detail:
When connecting a Core to USB, the serial number reported is a strange number instead of the device ID. The Photon and Electron report their device ID.

```
$ lsusb -v | grep Particle -A 2
  iManufacturer           1 Particle          
  iProduct                2 Spark Core with WiFi    
  iSerial                 3 6D75569D4957
```

This is blocking the CLI from using the USB serial number to detect the device ID of any connected device.

1369.title: [CH6178] Checkpoints/diagnostics
1369.detail:
When a device hard faults, crashes, freezes or is otherwise misbehaving, it is presently difficult to know what the last action the device took is and whether the fault lies in application code, system code, peripheral code etc..

A checkpoints API would allow application and system firmware to record their current execution progress and provide an indication of where execution halted prior to the crash. This information is then published to the cloud on next successful connection.

It is also possible to get stack trace of all the threads using a naive stack unwinder, that just scans through the thread stack, looking for flash addresses (within system and user part bounds) and checks if there is a branching instruction at that location.

It would be useful to store per-thread stack traces in addition to checkpoint info whenever the device enters a hardfault, a panic state, or on demand. This will provide a better overview of the system state and help understand the cause of the crash or deadlock for difficult to reproduce issues.

1370.title: Fixes Photon monolithic builds on 0.7.0-rc.3

See #1368 

`link_heap_location` and `link_heap_location_end` definitions missing in linker file.

1396.title: Simple pool allocator
1396.detail:
Implements a simple pooled memory allocator to simplify communications between interrupt handlers and system threads.

Currently, passing data from an ISR to the system thread is complicated and requires implementing feature-specific object pools, which are not always helpful (for example, when it is necessary to pass some data to the system thread from an ISR and forget about it) and have code size implications.

Having a small general purpose memory pool supporting typical malloc/free operations in the context of an ISR would be helpful.

1402.detail: As a firmware developer I often need to split a string on a delimiter like when I receive an event I subscribed to. Splitting a String is not documented in our firmware docs and using the C function `strtok` is difficult because it modifies the actual string.

1454.detail: Despite introduction of #1295, Electrons sometimes still end up corrupting their DCD data (mainly keys).

1456.title: Firmware update and access to internal flash via USB requests
1456.detail:
This PR is based on [feature/usb-requests](https://github.com/particle-iot/firmware/tree/feature/usb-requests) and introduces the following changes:

* The firmware now can be updated via USB requests (see `START_FIRMWARE_UPDATE`, `FINISH_FIRMWARE_UPDATE`, `CANCEL_FIRMWARE_UPDATE` and `FIRMWARE_UPDATE_DATA` requests specifically).

* The system now exposes its internal storage (firmware modules, factory backup, DCT and EEPROM) in a self-descriptive manner via `DESCRIBE_STORAGE`, `READ_SECTION_DATA`, `WRITE_SECTION_DATA` and `CLEAR_SECTION_DATA` requests.

* `system_ctrl_set_result()` now accepts an optional completion callback making it possible for the system to, for example, reset the device only after a reply to the host is sent completely. This helps to avoid USB errors at the client side.

* `system_ctrl_alloc_reply_data()` now acts as `realloc()` and, consequently, `system_ctrl_free_reply_data()` has been removed.

* The `LISTENING_MODE` request has been split into two requests: `START_LISTENING` and `STOP_LISTENING`.

* Protocol files have been moved to a git submodule ([firmware-protobuf](https://github.com/particle-iot/firmware-protobuf)). The firmware repo still contains the protocol files in a precompiled form, so, normally, there's no need for our users or CI to perform any additional steps in order to build the firmware.

1460.title: SoftAP: HTTP url query string fix
1460.detail:
See original issue #1458.

The regression was introduced during WICED upgrade to version 3.7.0-7 (0.7.0-rc.1 release). HTTP server implementation in 3.7.0-7 passes URL query string separately from the path to the request handler.

1462.title: Fixes GCC virtual device running with UDP protocol
1462.detail:
There are two issues that prevent GCC virtual device to successfully connect to the cloud with UDP:
1. (main) The UDP socket is being bound to a multicast address 224.0.0.251, instead of 0.0.0.0 or some interface address
2. Cloud sockets use the same source UDP port, which prevents from running several virtual devices on the same host.

1463.title: Fix usage of an incorrect prerequisite name in program-* targets
1463.detail: This PR fixes an issue introduced by 9aa4b8ff358b472f7a3308f26268a73f7fe88299, which causes GNU make to fail when invoked with such targets as `program-dfu`, `program-ocd`, etc.

1464.title: [Electron] connect_cancel() fix
1464.detail: Only the first `CellularNetworkInterface::connect_cancel()` call succeeds, subsequent calls do not cancel running connection attempt due to the fact that `connect_cancelled` flag is never cleared.

1465.title: Serialize access to the CRC peripheral (STM32F2xx)
1465.detail:
The CRC peripheral is not thread-safe and thus concurrent hardware-accelerated CRC calculations should be serialized. 

While there's no evidence that the system and application threads perform CRC calculations concurrently, a synthetic test shows that such a situation can cause invalidation of the DCT.

1. Cellular band select tests should be performed while deregistered from the network, otherwise current RAT affects a selection of bands available. See *7.22 Select band +UBANDSEL* documentation from u-blox Cellular Modules - AT Commands Manual:

```
TOBY-L2 / MPCI-L2 / LARA-R2 / TOBY-R2 / SARA-U2 / LISA-U2 / LISA-U1
The list of supported bands presents exclusively GSM, UMTS or LTE bands depending on which RAT the
MT is currently registered. If it is not registered, the bands presented depend on +URAT command:
• If in single mode, depends on <AcT>

```

1485.title: Photon/P1: TCPClient: non-blocking, blocking, blocking with timeout writes support
1485.detail:
Unlike `TCPClient::read()`, `TCPClient::write()` is a blocking call and whenever TCP send queue gets completely filled (see #1461 for a particular case on Photon/P1 with low wifi signal), the application thread may be blocked for an indefinite amount of time.

There needs to be a way to specify the maximum amount of time the write should take.

1492.title: Photon/P1: A number of networking-related fixes
1492.detail:
1. WICED makes a write to DCT while DCT is locked for reading causing an assertion failure (particle-iot/photon-wiced#27)
2. There is a race condition between HAL and WICED in DHCP handling: DHCP may be started non-synchronously under certain conditions (and we assume that it's synchronous in wlan_hal)
3. There is a bug with tcp server resource cleanup in socket_hal: when `wiced_tcp_server_start()` reports an error, we do not call `wiced_tcp_server_stop()`, causing an internal tcp server list in WICED to get completely filled. As a result, we are unable to create any more tcp servers
4. There is a race condition with `SYSTEM_THREAD(ENABLED)` between `WiFi.ready()` and when the config is updated in system thread (#1371)
5. LwIP `tcp_tmr` no longer functions after network stack is reinitialized (particle-iot/photon-wiced#27)
6. `socket_close_all()` causes a hardfault due to socket destruction when it should simply be closing them and leaving the resource cleanup up to the socket 'user'
7. `Pinger` is not functioning properly, hence #1479

1530.title: [Electron] Fixes missing URCs for received data during TX or RX socket operations
1530.detail:
We've been getting reports of times when devices seem to stop being able to receive data.  They seem to recover after the device exhausts its retries (about 78 seconds) and reconnects to the Cloud.  This has been a tricky bug to nail down, but it appears to be a corner case in how the cellular modem reports URCs, or in this case, doesn't report them.

The error condition occurs with the following sequence.  We start with the RX buffer is empty.  We receive some data, and the modem notifies us of this pending data via URC (Unsolicited Response Code). When we go to read that data from the modem, if we received more data concurrently, no further URC is generated after the data is received, or after the read completes.  The error case can occur during a write operation as well (receiving data while we are sending data).  We normally rely on URCs to allow us to receive status from the modem asynchronously and avoid polling it for status, which allows it to enter low power mode as well.

1531.title: Wait for Wiring Thread to start (backport)

1532.title: Add support for SARA-R410 to the Cellular HAL
1532.detail:
This PR adds support for U-blox SARA-R410 modules to the Cellular HAL.

The major difference between SARA-U2/G3 and SARA-R4 modules is the network registration process: in case of SARA-R4 the module automatically establishes a PSD (Packed Switched Data) connection as part of the network registration process, so there's no need to activate a PDP context/EPS bearer explicitly. Cellular HAL has been refactored accordingly (and in a backward-compatible way) in order to support different network registration flows.

Additionally, SARA-R4 doesn't currently support the RTS/CTS flow control and this poses a problem for the runtime modem type detection, since we first need to initialize UART without any flow control enabled, detect the modem type and then reinitialize UART if it appears that the modem does support the hardware flow control. Due to that, in my tests the modem (SARA-U270) or the AT command parser sometimes get into a weird unresponsive state (typically after a system reset), which gets resolved only after an automatic modem reset performed by the `MDMParser`. I can see a similar problem when I run current `develop` with hardware flow control disabled (i.e. with `USE_USART3_HARDWARE_FLOW_CONTROL_RTS_CTS` set to 0). I'd like to invite everyone to try to debug this problem. One workaround, as suggested by Andrey, is to store the modem type in a backup register to avoid repeated initialization of the UART after a system reset.

This PR also adds a custom DNS client implementation based on LwIP, which is used specifically for SARA-R4 since the latter doesn't support DNS lookup commands.

1558.title: [LTE/Electron] Fast OTA Fixes [ch16346]
1558.detail:
- Fast OTA on the E Series LTE v0.8.0-rc.8 is disabled pending a Cat-M1 rate limit investigation.  Chunks would hang at index 48 out of 49, and usually be missing most of the 0-48.
- Devices were resetting before sending the UpdateDone ACK to the server, leaving it in a limbo OTA process state for 16 minutes.  During this 16 minutes, the device APIs were blocked (no function calls, etc..)
- Event loop error = 3 (INVALID_STATE) when working around the reset too soon issue with a "Delay 5 seconds before resetting after OTA update" fix.

1567.detail: eDRX is enabled by default on production u-Blox modules, and it causes a variable lag in the network data transmissions that we do not account for at this time.

1576.title: [LTE] adds 1 retry for UDP/TCP socket send in case of error [ch18789]
1576.detail:
LTE socket send AT commands in Binary mode are being interrupted with data being received, which causes the send to error.  This subsequently causes a handshake error immediately.  This has been identified as an issue with the u-blox SARA-R410M-02B at this time only and does not seem to affect SARA-U260/U270/G350 modems.


```
socketSendTo(0,86.75.309.42,5684,,91)
  1545.444 AT send      36 "AT+USOST=0,\"86.75.309.42\",5684,91\r\n"
  1545.460 AT read  >    3 "\r\n@"
  1545.510 AT send      91 "\x16\xfe\xfd\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x04\x00N\x10\x00\x00B\x00\x03\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00BA\x04\x03t\xe4\xe5?U\xce^.\x80M\xf5\x87\x05\xebI\x92\xafN3\a\xab^,\xe2\xd2\x80E\x18\xf5\xc3\xee\n\xb5{\xb4,Q\x01\xf9\xfd\xc2\x10\xcaZ\x91\xf0+2{\xba5\xcc,F}\x13#\xf0\xa54\ny\xa2"
  1545.550 AT read ERR   9 "\r\nERROR\r\n"
mbedtls/library/ssl_tls.c:2971: mbedtls_ssl_flush_output() returned -1 (-0x0001)
mbedtls/library/ssl_cli.c:3115: mbedtls_ssl_write_record() returned -1 (-0x0001)
0001545565 [comm.dtls] ERROR: handshake failed -1
```

1577.title: Fixes recursive semaphore lock timeout [ch21928]
1577.detail: If the system thread or application thread gets stuck attempting to dynamically allocation memory, and the opposing thread subsequently also attempts to allocate memory, the recursive semaphore will deadlock.  This recursive semaphore does have a timeout, but was set to approximately 1193 hours, so basically it would be stalled forever.

1578.title: Do not check and lock bootloader sector write protection on every boot [ch17416]
1578.detail: Checking and locking the bootloader sector write protection (if needed) on every boot could be contributing to flash memory corruption, although no testing has shown this to occur. It has only occurred naturally in the wild.  See references.

1580.title: Fix WiFi credentials clear event not being fired

1581.title: [Electron/LTE] Power Manager Watchdog Timer Fix
1581.detail:
Modem on Electron/LTE turn off unexpectedly during initialization when powered from a USB Host only (no battery).

After an investigation it was discovered that the PMIC watchdog causes current limit to drop to 100mA temporarily which causes the modem to stop responding to AT commands.

- Sets default hostname to deviceId on Ethernet and WiFi interfaces
- Enables LwIP `LWIP_NETIF_HOSTNAME` option

1596.title: [Mesh] Fixes a conflict between DHCPv4 and ND6 DNS server list
1596.detail: Despite the fact that we currently don't support IPv6 on non-mesh interfaces, our network stack still processes incoming ND6 (RFC4861) messages. When receiving RA, ND6 code will blindly overwrite DNS servers previously set by DHCPv4.

1598.title: system event on isr
1598.detail:
The malloc implementation in release 0.8.0-rc.11 includes an explicit check to ensure malloc is not called from an ISR. 

The button events are sometimes handled from an ISR, and consequently when the system event is marshaled to the application thread (using malloc) the assertion fails and the system enters a SOS.

1599.title: _CONST was dropped in Newlib 3.0.0
1599.detail: If eventually the firmware is built with Newlib 3.0.0, then without this change there's an `error: unknown type name '_CONST'` because `_CONST` was [dropped in Newlib 3.0.0](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=newlib-cygwin.git;a=commit;h=0bda30e1ffd23488aa4a9b73f228089463fbee1a).

1601.title: implements `make includes` to generate a list of include directories.
1601.detail: Tools need to know the include directories and source files for system and application firmware.

1604.title: Escape special characters in SSIDs and passwords when sending them to ESP32
1604.detail: Argon fails to connect to a WiFi network if the network's password contains special characters (`,`, `"`, `\`).

1606.title: Feature/hal/nfc
1606.detail:
Implement NFC Type 2 HAL driver

_NOTE: This PR changed the timer used by USART, because NFC uses timer 4. Now we use timer 1 in USART driver._

1607.title: Release timer 2, use systick to calculate debounce time
1607.detail: Button driver occupied a high precision to calculate debounce time,  it is wasteful, we can use systick handler to calculate debounce time.

1608.title: [NCP] Unblock parser when the muxer exits asynchronously and fixes a race condition in muxer
1608.detail:
- https://github.com/particle-iot/gsm0710muxer/pull/2
- When the muxer stops asynchronously for example due to a keepalive timeout or due to the other peer requesting to terminate the link, we should unblock the parser as well.

1609.title: [network] nat64: randomize base source port on boot
1609.detail:
There is a known issue in Device Service sometimes preventing Gen 3 devices from connecting to a different node from the same source IP and port pair (see [CH23915]). We've introduced a workaround for this in rc.25 by using ephemeral ports for connections over non-mesh network interfaces.

For connections over mesh we use a fixed source port (5684), because we don't want to easily exhaust the gateway NAT64 translation table, however after the gateway resets, first connection from within the mesh will always get 40000 source port on the outside interface after NAT64, which may or may not be the cause of the same issue we've seen on gateway devices in [CH23915].

1613.title: [boron] cellular_hal: fixes a crash with STARTUP() macros and credentials management functions

1614.title: Add a request to retrieve the module info in protobuf format
1614.detail: This PR implements a handler for [`GetModuleInfoRequest`](https://github.com/particle-iot/firmware-protobuf/blob/b4dd8ae91091151bd2f42e72143284aa57c99018/control/storage.proto#L153). The request allows retrieving the module info in protobuf format.

1617.title: Fixes user part update procedure in hybrid build
1617.detail: When flashing a user-part that depends on the newer version of system-part1, hybrid firmware will overwrite that user part with the embedded tinker due to failed dependency check (https://github.com/particle-iot/firmware/blob/mesh-develop/hal/src/nRF52840/core_hal.c#L352), preventing safe mode from triggering and as a consequence preventing safe mode healer from applying newer system-part1 to resolve the dependencies.

1618.title: Fixes an assertion failure in LwIP DHCP code when receiving an offer with > 2 DNS servers
1618.detail: Xenons with Ethernet FeatherWing and Argons go into panic state due to an assertion failure in LwIP DHCP code when receiving a DHCP OFFER with more than 2 DNS servers.

1619.title: Do not log WiFi passwords
1619.detail: The AT command parser logs all AT commands and responses, including the command that contains the WiFi password (`AT+CWJAP`). Given that we often request device logs from the users this may disclose their sensitive data.

1621.title: [nrf52840] Enables power failure comparator on boot with a registered power failure handler that resets the device
1621.detail: nRF52840 MCU can easily operate at voltage as low as 1.7V, however the external QSPI flash we are using requires at least 2.8V, thus we require some form of undervoltage protection, because several key components of the DeviceOS rely on the external flash: DCT, OpenThread settings, WiFi settings.

1622.title: Do not disable interrupts on every system loop iteration

1623.title: Do not set the sticky skip hello after handshake
1623.detail:
After OTA the device should send the HELLO message so it gets prompted to send its describe message.

Occasionally after sending the HELLO message, the cloud communications fail. After reconnecting, it does not send the HELLO message again so the version of firmware running on the device is not updated in the database.

1624.title: Do not set the sticky skip hello after handshake

1625.title: Fixes OpenThread locking
1625.detail: Compiler seems to have optimized our ugly `std::lock_guard<ThreadLock> lk(ThreadLock())` constructs and in essence we had OpenThread running in some cases without any form of locking, which caused various random crashes or deadlocks.

1626.title: Fixes Network Manager initial state after network_setup()
1626.detail: Interface state list in Network Manager is not populated until `network_connect()` call is made.

1627.title: [LTE] AT+CNUM command causing registration failure on LTE devices
1627.detail:
AT+CNUM command is used in the registration process just to log the phone number of the inserted SIM.  It has been observed that some SIMs in LTE devices have invalid characters in the phone number string that causes this command to error.  
```
40.796 AT send       9 "AT+CNUM\r\n"
40.826 AT read ERR  49 "\r\n+CME ERROR: invalid characters in dial string\r\n"
```
This prevents the registration process from completing and the device will blink green continuously.

1629.title: [OpenThread] Max transmit power setting (HAL_PLATFORM_OPENTHREAD_MAX_TX_POWER)
1629.detail: We are using the default 0dBm transmit power in OpenThread.

1632.title: Reverts OpenThread 20181204 upgrade (#1620)
1632.detail: We are seeing elevated TX errors after #1620.

1633.title: [nrf52840] hal: enables Wire1 on Argon and Xenon by defining HAL_PLATFORM_I2C2 in common platform config

1634.title: ble: sets the default MTU and data length to minimum values
1634.detail: We don't want the device to initiate MTU and data length negotiation, and prefer the peer to do that.

1635.title: [Photon] Memory usage optimizations
1635.detail: The decompression of the WiFi blob firmware, which is performed every time `WiFi.on()` is called, requires about 10K of heap memory in 0.8.0-rc.11, and such an increased memory usage can pose a problem for user applications.

1636.title: [nrf52840] hal: implements __assert_func() to handle libc assert()
1636.detail: Currentl libc `assert()` will simply trigger `abort()` and `_exit()`, which doesn't really give us any insight into the cause of the failure.

1638.title: Fixes to the Argon in Listening Mode showing wrong MAC address with the command `m`.
1638.detail: The Argon shows MAC address with "00:00:00:00:00:00" in Listening Mode with command `m` which is incorrect.

1639.title: Invalidate sockets when turning WiFi off
1639.detail: Socket operations, such as `socket_close()`, may cause a hard fault when performed after a WiFi reset.

1640.title: Cache persistent feature flags
1640.detail: DCT operations in WICED 3.7.0 consume significantly more stack memory than in WICED 3.3.0. This may cause a stack overflow in `HAL_Core_System_Reset()`, which checks whether the reset info feature flag is set in the DCT.

1643.title: Updates OpenThread to 20181217 master
1643.detail: We've temporarily reverted an update to 20181204 OpenThread master (#1620) for rc.26 due to a regression in the Nordic 802.15.4 radio driver.

1645.title: [argon] ncp: updateFirmware() after the NCP reset needs to re-enable the client
1645.detail: Fixes a regression introduced by #1608: `updateFirmware()` always returns `SYSTEM_ERROR_INVALID_STATE` despite applying the update successfully.

1646.title: Fix SYSTEM_04_button_mirror test
1646.detail:
This PR fixes the `SYSTEM_04_button_mirror` test from the `wiring/no_fixture` suite.

1648.detail: `wiring/networking` test not resolving IP first try for Core

1649.title: Enable USB Serial by default
1649.detail: USB Serial on Gen 3 devices is not enabled by default until `Serial.begin()` is called. This behavior differs from Gen 2 devices.

1650.title: Execute button and OOM event handlers synchronously
1650.detail: Prior to the changes introduced in https://github.com/particle-iot/firmware/pull/1600, there was a bug in `system_notify_event()` that was causing a system panic in multithreaded applications when a button event was generated. That PR fixed the problem by making all button handlers asynchronous, which, however, is a breaking change, and we'd like to avoid introducing breaking changes at this point.

1651.detail: Providing Cellular command on Gen 3 Devices to allow testing customer AT commands.

1653.detail: WinUSB driver is not being automagically attached to DFU interface on Windows.

1655.title: [Gen 3] Control requests over USB
1655.detail: We are only exposing the control interface over BLE on Gen 3 devices, whereas Gen 2 devices expose it over USB.

1657.title: Mesh network diagnostics
1657.detail: We'd like to have better understanding of the topology of the mesh network by introducing a control request (accessible over BLE and USB) to collect the current topology (as well as other diagnostic information) of the network.

1658.title: CH26714: Arduino compatibility for mesh platforms.

1659.title: Fixes the issue that Argon doesn't return the cipher type of an AP co…
