1661.detail: In certain cases Argon may deadlock when reinitializing its NCP client.

1663.title: [Gen 3] Fix on-device unit tests
1663.detail:
This PR is a WIP, and at least the following tests are still failing:


- `GPIO_05`, `GPIO_06` take too long and eventually fail.
- `GPIO_08` expects `HAL_ADC_Read()` to change the pin mode to `AN_INPUT`.
- `WIFI_04` depends on `wlan_fetch_ipconfig()` which doesn't set DNS and DHCP server addresses at the moment.
- ~`TIMER_07`, `TIME_13`, `WIFI_12` cause system panic either immediately or shortly after the test.~
- ~`APPLICATION_WATCHDOG_02` fails intermittently.~
- `LED_11` fails to validate the state of the RGB LED (possibly, due to `HAL_Led_Rgb_Get_Max_Value()` returning a value that doesn't work well with the test logic).
- `INTERRUPTS_02`, `INTERRUPTS_03`, `SYSTEM_04`, `SYSTEM_05` don't compile due to missing interrupt HAL definitions or dependency on STM32-specific functions.

1664.title: Bypass git dependency in build
1664.detail:
`git` should not be a build dependency.

It is possible for the firmware to build correctly without having `git` installed. Currently, `git` is used to test which branch is being built and offer a warning message if you are working on the `develop` branch, without the having specified the `PARTICLE_DEVELOP` environment variable.

The branch check forces a dependency on Git and spews error messages in its absence. The false positive error messages obfuscate true errors and warnings, which make it harder for a developer to monitor and catch warnings and errors.

1665.title: Dependency clarification
1665.detail: The dependency information is incomplete, and the available information is unorganized and hard to process.

1666.title: Fixes unique stale socket issue with LTE devices
1666.detail:
A unique situation on LTE devices appears when cellular coverage drops briefly and the device remains unreachable until reset.

If cellular coverage drops and comes back just as the cloud socket close operation is executing.  The observed issue is that the cloud socket handle on the modem is attempted to be closed, but at the time the modem is unable to process the request.  The socket is freed from the lookup table in RAM and when the system attempts to re-connect to the cloud, a new socket is requested and the modem returns handle 1 on port 5684.  0 is still open on port 5684 and the modem apparently doesn't mind having two sockets open on the same port.  Data is sent on handle 1 and expected back on handle 1, but it's being received on handle 0 by the modem.  This state persists until the modem is reset.

1669.title: Absolute paths for submodules
1669.detail: Cannot fork `particle-iot` repository without forking all submodules.

1672.title: Fix/hal/spi default config
1672.detail:
This PR includes two fixes:
1. Nordic SDK uses PULLDOWN configuration for MISO, which may affect some users' tricky usage.
2. When calling SPI.begin() to define a new CS pin, the SPI driver of Gen2 will keep the GPIO configuration of old CS pin while the SPI driver of Gen3 will reset old CS pin. I'm not sure whether this fix is a good choice, just for compatibility with Gen2 device.

I was puzzled why Gen2 SPI driver doesn't reset GPIO even if we call `HAL_SPI_End()`, that means once we use SPI driver it will make an unrecoverable configuration to a GPIO. 

[issue-1671](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/issues/1671)

1680.title: [nrf52840] hal: Fixes inaccurate system time for micros()
1680.detail: micros() is not accurate in RC27, because we change the clock source from `DWT->CYCCNT` to `RTC2`, the time error become: 1/32.768KHz = 30.5us

1688.title: [LTE/Electron] Fixes software Timer()'s halting after millis() overflows (every 49.7 days)
1688.detail: The [Particle software timers aka `Timer`](https://docs.particle.io/reference/device-os/firmware/photon/#software-timers) use the FreeRTOS timer feature. FreeRTOS version 8.2.2 used on the Electron introduced a bug where timers stop triggering after an overflow of the tick count, which happens after ~49 days.

1694.title: Fix/gen3 fix no fixture unit test
1694.detail:
This PR is additional fixes for some issue in [[Gen 3] Fix on-device unit tests](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1663)

> `GPIO_05`, `GPIO_06` take too long and eventually fail.

This is because PWM function is not available on D1 pin, use D2 instead

> `GPIO_08` expects `HAL_ADC_Read()` to change the pin mode to `AN_INPUT`.

`AN_INPUT` is only for Gen2 device

> `LED_11` fails to validate the state of the RGB LED (possibly, due to `HAL_Led_Rgb_Get_Max_Value()` returning a value that doesn't work well with the test logic).

A7 is not available on Gen3 device and `HAL_Led_Rgb_Get_Max_Value()` is fixed in [mirror button and led](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1590)

1708.title: [Internal] Fix `brew install gcc-arm-none-eabi-53` formula
1708.detail:
On MacOS High Sierra 10.13.3:

running the `brew install gcc-arm-none-eabi-53` step fails:

```Error: gcc-arm-none-eabi-53: /usr/local/Homebrew/Library/Taps/px4/homebrew-px4/gcc-arm-none-eabi-53.rb:13: syntax error, unexpected keyword_end```

Adding quotes on line 13 around the prefix command fixes the problem.  they need to be escaped in the echo command.

Running again we see the following problem:

```undefined local variable or method `gcc' for Formulary::FormulaNamespace400315692c1c92e387b328263702f935:Module```

removing gcc-arm-none-eabi-53.rb from the first line of the ruby file allows for successful installation.

1739.detail:

1741.title: [bootloader] SysTick needs to be disabled in Reset_System() on Gen 2 platforms
1741.detail: Bootloader on Gen 2 platforms built out of `develop` currently fails to boot correctly into system parts. This is an artifact of Gen2/3 merge, where the preparatory logic for deinitializing things in the bootloader before jumping into the application was moved out of the common bootloader code into platform-specific `Reset_System()` function.

1742.title: Reserve memory for system-part1 SRAM
1742.detail:
On the Photon, the size of the static RAM (SRAM) allocated for system-part1 is only 768 bytes, which is not enough to build Device OS with newer versions of GCC (5.4.x – 8.2.x): https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1159#issuecomment-262969953.

The user part's SRAM is located immediately after the system-part1 SRAM, so the size of the latter region cannot be increased without breaking the backward compatibility:
```
Photon                                  Electron
+-------------------+ 0x20000000        +-------------------+ 0x20000000
| system-part1 SRAM |                   | system-part1 SRAM |
+-------------------+ 0x20000300        +-------------------+ 0x20000400
| user-part SRAM    |                   | user-part SRAM    |
+~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~+                   +~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~+
|                   |                   |                   |
|                   |                   | Heap              |
| Heap              |                   |                   |
|                   |                   +-------------------+ 0x2001c000
|                   |                   | system-part3 SRAM |
+-------------------+ 0x20014800        +-------------------+ 0x2001d000
| system-part2 SRAM |                   | system-part2 SRAM |
+-------------------+ 0x2001f000        +-------------------+ 0x2001f000
| Initial stack     |                   | Initial stack     |
+-------------------+ 0x20020000        +-------------------+ 0x20020000
```

1743.title: [internal] [photon/p1] crypto: re-enables MD5 for TLS (WPA Enterprise)
1743.detail: MD5 got erroneously disabled for Photon and P1 during the development of 1.1.0-rc.1, which prevents WPA Enterprise authentication not working correctly.

1748.title: Runtime logging configuration
1748.detail:
This PR reimplements the control requests for runtime logging configuration using protobuf (the original implementation used JSON).

The most part of the logging framework is implemented in the user module. In order to reduce the overhead for user applications, parsing of protobuf messages is performed in the system module. A deserialized configuration is then passed to the user module via a thin system API layer (see `system_logging.h`).

Note that the capability to configure logging at runtime is disabled by default. The application needs to set a feature flag in order to enable it (`FEATURE_LOG_CONFIG`). Unfortunately, we can't enable this feature by default and provide an option to disable it, because in that case the linker won't be able to optimize the unused code out. A solution would be to move the logging framework to the system module entirely.

1749.title: [test] fixes unit-tests for testing version string with pre-release
1749.detail:
- Unit Tests do not expect Alpha or Beta pre-release strings in addition to RC.
- TEST=wiring/no_fixture test SYSTEM_02 has the same issue
- Upgrade-downgrade.sh needs updating for 1.2.0-beta.1

1750.title: Do not fail the build if PARTICLE_DEVELOP is not defined

1751.title: Remove the message "External flash is not supported" from Gen 3 builds
1751.detail:
```
device-os/modules$ make PLATFORM=argon -s
  /home/monkbroc/Programming/firmware/modules/argon/system-part1/makefile /home/monkbroc/Programming/firmware/modules/argon/user-part/makefile
src/control/storage.cpp:63:50: note: #pragma message: External flash is not supported
 #pragma message("External flash is not supported")
                                                  ^
   text	   data	    bss	    dec	    hex	filename
 649424	   2156	  65792	 717372	  af23c	../../../build/target/system-part1/platform-12-m/system-part1.elf
Creating ../../../build/target/user-part/platform-12-m/module_user_memory.ld ...
Creating ../../../build/target/user-part/platform-12-m/module_user_memory.ld ...
   text	   data	    bss	    dec	    hex	filename
   4764	    104	    780	   5648	   1610	../../../build/target/user-part/platform-12-m/user-part.elf
```

This message shows up in all Gen 3 Device OS builds, including quiet builds. It is not an actionable message for end users. If we need to implement additional support for external flash in Device OS, let's plan for that instead of showing a message in the build output.

1754.title: Shared Gen3 module code
1754.detail:
Compiling Gen 3 Device OS would put intermediate build files outside of the `build/target` directory or `$APPDIR/target` directory (when compiling a customer application).

The source code for system-part1 and user-part modules for Gen 3 devices was in `../../../modules/shared/nRF52840/src/system-part1` and `../../../modules/shared/nRF52840/src/user-part` which led to the build files being put in a relative folder `modules/shared/nRF52840` instead of `target/system-part1/platform-X-m`.

1756.title: [Gen 3] Updates embedded bootloader
1756.detail: The Gen 3 embedded bootloader was supposed to be updated in 1.1.0-rc.1.

1757.title: Sets C++ and C standard versions in a single location (C++14 and C11)
1757.detail:
1. We'd like to upgrade the C++ standard we use to C++14
2. Almost every module seems to set its own C++ and/or C standard version

1758.title: [Gen 3] Always check ongoing RX DMA transaction when reporting number of bytes available in RX buffer
1758.detail:
`SerialX.available()` may report smaller number of bytes available in RX buffer than actually received, until the data is read out. There is no data loss though.

This is a "bug" in how we handle partial DMA transfers. We commit pending DMA data only if the RX buffer is empty, so you would see a smaller number in `available()` that wouldn't change until read out and then partially completed DMA transfer would be commited.

Originally issue was reported in https://community.particle.io/t/error-serial1-available-argon/48380/4

1759.title: Integrate cellular network vitals data into `DESCRIBE_x` message

1760.title: Mesh network scan fixes
1760.detail:
This PR introduces the following changes:

- Make the duration of an active scan configurable.
- Remove duplicate network entries from the network scan results.
- Remove our workarounds for OpenThread bugs that were fixed in the upstream repo and pulled into our dependency branch (see https://github.com/openthread/openthread/pull/3246).

1761.title: Introduce safety checks on heap usage from ISRs
1761.detail:
Apparently we don't have checks on whether `malloc()`/`free()` etc functions are being called from an ISR, which should not be possible due to the usage of a semaphore for thread-safety.

We did have assertions for this previously but only for Electron.

1762.title: [Electron/LTE] disables all eDRX AcT types [ch32051]
1762.detail: eDRX is enabled by default on production u-Blox modules, and it causes a variable lag in the network data transmissions.  We have previously disabled it, but not entirely.

1766.title: ch32350/error codes - Create AT specific errors

1767.title: Wait for confirmable messages when entering the deep sleep mode
1767.detail: `System.sleep(SLEEP_MODE_DEEP, ...)` doesn't wait for confirmable messages to be processed before entering the deep sleep mode. If the current session data became invalid for some reason, this may put a sleepy device into an endless loop, where it wakes up, restores the session, publishes an event and goes back to sleep without ever noticing that there's no established connection with the cloud.

1769.title: photon UDP support
1769.detail: UDP Cloud Communications on the Photon/P1. This was not working correctly after refactoring mbedtls in the system firmware and the Gen2/Gen3 integration.

1770.title: Fixes Spark Core function calls broken in 0.8.0-rc.4 [ch32050]
1770.detail: Spark Core function calls broken in 0.8.0-rc.4 #1537 when updating API limits for Gen 2 devices.

1773.title: [system] network manager: allows to clear interface-specific credentials notwithstanding interface state, except for Mesh

1774.title: Rename SoM platform names [ch32184]
1774.detail: The Device OS `PLATFORM_NAME` definition for platforms 22, 23, 24 started as `argon-som`, `boron-som` and `xenon-som` in 1.1.0-rc.1 and 1.1.0-rc.2. The official platform names for the SoMs are A SoM, B SoM and X SoM so in Device OS the `PLATFORM_NAME` should be renamed to `asom`, `bsom`, `xsom` for compilation.

1775.title: communication: cleans up CoAP timeout/parameters/retransmission stuff
1775.detail:
This is something I made some time ago while investigating CoAP issues for Gen 3 devices, so putting it here so it's not lost in time.

This PR:
1. Cleans up (IMHO) CoAP parameter calculations
2. Fixes retransmission logic to exactly follow RFC (random part is calculated only once), additional logging, keeping retransmissions within `MAX_TRANSMIT_SPAN`
3. `MAX_TRANSMIT_SPAN` -> `EXCHANGE_LIFETIME` again to follow the RFC
4. Makes `PING` ACK timeout based on `MAX_TRANSMIT_SPAN` instead of arbitrary `30s`

1776.title: expires a session after 3 unsuccessful attempts at connecting to the cloud
1776.detail:
The device and cloud may get out of sync when reusing a session. For instance, session data may become corrupted on the device, or session caches on the cloud expired. 

When this occurs the device presently retries indefinitely to use the current session.

1777.title: Fix/hal/gen3 pinmode
1777.detail:
1. User LED is configured to OUTPUT mode when initializing.
2. Pin mode is changed to default mode after calling `analogWrite()` and `digitalWrite()`

Reference issue:
https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/issues/1772

1778.title: [Gen 3] Fixes various issues caused by the gateway reset
1778.detail: Mesh devices may be unable to connect to the cloud or appear to be connected but can neither send nor receive data to/from the cloud under certain conditions.

1779.title: [Electron/LTE] Make sure that the RAT information is actual before calculating signal strength (RSSI) and quality
1779.detail: Invalid RAT information causes signal strength/quality information to be unavailable. This is caused by `AT+COPS?` in `checkNetStatus()` which invalidates the RAT set by URC handlers as it only handles `GSM` and `UTRAN` for some reason: https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/develop/hal/src/electron/modem/mdm_hal.cpp#L1380

1780.title: [gen 2] adds Kore Vodafone SIM support & removes Twilio SIM support (…
1780.detail:
- Kore Vodafone SIM not supported in system firmware for Gen 2 devices
- 3rd Party Twilio SIM users were having issues with system firmware taking over and using port 4500

1782.title: [wiring] Make sure that `Serial` and `SerialX` methods are in sync with the documentation and don't return unexpected values

1783.title: [Photon / P1] Fixes MAC address info not being available in listening mode
1783.detail: This is an artifact of Gen 2 / Gen 3 merge where we've changed the behavior of listening mode: it's no longer blocking and is a part of the system loop. This causes network config to be zeroed out by `manage_ip_config()` -> [`update_config()`](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/develop/system/src/system_network_internal.h#L786).

1784.title: intelligent update flags synchronization
1784.detail: The device previously only sends the value of these flags when they have changed from the default. However, they are reset when the device resets, yet the cloud is not informed of this change.

1785.title: [gen 3] update bootloader dependency to v302
1785.detail: After merging Gen 3 and Gen 2 firmware bases together, there was no way to bump the bootloader dependency separately for each generation of device.

1786.title: [Gen3] Fixes a HeapError panic due to malloc() call from an ISR (caused by rand() usage)
1786.detail: `rand()` when called from an ISR will attempt to allocate `_reent` struct from heap for thread safety, which shouldn't happen in the interrupt context.

1787.title: [Gen3] Fixes HAL_USB_USART_Send_Data() returning incorrect values
1787.detail: `HAL_USB_USART_Send_Data()` should report the number of bytes scheduled for transmission, i.e. put into TX buffer, and shouldn't care about how many bytes were actually transmitted to the host. Currently it does both depending on the internal state.

1788.title: allow the bootloader to be flashed over DFU
1788.detail: When preparing a new firmware release for Gen2 and Gen3 platforms that don't contain the bootloader, we currently prepare an Ascender app that allows updating the bootloader of the device. This causes unnecessary delay in the release process.

1792.title: [Gen 2] Fix ABI compatibility issue in cellular HAL
1792.detail: This PR fixes the ABI compatibility issue in the cellular HAL, which was introduced in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/commit/1df0c18d4f97c846d764be2da2677e795adf3c94#diff-7a8d5f66bffd6a68cd5013b3f8709506R171 – this commit adds a new field to the `CellularDevice` structure but is missing necessary structure size checks to preserve the backward compatibility.

1794.title: [system] Fixes radio initialization sequence for Softdevice S140v6.1.1
1794.detail: Softdevice assertion failed when initializing radio on Softdevice S140v6.1.1.

1795.title: Correct APPLIBS reference
1795.detail: The docs about APPLIBS are wrong.

1796.title: BLE: optimize the semaphores' usage in BLE HAL.

1797.title: BLE: to not pollute system listening mode handler class.

1798.title: [gen 3] hal: added apn user credentails to sara_ncp_client
1798.detail: Currently the SDK supports using 3rd party SIMs. This includes the ability to enter a custom APN, user and password. The problem? That information doesn't currently get forwarded on to the SARA-R410M module. Plus if a username and password is used, it causes the program to execute an AT+CGDCONT command which outright fails (by using the auth prefix `CHAP:` before the APN name)

1799.title: [gen 3] [bootloader] External flash sleep refactoring
1799.detail:
We've introduced an incompatibility in the bootloader with older versions of system firmware in the releases containing https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1725.

When you have a bootloader that has this feature on your device, before we jump into the system-part1 the QSPI flash is put into low power mode and requires a special command to wake it up. So, when you have a system-part1 that doesn't send that special command, the QSPI flash is left in low power mode and anything dealing with it fails, e.g. filesystem.

1801.title: System.disableUpdates() operates asynchronously
1801.detail: For a full description see the clubhouse story.  In a nutshell, System.disableUpdates() should not block the application thread to send the event to the cloud.

1802.title: Building platform BSOM results flash overflow.

1803.title: [gen3] hal: fixes early wakeup by RTC from STOP sleep mode
1803.detail:
See #1789.

For some reason when we are configuring the RTC before going into STOP sleep mode, the prescaler writes don't take effect. This can only happen if the RTC is not stopped, but it should have been stopped by that point.

1804.title: Add two-digit mnc diagnostic flag
1804.detail: Currently, the `mnc` is translated to and stored as a decimal value. According to the specification, `40` and `040` are not equal values. Currently when using the `mcc` and `mnc` tuple, there does not appear to be a clash. However, maintaining this distinction is important is important to ensure future bugs do not appear in the system.

1806.title: Improve compatibility with recent versions of GCC (module version should bump to 1320)
1806.detail:
This PR is a continuation of the work started in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1742:

- Refactor linker files to eliminate duplication of RAM memory map constants in different files (only for modular builds for now).
- Move the system-part1 SRAM region to another location on Gen 2 platforms (see https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1742).
- Increase the size of the system-part1 SRAM from 768 to 1024 bytes on Photon. This is enough to store the statically allocated locale data that was added in newlib bundled with ARM GCC >= 5.4.1.
- Use `os_thread_t` instead of `std::thread` in the active object classes. This decouples our code from the libstdc++ internal API which changes between GCC releases.
- Fix various compiler warnings and errors to make the code buildable with GCC 6-8. Note that correct work with recent versions of GCC is not guaranteed, the default compiler version is still 5.3.1.

1808.title: add encrypted slack token
1808.detail: When merging the private and public repo after Gen3 development, the private repo was using an unencrypted slack token. This was inadvertently copied to the public repo during the merge.

1810.title: Cache cellular diagnostics
1810.detail: Current implementation requires multiple calls to `AT+COPS` and could result in an inconsistent cellular global identity.

1812.title: Feature/dynalib
1812.detail: Guidance on how to maintain ABI compatibility between releases of a dynamic linked interface was missing, in particular practices on revising structs passed by callers.

1816.title: [Gen 3] SoftDevice update support
1816.detail:
https://app.clubhouse.io/particle/story/31496/nordic-softdevice-upgrade

Currently, the only way to upgrade the SoftDevice is by using the debugger and manually flashing the SoftDevice binary into the appropriate location.

We've specifically decoupled our Gen 3 bootloader from SoftDevice, so it should be possible for us to employ current OTA update mechanics to update the SoftDevice, where the module is first copied into the OTA region by the DeviceOS, the device is reset and then the bootloader copies the module from the OTA region to the appropriate location in the internal flash. The only caveat is that we'll need to strip off the header/footer.

It should ideally also be possible to flash the SoftDevice over DFU as a means of recovery.

1818.title: [NFC] Context parameter is missing and NFC.update() will remove callback
1818.detail: Context parameter is missing and NFC.update() will remove callback

1819.title: [Gen 3] Fix memory usage diagnostics
1819.detail: The memory usage diagnostics report negative values in the safe mode. The problem is caused by `HAL_Core_Runtime_Info()` which uses an incorrect initial heap size for calculations.

1822.title: fixes #1811 - increases the number of event handlers to 6 to accommod…

1824.title: [lte] cellular fixes
1824.detail:
There are several issues currently:
- u-blox SARA-R410M-02B firmware 05.06,A.02.00 has a memory housekeeping issue where after every 124 days it does a cleanup.  If the power is forced off while that cleanup is in progress, the modem can enter an unrecoverable state.  u-blox has advised on proper timeouts from power up and registration to mitigate this issue.  Only this particular version of u-blox firmware has this issue.
- u-blox SARA-R410M-02B firmware 05.08,A.02.04 changes the way some line endings are generated for multiple commands.  This breaks the AT command parser on Gen 2 devices.  Gen 3 is unaffected based on how it removes all line endings before parsing commands.
- u-blox SARA-R410M-02B firmware 05.08,A.02.04 requires the AT+UMNOPROF default setting to be changed to a specific carrier, or SIM Select.  We prefer SIM Select as it should allow 3rd party SIMs to have the correct settings applied.

1825.title: Particle.connected() should return true only after handshake messages are acknowledged
1825.detail: `Particle.connected()` returns `true` immediately after the session is resumed, even if the session data became invalid for some reason and the device will in fact never receive ACKs for its handshake messages until the next connection attempt.

1829.title: [gen2] hal: Fixes I2C bus missing stretch configuration

1830.title: Cancel network connection when processing a USB request that resets the device
1830.detail: Control requests are normally processed in the system thread, and if the thread is blocked on some operation, a request may time out. This is especially noticeable on Gen 2 platforms where networking events are processed in the system thread and such CLI commands as `usb reset` and `usb dfu` are likely to fail when the device is trying to establish a network or cloud connection.

1833.title: Exports part of mbedtls to the user application
1833.detail: We'd like to have access to mbedTLS functions available in system-firmware from user application in certain cases.

1836.title: Feature/ch33992/communications callbacks
1836.detail: Sending multiple events over an unreliable connection may result in out of date data being received.

1837.title: [gen3] hal: change wakeup pin for SoM boards
1837.detail: By default, D8 pin is the wakeup pin, but D8 pin is also used by Ethernet on BSoM EVB, when BSoM enters deep sleep mode, it will be woken up accidentally.

1838.title: Rework pinmap for each platforms
1838.detail:
We use conditional compilation to reuse the pin definition which makes our pinmap messy. The pin definition should be moved to platform-specific implementation headers.

Pin information `STM32_Pin_Info` and `NRF5X_Pin_Info` are replaced by `Hal_Pin_Info`, we'll abandon the platform-related naming to get rid of some workarounds such as `typedef NRFX_Pin_Info STM32_Pin_Info`.

1839.title: [Gen 3] Fixes mesh pub/sub socket consuming all packet buffers

1841.title: fixes RSSI regression on G350 (2G) devices [ch35194]
1841.detail: A regression in the Cellular.RSSI() API was introduced in Device OS 1.2.0-rc.1 PR #1779 where the G350 RSSI functionality was broken.

1846.title: Fixes Boron charging current limitation when powered by VUSB
1846.detail:
Customers are limited to 500mA charging current when Boron is powered by VUSB.

Affected Device: Gen3 devices

1848.title: fixes RSSI regression on G350 (2G) devices [ch35194] (original PR #1841)

1850.title: Fix to ensure device resets after bootloader update

1851.title: Fixes boot issue for Core introduced in 1.2.1-rc.3

1854.title: [Electron/LTE] devices drop Cloud connection every time user firmware opens and closes a TCP socket [ch34976]
1854.detail: LTE E-series R410 devices drop Cloud connection every time user firmware opens and closes a TCP socket.  This does not appear to affect U260/U201/G350 devices.

1857.title: [system] disconnect the cloud when calling Mesh.off()
1857.detail:
Issue: #1813 

SEMI_AUTOMATIC mode blocks loop() after calling Mesh.off()

1862.title: [electron, gen3] Temporarily increase IDLE task priority whenever a thread exits (calls vTaskDelete)
1862.detail: Due to the busy-loop nature of the application thread and higher priority (2) FreeRTOS IDLE thread responsible for thread resources cleanup (stack) is not being given CPU time, causing memory leaks, unless the application thread goes into a blocked state (waiting on a synchronization primitive or delaying).  This could cause the device to be stuck "blinking green" until reset.

1863.title: communications public interface
1863.detail: The internal and public headers were contained in the `src` folder which was exported as the public interface, exporting internal headers at the same time.

1864.title: Third-party dependency update
1864.detail: DeviceOS depends on a number of third-party components, which we should strive to keep up to date in order to not be affected by various issues in them possibly fixed in the recent versions. We've had several of such occurances already.

1867.title: Pull test implementation out of source file
1867.detail: Test code should not exist in our production code base

1868.title: Fix/reload dct functions
1868.detail: Particle Update fails to update a Photon/P1 from Device OS <1.2.1-rc.3 to 1.2.1 via DFU mode. This is caused by that after updating the system parts, the address of DCT functions that resided in system parts aren't consistent, so when bootloader tries accessing the DCT after that, it then crashes.

1869.title: Refactor/move catch test
1869.detail: Coverage statistics are not being captured with unit-tests.

1870.title: [hal] Fixes Argon cannot be reset by external gpio
1870.detail:
The reset pin (RST) on the side of the Argon is unable to reset the board by another board using a GPIO (e.g. a Xenon).

We saw two kinds of symptoms of this issue:
1. Argon cannot be reset
2. Argon can be reset, but the reset pin on Argon goes from 3.3V to 1.6V and wait for around 500ms, then it goes to 0V.

1871.title: [hal] Fixes USB send failed
1871.detail: We Introduced USB state in #1846 , the USB sending API didn't update its available condition.

1872.title: Set path to Boost libraries
1872.detail:
It is now required to have Boost libraries installed globally in the system to build CMake-based unit tests locally (this change was introduced in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1869). This PR changes the paths to Boost libraries back to `$BOOST_ROOT` which is set by CI scripts.

Note: This is a temporary solution. Ideally, we'd want all necessary paths to be detected and set using built-in CMake mechanisms.

1873.title: Fixes from 1.2.1
1873.detail: Two fixes were applied directly to v1.2.1 and need to be cherry-picked to latest `develop` for next release: `1.3.1-rc.1`

1875.title: Fix/gen3 i2c timeout
1875.detail: The I2C driver on Gen3 device doesn't support timeout, once the external I2C slave device dies, the I2C bus will be held, Device OS gets stuck in the endless wait, the user application doesn't run anymore.

1876.title: Add analogReference function to switch between default VDD/4 reference and internal reference for ADC.
1876.detail: The default analog reference for nRF52840-based boards (Xenon, Argon, Boron) uses VDD/4. This is fine for stable input voltage (usb), but super not great if you're running off a battery as the input voltage (and therefor reference voltage) decreases over time. The nRF52840 does have an internal 0.6v reference that would solve this problem, but the ability to use it is not currently implemented in the Particle OS. This is pretty annoying in a device that markets itself as a battery-based sensor node.

1878.title: [gcc] fixes virtual platform exception on startup #1878 [ch35243]
1878.detail: The Gen2 virtual platform failed on startup due to a coding error.

1879.title: Fix/gen3 spi concurrent
1879.detail:
The EthernetWing uses the high speed SPI for Gen3 devices, but the hardware design blocks to use the 2nd SPI interface unless to do some modifications to the EthernetWing.

Besides the above, the high speed SPI was not able to be shared with other SPI peripheral devices to use it concurrently with the EthernetWing since the SPI HAL has not implemented any synchronization mechanism.

1882.title: BLE: alternately broadcast user's and Particle-specific advertising d…
1882.detail: The advertising data and scan response data set by user application will not be broadcasting when device in the Listening mode. What that means is, for custom mobile App it would not be able to filter their device by the advertising data set in user application when device in the Listening mode.

1887.title: Changes to support building combined Photon and P1 images for the recent releases
1887.detail:
We haven't done a manufacturing release for Photons and P1s since 0.5.5 and DeviceOS has changed quite significantly since then:

1. DCT functions do not fit into the bootloader and are dynamically imported from system parts
2. System flags are no longer stored in DCT
3. Tinker is no longer being built by default if no app is specified

1889.title: [hal] Fixes WIFIEN pin mode for ASoM
1889.detail: ASOM has a pull-down resistor on ESPEN pin, it's different from ARGON, so the pin mode should be output drain on ARGON, output on ASOM.

1890.title: BLE: introduces BLE.begin() and BLE.end() wiring APIs.
1890.detail: In Device OS 1.3.1-rc.1 and below, to terminate all the BLE activities initiated by user application, we can call `BLE.off()` to just shut off the BLE radio. While this API will also prevent the mobile setup from going further when device is in the Listening mode, since BLE will stop advertising and Peripheral connection is dropped if connected when that API is called.

1894.title: [user] fixes weird alignment error with the dynalib table location

1895.title: Expose select() and poll() to apps
1895.detail: `select` and `poll` system calls are not exposed to applications

1896.title: Update Travis CI for Coveralls
1896.detail: Travis CI is not integrated with Coveralls

1897.title: Fixes SoftDevice OTA updates
1897.detail:
1. The bootloader doesn't correctly handle `MODULE_INFO_FLAG_DROP_MODULE_INFO` flag. The returned module info for the SoftDevice module is a copy into a static variable, so direct pointer comparisons can't work.
2. The state checksum doesn't change after an update of either SoftDevice or NCP module, which causes the device to get stuck in safe mode

1898.title: Fixes issues encountered during 1.4.0 rc.1 testing

1899.title: Notify the cloud about planned disconnections
1899.detail:
This PR implements a mechanism for graceful disconnection from the cloud on the following events:

- System reset (as part of the firmware update process or via `System.reset()`, `System.dfu()` and other APIs).
- Disconnecting via `Particle.disconnect()`.
- Shutting down network interfaces.
- Entering the listening mode.
- Entering one of the sleep modes.

Upon any of the above events, the device first sends a Goodbye message to the cloud, waits for the message to be received by the cloud, and then proceeds to close the connection with the cloud. On UDP platforms the message is sent as a confirmable message and needs to be acknowledged by the server. On TCP platforms the delivery of the message is ensured by half-closing the socket and waiting for the server to close the connection.

The Goodbye message carries the information about the disconnection reason, system reset reason and duration of the sleep (if applicable). The format of the data is described [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bM8oy2l6TrWtLE0H7dQKWNTiEuyVyayevTR7NWwfQyk).

**Important:** This PR introduces the following changes in the current Device OS behavior:

- Device OS now completely disconnects from the cloud when going into sleep. Previously, it was leaving the comms layer and cloud socket in whatever state they were prior to entering the sleep mode.
- By default, `System.reset()` and other APIs no longer reset the device immediately if it's connected to the cloud.

This PR also refactors buffer appender classes (`BufferAppender`, `BufferAppender2`), so that there's only one `BufferAppender` class.

1901.title: BLE: user can optionally send characteristic value with/without ACK.
1901.detail:
For local characteristic with `NOTIFY` and `INDICATE` property, it will only send notification even if peer device subscribed indication.

For peer characteristic with `NOTIFY` and `INDICATE` property, it will only subscribe notification.

For peer characteristic with `WRITE` and `WRITE_WO_RSP` property, it will only send data without response.

1903.title: [ch34058] update release script to include Electron without DEBUG_BUILD=y and tinker-serial-debugging apps for Gen 3
1903.detail:
- Some customers would like the Electron released with DEBUG_BUILD=n
- When debugging Gen 3 devices, it is very convenient to use `tinker-serial-debugging` if you do not have a Serial USB adapter for use with `tinker-serial1-debugging` that is already being generated.

1907.title: Backports into 1.3.1
1907.detail:
Backports a number of bugfixes from 1.4.0-rc.1 and develop.

1. #1905 
2. #1894 
3. #1897
4. Everything from #1898 except for https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1898/commits/f5ccd79aaad659416d4d1385ae0a7f06eea2f30e, https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1898/commits/2d983d357f054b0cdce5e2204d161ff9681a2f88 and https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1898/commits/580cfaf08736b11a83e87c8e17380fc368cfef4e

---

1908.title: Notify the cloud about keepalive interval changes
1908.detail:
User applications can change the keepalive interval of the cloud connection via the `Particle.keepAlive()` method. The interval can also be changed by the system depending on the cellular provider and/or the type of the external connectivity used by the gateway device in a mesh network.

At present, the cloud has no means to determine the keepalive interval set on a particular device, and this affects the ability of the cloud to track the online status of the device accurately.

1909.title: Do not mix logging and serial console output
1909.detail: This PR cherry-picks cae58bcdd84d1d6d5fa1a1c5fa0bf2b88608e221 from https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1748 to make sure logging over `Serial` does not interfere with the serial console in listening mode.

1910.title: Git: fix submodules whitespace
1910.detail: A change in 1.4.0-rc1 causes merge conflicts. This is important to fix before 1.4.0 goes live so that feature branch maintainers don't suffer needless headaches when targeting new `device-os` releases.

1911.title: [gen 2][lte] TCP socket closing slowly and TCPClient::connect() return values are incorrect
1911.detail:
- See #1865 where TCPClient::connect() return values are not working as documented (1 = connected, 0 = all errors)
- [gen 2][lte] TCP Sockets generally take much longer to close on the SARA-R410M-02B vs. U260, U201 and other modems.

1912.title: Minor test fixes for 1.4.0
1912.detail:
1. Fixes a bug in `IPAddress::operator bool()` for IPv6 addresses
2. Changes a default pin from `D0` to `A0` in GPIO tests. `D0` is usually an I2C pin as well, so the test might not work depending on how things are wired (e.g. on SoM EVB)
3. Minor fixes in `NETWORK_01_LargePacketsDontCauseIssues_ResolveMtu`

1914.title: Increase maximum DTLS handshake timeout
1914.detail:
The comms library sets the maximum DTLS handshake timeout (see [RFC 6347](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6347#section-4.2.4.1)) to 6 seconds: [dtls_message_channel.cpp#L204](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/dfc2f2cc0e31e62809c3cbdb835d98d55a3e7dc2/communication/src/dtls_message_channel.cpp#L204). Effectively, this causes mbedtls to retransmit an unacknowledged handshake packet only once before failing with a timeout error:

send packet
_...wait 3 seconds..._
resend packet
_...wait 6 seconds..._
timeout

(device log: [6_seconds.txt](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/files/3603310/6_seconds.txt))

This PR sets the maximum timeout to 24 seconds, which gives nice 3 retransmission attempts while keeping the overall handshake timeout limited to reasonable 45 seconds:

send packet
_...wait 3 seconds..._
resend packet
_...wait 6 seconds..._
resend packet
_...wait 12 seconds..._
resend packet
_...wait 24 seconds..._
timeout

(device log: [24_seconds.txt](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/files/3603311/24_seconds.txt))

Note that this change does not affect session resumption and only changes the number of retransmissions and overall timeout of the DTLS handshake, which is performed as part of the full handshake with the cloud.


RFC 6347 recommends setting the minimum and maximum timeouts to 1 and 60 seconds respectively. The 60-second timeout extends the overall handshake timeout to 2+ minutes and seems to be an overkill, but how about lowering the minimum timeout from the current 3 seconds to 1 or 2 seconds? That would potentially lower the latency of the full handshake.

1915.title: BLE: fixes that setValue() doesn't work with BleTxRxType::AUTO if characteristic has WRITE property.

1916.title: BLE: discovered descriptor is incorrect
1916.detail: Discovered descriptor of peer characteristic with 128-bits UUID is incorrect. That would report a fake CCCD handle, which is the same as the characteristic value handle, even if that characteristic has no CCCD presented. As a result, BLE Central device will send two byte, which is supposed to be the CCCD value, to the characteristic value instead upon connected when automatic connecting scheme is adopted.

1917.title: [electron, gen2] fixes RSSI failing due to Power Saving mode active [ch38428]
1917.detail:
PR #1886 added some AT / OK checks before commands with long delays, to force a quicker timeout when the AT interface was not responsive.  Unfortunately this negatively affected Gen 2 2G/3G modems due to the Power Saving mode being set to UPSV=1 by default which enables low power mode after about 9.2 seconds in most cases.  The issue is that when power saving mode is active, the AT / OK check can take longer than the 1 second timeout is currently has set, while the modem is transitioning from the IDLE to ACTIVE state.  In practice, I see this take anywhere from 0.5 seconds to 3 seconds.  The U2/G3 integration manual does not state how long this should take.

Gen 2 & Gen 3 LTE devices are not affected due to power saving mode being disabled by default.

Gen 3 2G/3G devices are also not affected due to power saving mode being disabled by default.

1920.title: Increase VitalsPublisher coverage
1920.detail: Despite VitalsPublisher being a new class, it is not fully covered.

1921.title: [system] Increase the input current limit from 900mA to 1500mA
1921.detail: Boron 2G/3G unable to connect when powered via VIN only with no Battery connected

1927.title: Feature/gen2 otp store
1927.detail: We'd like to store full 15-digit serial numbers when manufacturing Gen 2 devices in the OTP area, ideally using the same format used on Gen 3 devices. This requires support on the DeviceOS side as well.

1928.title: Add encrypted Coveralls key to Travis CI
1928.detail: Pull requests from external sources are not compatible with our Coveralls key handling, and therefore cannot be merged.

1929.title: Fix: BLE scanning memory leak
1929.detail:
BLE memory leak during scanning.
Issue: https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/issues/1926

1930.title: Improves cellular test coverage [ch35587]
1930.detail: Some tests missing for currently covered cellular code.

1931.title: [gen 2] hal: enables reporting of serial and mobile secret from OTP area in listening mode (`i` command)

1933.title: Implement Mesh.selectAntenna()
1933.detail: Even though the antenna is shared between mesh and BLE on gen3 devices, for parity with `BLE` there should be a method in the `Mesh` class that would allow setting the antenna used for mesh radio. This setting should be stored persistently, as otherwise an endpoint mesh device won't be able to connect to the cloud in safe mode.

1935.title: Send safe mode event when the session is resumed
1935.detail:
https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/commit/4a73449a4f7345c9b8e03b81baf141a68ead4cad restored the pre-1.1.0 behavior where the safe mode event is sent only after a full handshake with the cloud. It turns out that this logic may actually break the firmware update process under some circumstances.

A simple test to reproduce the problem:

1. Flash 1.4.0 firmware to a device, e.g. an Argon.
2. Flash 1.4.1-rc.1 tinker to the device.
(device resets and connects to the cloud in safe mode)
3. Reset the device while it is receiving 1.4.1-rc.1 system firmware.
(device reconnects to the cloud and stays in safe mode forever)

1938.title: [LTE, u-blox] adds a mitigation to keep DNS Client responsive [ch38990]

1939.title: Fixes the attachInterrupt() fails for pin D7 on Boron
1939.detail: The attachInterrupt() fails for pin D7 on Boron

1940.title: electron: use standalone DNS client for all modem types
1940.detail:
We've seen SARA U2XX modems stuck returning potentially cached DNS lookup results for longer than records' TTL despite the fact that DNS records have been modified. The only thing that caused AT+UDNSRN to correctly re-resolve in those particular cases was to reset the modem.

This causes problems for device service deploys.

1941.title: [electron] enables modem logs in non-debug builds [ch35402]
1941.detail: Electron modem logs are only enabled in debug builds (DEBUG_BUILD=y). They are useful, but we don't want to keep using debug binaries as default release binaries.

1943.title: Implement a command to reset all network interfaces of a device remotely
1943.detail: We'd like to have a way to reset the modem of a cellular device remotely. This PR extends the existing system handler for `device/reset` events to support a new reset type (`network`), which toggles all active network interfaces off an on.

1944.title: Fixes D7 pin interrupt unit test: be #if instead of #ifdef
1944.detail: D7 pin interrupt unit tests for platform ID macro judgment.

1945.title: [photon] wlan: limit WPA Enterprise maximum TLS version to 1.1
1945.detail: WPA Enterprise authentication fails in some environments.

1946.title: Extract version from release scripts
1946.detail: Currently, version information is captured in the `./build/release.sh` script. This makes sharing the version information with other consumers unnecessarily difficult.

1947.title: [test] i2c_mcp23017: implements HighPriorityInterruptInterferer for nRF52840-based platforms
1947.detail: `HighPriorityInterruptInterferer` is not properly implemented for Gen 3 devices in `wiring/i2c_mcp23017` test.

1948.title: [nrf52840] platform: disable clock driver in Reset_System() before jumping into system firmware
1948.detail:
Originally reported in https://community.particle.io/t/workbench-local-flash-occasionally-requires-hard-reset/52744

The main issue is that `POWER_CLOCK_IRQn` interrupt comes in immediately after we jump from bootloader into the system part and before we initialize all the necessary power/clock related things in the Nordic SDK which causes a jump to `0x00000000` because the clock event handler has not been registered.

The problem comes from the fact that we are not stopping the clocks or disabling interrupts (all or at least `POWER_CLOCK_IRQn` specifically) before jumping into the system part.

I have no explanation on why we haven't seen this previously, perhaps a compiler started optimizing things slightly differently due to the Nordic SDK update in 1.2.1.

Surprisingly the event that causes the interrupt is `EVENTS_LFCLKSTARTED`, despite the fact that we have a busy loop waiting for LFCLK to start in `Set_System()`


```
```


Bootloaders in DeviceOS 1.2.1 - 1.4.1.

1949.title: [photon] wlan: add wiced_wlan_connectivity_initialized() check in wlan_fetch_ipconfig()

1951.title: Feature/intelligent firmware updates synchronization
1951.detail:
The device presently only sends the value of of firmware updates enabled and forced flags when they
      have changed from the default. However, they are reset when the device
      resets, yet the cloud is not informed of this change since they are then the default values.

1952.title: Unify build dependencies
1952.detail: The DeviceOS needs to describe the dependencies required to build itself in codified documentation.

1953.title: Refactors link scripts for all Particle platforms

1954.title: Fix spelling in comments
1954.detail:
Fix a common spelling mistake in some comments, basically:
* `s/recieving/receiving/g`
* `s/recieve/receive/g`

1956.title: Implement HandshakeComplete message
1956.detail: At present, there is no explicit indication that the application handshake has completed. The cloud does not know with any certainty that the device has completed the application handshake and considers itself online. The possibility of out of order delivery of events compounds this problem even further.

1957.title: Enable Workbench DeviceOS local development
1957.detail: A `manifest.json` file is required to enable DeviceOS development in the Workbench.

1961.title: Fix call to objdump
1961.detail: Fixes a issue on Gen 3 devices when the compiler is not on the PATH

1963.title: Ensure gpio pin map is initialized on first use for gcc build
1963.detail: Fixes init order bug as described in #1962

1965.title: Refactors system sleep implementation
1965.detail:
Currently, both HAL and Wiring sleep APIs are not very extensible and support only a subset of possible modes and wake-up options. It has been a long time goal for us to improve the sleep APIs and we’ve already taken some steps in that direction e.g.:
- Wake up reason
- Multiple wake-up pins support for STOP mode sleep
- Type-safe sleep flags in wiring

1966.title: Add gcc preprocesor macro with git msg
1966.detail: Add macro GIT_MSG associated with the application local git repository

1969.title: [Gen 3] Fix too many connection events with deactivated SIM [ch40865]
1969.detail: Gen 3 cellular devices were having twice as many connection attempts as expected during registration, with a deactivated SIM

1970.title: [Gen 2] Fixes thread-safety issues in libc functions
1970.detail:
Float formatting (log, sprintf, etc) can cause Hardfault on Gen2 platform.

The problem has been identified to be disabled FreeRTOS feature `configUSE_NEWLIB_REENTRANT`, which makes FreeRTOS allocate and manage thread-local libc reentrant structure.

1973.title: Add boundary checking to format string copy

1974.title: Export sendmsg() and recvmsg() systems calls

1975.title: Gen3 devices now can be woken up by BLE.

1976.title: [Photon/P1] Fixes handling of invalid WiFi access point config entries in DCT
1976.detail:
1. See #1968, WiFi AP list gets initialized to 0xff instead of expected 0x00, which causes invalid (filled with 0xff) entries to be treated as valid credentials resulting in crashes
2. There aren't any sanity checks on the WiFi AP entries retrieved from DCT

1977.title: Implements that Gen3 platforms can be woken up by multiple pins when they are in standby mode.

1978.title: Implements bitwise operants for enum class
1978.detail: Enum class doesn't provide bitwise operants for type-safety purpose. While for bit mask flags, each bit of it may be a member of an enum class, in which case we need to enable bitwise operants to operate the flag basing on the given enum class.

1979.title: Implement Particle.cancel()
1979.detail: This PR implements a method called `Particle.cancel()` which closes the cloud connection synchronously, without waiting for any unacknowledged messages.

1980.title: [Argon/Boron] NCP bugfixes
1980.detail: Devices may get stuck in a state where they think they are connected to the network, where in fact they are not.

1982.title: Validates sleep configuration before entering sleep mode
1982.detail: Device enters sleep mode without checking the sleep configuration.

1986.title: Feature/sleep20
1986.detail:
Currently, both HAL and Wiring sleep APIs are not very extensible and support only a subset of possible modes and wake-up options. It has been a long time goal for us to improve the sleep APIs and we’ve already taken some steps in that direction e.g.:

- Wake up reason
- Multiple wake-up pins support for Standby mode on Gen 3
- Type-safe sleep flags in wiring
- Woken up by BLE on Gen 3

1987.title: Add support for control requests sent by the test runner

1988.title: linking in static libraries from `lib-static` directory
1988.detail: Linking in some code written in another language. (I'm testing this with Rust)

1991.title: Add support for chunked transfer of USB request/reply data
1991.detail: libusb limits the maximum length of a control transfer's data stage to [4096 bytes](https://github.com/libusb/libusb/blob/f20f2be7825e34b5273af17fc0740c60bd352b32/libusb/os/linux_usbfs.h#L85). This causes larger USB control requests to fail.

1992.title: [Boron/Electron] Reverts defaults PMIC settings changes, adds higher level power config API
1992.detail:
1. We've recently increased maximum current and decreased voltage limit when powered by VIN by default in order to allow Electrons and Borons to function without a battery, as well as fixed a problem with Borons incorrectly detecting when they are powered by VIN vs USB Host See https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1846 https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1921

2. Applications requiring special PMIC settings cannot reliably set them, because of System Power Manager within DeviceOS. There currently exists a workaround for this, but it's not ideal https://community.particle.io/t/1-3-1-rc-1-change-to-boron-solar-charging-via-vusb-behavior/51987/5?u=avtolstoy

These two problems together prevent certain applications e.g. solar.

1994.title: [Gen 3] Logging modem AT commands and data TX/RX by default on modular Boron/B SoM [ch33624]
1994.detail:
As a user of a Gen 3 device, I would like the logging of modem AT commands and data TX/RX to be included in firmware by default on modular Boron/B SoM.

Unfortunately there is not enough space in modular firmware to enable all logging for Boron/B SoM, which is why it's only enabled for monolithic firmware.

1996.title: [gen3] fixes .particle/toolchains/gcc-arm/5.3.1/bin/objdump: not found issues in WB
1996.detail:
For some reason building things out of `main` with WB is broken now (at least with deviceOS@source) and fails with not being able to find `objdump`:

```
/bin/sh: 1: /home/avtolstoy/.particle/toolchains/gcc-arm/5.3.1/bin/objdump: not found
/bin/sh: 1: /home/avtolstoy/.particle/toolchains/gcc-arm/5.3.1/bin/objdump: not found
```

And consequently failing to link:

```
/home/avtolstoy/.particle/toolchains/gcc-arm/5.3.1/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-none-eabi/5.3.1/../../../../arm-none-eabi/bin/ld: Insufficient room for .data and .bss sections
/home/avtolstoy/.particle/toolchains/gcc-arm/5.3.1/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-none-eabi/5.3.1/../../../../arm-none-eabi/bin/ld: region `SRAM’ overflowed by 1196 bytes
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
```

1998.title: Thread-safe cloud variables
1998.detail: When the server requests the value of a cloud variable, the system queries it in the system thread without synchronizing access to the value's data. If the application is running in a separate thread, the request may yield an incorrect value (especially, for `String` and `double` variables that can't be updated atomically) or cause a crash.

1999.title: [b5som] Temporarily disables HW Flow Control
1999.detail: HW Flow control needs to be temporarily disabled on b5som due to hardware incompatibility

2000.title: [Gen3] Frees up some flash space
2000.detail: We've run out of flash space (again) on some Gen 3 platforms.

2001.title: [Gen 3] Fix retained values not initializing correctly [ch42294]
2001.detail: Variables that are defined as "retained" which are supposed to retain the value of variable across system reboots are not getting initialized correctly as expected, on Gen3.

2004.title: Document adding custom symbols during Device OS application build

2006.title: [b5som] hal: quectel modems don't support CHAP:<APN> in CGDCONT
2006.detail:
Quectel modems don't support `CHAP:` option for `AT+CGDCONT` in the form: `AT+CGDCONT=<id>,<type>,CHAP:<apn>`.

This is something that has been copied over from ublox NCP client and should be removed.

This will cause problems (i.e. inability to get cellular connectivity due to `ERROR` response from the modem) for custom credentials with username and password as well as with empty credentials and Kore SIM cards due to our IMSI-based credentials store (see `network_config_db.cpp`: `{ "204", "04", "vfd1.korem2m.com", "kore", "kore" } // Kore/Vodafone`).

```
0000078901 [ncp.at] TRACE: > AT+CGDCONT=1,"IP","CHAP:vfd1.korem2m.com"
0000078949 [ncp.at] TRACE: < ERROR
```

2007.title: Adds internal function to modify cellular registration timeout
2007.detail: Cellular registration timeout is hardcoded to 5 minutes.  There may be instances where this needs to be specified by the user for their particular carrier/application.

2008.title: [Gen 3] Boron 2G/3G fixes
2008.detail:
Boron 2G/3G devices are having a hard time connecting to the cellular tower due to a few issues:
- AT+COPS=0 command is taking longer than the specified 3 minutes to resolve, if this times out initialization can fail early, and the cycle will repeat.
- The AT interface has been noted to not respond directly after the baudrate change command AT+IPR=921600 which causes a similar response.
- The observed status here is "blinking green"

2009.title: Don't check and write protect the system firmware on boot
2009.detail: There is a possibility that in low power / unreliable power situations that checking if the system firmware flash pages are write protected will give the wrong result. The system firmware would attempt to write protect the system firmware flash pages, which erases the option bytes and if the device resets at that moment, sets the write protection level 1.

2010.title: [Gen 3] Workaround for QSPI/XIP nRF52840 hardware anomaly 215
2010.detail:
See #1832 

https://infocenter.nordicsemi.com/index.jsp?topic=%2Ferrata_nRF52840_Rev2%2FERR%2FnRF52840%2FRev2%2Flatest%2Fanomaly_840_215.html&anchor=anomaly_840_215

The gist of the problem is that we concurrently access the external QSPI flash through two different mechanisms: QSPI peripheral and XIP (maps the external flash into the microcontroller memory space). As outlined in the anomaly description, the access to certain QSPI registers after the access to XIP region may lead to a complete CPU lockup. In our testing it showed also that under some circumstances it's not a complete lockup, but a failure to communicate with the QSPI flash.

2012.title: prevent expansion of `EXTRA_CFLAGS` build env var
2012.detail:
special shell variables are expanded when the `EXTRA_CFLAGS` build env var is processed by the build system resulting in build failures.

```sh
$echo $EXTRA_CFLAGS
-DFOO="$"
```

...then build

```sh
cd "${DEVICE_OS_PATH}/main" && make all program-dfu
/bin/sh: -c: line 0: unexpected EOF while looking for matching `"'
/bin/sh: -c: line 1: syntax error: unexpected end of file
```

2015.title: Adds SystemPowerFeature::DISABLE to disable system power management
2015.detail: In some applications, one might want to disable power management subsystem within the DeviceOS to leave the PMIC control entirely up to the application.

2016.title: Clear WLAN WD so it does not interfere with Particle.connect()
2016.detail: In the case when a `'first' Particle.connect()` does not connect to cloud, and `Cellular.off()` was called to power off the cell radio, `subsequent Particle.connect()` does not work. The problem is due to `WLAN Watchdog timer` not clearing when Particle.connect() fails or when cellular.off() was called. The un-cleared watchdog timer interferes with the subsequent Particle.connect().

2017.title: Fix parsing of large AT command responses
2017.detail: AT command parser incorrectly handles modem responses larger than 128 bytes.

2019.title: Fix CGI for Quectel modems
2019.detail:
Quectel modems do not correctly report CGI data.

`quectel_ncp_client.cpp` appears to have been copied before CGI data was finished.

This results in not setting the flags TWO_DIGIT_MNC flag value, and the lac and ci are reported from uninitialized values.

2020.title: update workbench manifest with latest `buildscripts` dependency
2020.detail: `.workbench/manifest.json` uses an older version of the `buildscripts` dependency

2022.title: Introduce configurable I2C buffer
2022.detail: Increase or Make Custom I2C Buffer Length

2023.title: [wiring] Fixes a regression in SPI due to thread-safety additions from #1879
2023.detail:
1. Using SPI object in global object constructors leads to a crash due to undefined initialization order of global objects
2. `pinAvailable()` calls `SPI.isEnabled()`, potentially from interrupt context.
3. #1668

2024.title: Describe message fixes
2024.detail:
This PR introduces the following changes:

- Wrap all checksums that describe a cached application state (firmware modules, functions, variables, subscriptions) into a class (`AppStateDescriptor`). Implement a method to compare cached and current application states so that each field is compared individually (previously, that code was relying on a single CRC32 checksum derived from all other checksums).

- For each of the application state fields, introduce a persistently stored flag that explicitly determines whether the field is set or not (see `SessionPersistData::app_state_flags`).

- Store protocol flags in the persistent session data (`SessionPersistData::protocol_flags`) so that a change in the protocol configuration would trigger a new Hello message to be sent to the server.

- **Automatically send Describe messages when changes in the application/system state are detected (see notes below).**

- **Send Describe messages requested by the server as confirmable CoAP responses.** A failure to deliver a Describe message to the server is a critical connection error.

- **Update cached application state only after corresponding Describe messages have been acknowledged by the server.** See [this](https://s.slack.com/archives/CKRRAGTSB/p1573489983281100) thread in Slack for details.

- Fix the issue with devices always performing full handshake in the `AUTOMATIC` non-threaded mode.

**Note:** In the `AUTOMATIC` mode, the `setup()` function is not executed until the connection with cloud is fully established. In this mode, the application's Describe message will be sent immediately after the application returns from `setup()`. Depending on the threading mode, this may happen either during the handshake with the cloud or immediately after it.

2026.title: String::substring() unnecessarily modifies the source buffer

2027.title: [test] unit: fixes Print tests failing
2027.detail: `wiring_Print tests for all types` test suite may fail with Segmentation Fault.

2028.title: [wiring] SPI: fixes issue that the default SS pin is incorrect callin…
2028.detail: `SPI.begin(SPI_MODE_MASTER);` doesn't configure the default SS pin to be output high initially.

2029.title: [Gen 3] Fixes renegotiation of options and adds IPCP packet parsing
2029.detail:
1. We sometimes see that the devices establish the PPP link, however remain stuck in blinking green. This is caused by the remote side changing offered DNS servers during the negotiation (i.e. it offers one set first and then after we accept if, for some reason offers another).
2. IPCP packets are not easy to debug and are dumped raw
3. [B5 SoM] For some reason we are not receiving CREG/CGREG/CEREG URCs on muxed AT channel and they only appear in the muxed data channel, which causes us to not notice loss of carrier.

2030.title: Change the prefix of BLE broadcasting name for B5SoM.
2030.detail: The prefix of BLE broadcasting name is `B5som-`, while we want it to be `Boron-`

2031.title: [Gen 2] Fixes socket leak in UDP.begin()
2031.detail:
`UDP::begin()` can be called when already active with an open socket. It will unconditionally create open a new socket and discard its reference to the old socket while leaving it open.

If this sequence is repeated the system can run out of socket handles preventing new UDP sockets from being opened and even preventing cloud connection.

While users should call `UDP::end()` to close any open socket before a new `UDP::begin()` the implementation should defensively check for and close an open socket on `UDP::begin()`.

**NOTE: this bug only applies to Gen 2 devices**

2033.title: Replace CSQ on Gen2 with UCGED (mode 5)
2033.detail:
Signal strength on Gen2 is collected using CSQ command. 
1. This command does not provide quality value on Gen2
2. This command is quite unreliable, meaning that is sometimes gives invalid signal strength value in an expectedly solid cell coverage location. 
u-blox recommends to use UCGED command, which is expected to work more reliably than the CSQ command.

2034.title: [hal] usb serial: return -1 instead of 0 when there's no data to read
2034.detail:
The `USBSerial::read` method returns 0 instead of returning an invalid character to signal that there are no characters to read. It makes it impossible to make the difference between the 0 character and there being no characters to read from the serial port. 

This causes problems with functions that expect this method to return -1 whenever there are no characters left to read. This is the case of `Serial::readStringUntil`.

2035.title: Support for > 255 I2C buffers and transfers, configurable timeouts
2035.detail: This is continuation of the work done in #2022.

2036.title: [stm32f2xx] platform: fix FLASH_Update() for unaligned writes

2037.title: Workaround for failing Device OS builds on Windows
2037.detail: Workbench fails to build Device OS on Windows due to the path length limit on that platform.

2038.title: Adding changes for R410M to use UCGED instead of CESQ
2038.detail: R410M uses CESQ to collect data, which is an unstable AT command to collect signal strength values.

2039.title: Redo: Fixes the issue that SPI default SS pin is not configured
2039.detail: `SPI.begin(SPI_MODE_MASTER);` doesn't configure the default SS pin to be output high initially.

2041.title: [gcc] fixes builds on osx and enables usage of the latest gcc versions
2041.detail:
1. GCC platform builds on OSX are broken
2. Recent GCC versions (7+) cannot be used

2042.title: Enable hwfc for Quectel modem during runtime and add support for EG91-EX
2042.detail:
The pre-production B5SoM boards don't support hardware flow control. To distinguish them from the new b5som boards, we're going to automatically enable hwfc by detecting the hardware version. 

This PR adds two features:
1. Enable hwfc for Quectel modem during runtime
2. Add support for EG91-EX

2043.title: Adding diag id for transmitted msgs, and changing name of resend to r…
2043.detail: Device Diagnostics currently do not include number of messages transmitted and number of retries sent for a given message

2044.title: Fix building of Boost on macOS
2044.detail: On macOS, `ci/build_boost.sh` builds Boost using the system's clang compiler while Device OS for the virtual platform requires GCC and the two can't be linked together.

2045.title: OTA adjustments for Argon
2045.detail:
This PR introduces the following changes:

1. Reduce the maximum number of firmware chunks that can be requested by an Argon during OTA from 40 to 20. Argon doesn't seem to be able to receive more than 25 chunks from a given flight of chunks, which causes it to drop `UpdateDone` messages repeatedly.

2. Do not wait for an ACK for a `ChunkMissed` message synchronously. This causes the comms library to drop packets and blocks the system loop during OTA.

3. Rework logging in the OTA code so that it's easier to debug.

2046.title: Only increment unacknowledged counter for requests, not acknowledgements
2046.detail:
`g_unacknowledgedMessageCounter` goes up for devices that are connected and healthy when they get a Particle.variable request from the cloud. This was seen on Electrons running Device OS 1.4.4.


Root cause:
- Cloud makes a variable request
- Response is piggybacked on ACK for original request
- In `CoAPMessageStore::send`, it checks for message type. Since it's not `CoAPType::CON`, it calls `set_expiration` which sets `transmit_count` to a large value
- Some time later, `CoAPMessageStore::process` sees that the message has expired and it deletes it from the queue and calls `message_timeout` which increments `g_unacknowledgedMessageCounter`

2047.title: Lower priority of the network interface thread
2047.detail: Network interface threads on Argon and Boron (`esp32ncp` and `pppncp` respectively) are running with a higher priority than the application and system threads. Due to a limitation in the implementation of the [serial stream](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/dd8f7b7abde56f71ea2e79cce4d68144cc5c44db/hal/src/nRF52840/serial_stream.h#L26) class, which uses busy waiting to implement event notifications, those threads may completely block the application thread from running, especially when the NCP is being turned on or off.

2048.title: Feature/ch47381 coap latency
2048.detail: Add diagnostic for CoAP latency (for the last ACK-ed message)

2049.title: Ensure NCP connection state is processed when changed by the muxer [ch48825]
2049.detail: The loss of signal can cause the modem to draw higher currents and if the power supply is not sufficient, the modem power supply will brown out and the NCP client will become unresponsive to keep alive pings.  `[gsm0710muxer] ERROR: The other end has not replied to keep alives (TESTs) 5 times, considering muxed connection dead` can be observed in the logs when this happens.  This could be immediately after signal is lost, or approx. 5.2 minutes afterwards.  This causes the AT command & Data muxer to go through a teardown, which in turn causes the NCP client to turn off the modem, but the PPP client doesn't know about this and keeps trying to retransmit a configure-request for IPCP.  The modem will attempt to be turned on, the retransmitted configure-request will fail, and the modem initialization will immediately fail again before it turns on.

2050.title: Add diag for coap latency
2050.detail: Currently, there is no diagnostic to show the coap-latency of the messages going outbound from the device to the cloud.

2051.title: Fix YModem transfer
2051.detail: This PR fixes a regression introduced in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2041, which relies on a wrong assumption that the `FileTransfer::Descriptor` class correctly initializes itself. This is a good example of why all class member and stack variables should be initialized explicitly at the time of their declaration, even if their initial values are overwritten later in the code.

2053.title: [wiring] Thread: fixes memory leakage due to mutex not being destroyed.
2053.detail: Memory leakage if using wiring `Mutex` or `RecursiveMutex` class.

2054.title: Specify floating precision in wiring JSON library
2054.detail:
The wiring JSON library based on JSMN has a limitation to display double floating point numbers in limited default precision. The current `JSONWriter& value(double val)` method calls the `printf("%g", val)` statement that relies on the '%g' formatting specifier. This specifier adjusts precision based on overall significant digits versus digits to the right of the decimal point. As a result, significant decimal digits important to the application may be removed automatically.

```c
Serial.printlnf("%g", M_PI * 1301.0); // 6 (FLT_DIG) significant digits total
Serial.printlnf("%lf", M_PI * 1301.0); // 6 (FLT_DIG) digits right of the decimal point
Serial.printlnf("%.*lf", 12, M_PI * 1301.0); // 12 digits right of the decimal point
```
Outputs:
`4087.21`
`4087.212042`
`4087.212042320321`

2056.title: [system] close cloud socket on errors
2056.detail: Cloud socket is not closed on communication errors. With heavy traffic unread data may be left in it, which may prevent Gen 3 devices from establishing PPP link or performing network communications due to lack of TX/RX buffers.

2057.title: [b5som] fixes a hardfault with Ethernet enabled
2057.detail: B5SoM running the 1.5.0-rc.2 on the SoM EVB and enabling Ethernet detection will encounter hardfault SOS.

2058.title: [P1] Enable power save clock (32KHz) only if not disable by feature flag

2059.title: [wiring] Wire.requestFrom() multiple conflicting candidates
2059.detail:
Multiple conflicting candidates when calling Wire.requestFrom() in 1.5.0-rc.x:

```
../wiring/inc/spark_wiring_i2c.h:108:10: note: candidate: size_t TwoWire::requestFrom(uint8_t, size_t)
   size_t requestFrom(uint8_t, size_t);
          ^
../wiring/inc/spark_wiring_i2c.h:110:10: note: candidate: size_t TwoWire::requestFrom(int, int)
   size_t requestFrom(int, int);
          ^
```

2060.title: [Gen 2] Fixes SPI.beginTransaction() deadlocking
2060.detail:
Originally reported in https://community.particle.io/t/updating-from-deviceos-1-5-0-rc-1-rc-2-adafruit-ssd1306-lib-causes-freeze/54740/7

This is another side effect of https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2023 and https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1879.

The issue is caused by the usage of [`Mutex`](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/develop/wiring/inc/spark_wiring_spi.h#L156) as a synchronization primitive on Gen 2 platforms, whereas after the changes in the PRs mentioned above, wiring is expecting a recursive mutex.

2062.title: [Boron/B SoM/B5 SoM] Fix Cellular Global Identity generation
2062.detail: There is a race condition between CREG/CGREG/CEREG URC handlers that may leave LAC and Cell ID parts of CGI invalid.

2064.title: Remove support for unused control requests
2064.detail: We're out of flash space in system-part2 on P1.

2067.title: [Cellular] Fixes an issue with CGI (Cellular Global Identity) not available on some devices
2067.detail:
See #2066.

The main problem is `getCellularGlobalIdentity()` function (in NCP or modem implementation) was getting a temporary intermediate on-stack structure `CellularGlobalIdentity` completely uninitialized (thus containing garbage data of whatever was potentially previously on stack). We were lucky (and are lucky with 1.5.0 release on every platform except for Electron) that its `size` field was always initialized to some large value > `sizeof(CellularGlobalIdentity)`, which made the sanity check pass correctly.

2069.title: Enable HW Flow control on Quectel modems earlier in the init process

2070.title: [electron] cellular: compat rssi/qual for LTE devices using UCGED
2070.detail: Old API rssi and qual values are not available on LTE Electrons/E Series because we've switched over to UCGED in #2033.

2071.title: Move code to wait for AT after setting run time baud

2072.title: [cellular] increase registartion timeout to 10 minutes
2072.detail: We have been requested by cellular providers to increase the registration timeout to 10 minutes.

2073.title: fix uninizialized member in led signal struct

2074.title: Exposed queue peek function
2074.detail: Currently there is no way to check if a queue has elements available. With the help of the peek function it is possible to 1) check if the queue is empty 2) Get an item without removing it.

2075.title: Increase the size of the ARP queue
2075.detail: The size of the ARP queue for pending network packets is limited to 3 on Argon. This results in the loss and subsequent retransmission of one of the four handshake packets sent when the session is resumed.

2078.title: Invalidate value of '0' for RSRP and RSRQ on B5SoM
2078.detail: Quectel BG96 does not give valid values in QCSQ command to calculate signal stregnth immediately after power up. There is a known delay associated with this modem to give a valid value. If the code checks this AT command before it's ready, we get `0` for RSRP and RSRQ. Currently, we are translating `0` as -44 dBm (best signal strength), so it is misleading.

2079.title: [Gen 3] Network stack enhancements
2079.detail:
There are some issues in Gen 3 network stack that affect its performance:

1. Polling nature of `SerialStream`
2. Polling nature of GSM0710 muxer
3. Half-baked implementation of per-channel flow control in gsm0710muxer / `MuxerChannelStream`

2080.title: [hal] i2c: bus is driven low if building with JTAG/SWD enabled.
2080.detail: I2C bus is driven LOW after `Wire.begin()` when building with JTAG/SWD enabled on Electron.

2081.title: [wiring] BLE: use 'delete' in corresponding to the 'new' keyword

2083.title: Map AccessTechnology correctly on SARA R410M

2084.title: Gen3: fixes I2C hang up issue
2084.detail: I2C might get hang up by slave device and never lease the bus.

2085.title: Particle.process() is a no-op when called from a custom thread.
2085.detail:
If `Particle.process()` is called from custom thread, it runs `Spark_idle_events()`
(It's not safe is that Particle.process (and the underlying spark function) also handle things like serial event handlers, subscription handlers, function handlers, and (in 1.5.0 and later) variable queries. These are all expected to only be called from the loop context, otherwise you'd need thread safe constructs around them and in the loop code.)

2086.title: [hal] sleep: allow to enter hibernate mode without specifying any wak…
2086.detail: Gen3 device cannot enter hibernate mode if not specifying any wakeup source.

2087.title: [electron] Fix "Sim not inserted" debug log when modem is not responsive
2087.detail: Gen2 reports `SIM not inserted` or `Sim not inserted? Detecting...` when modem is not responsive. It is misleading because modem AT was not responsive and is confusing users to think that Sim is not inserted.

2088.title: Removes locking in some of the SPI and I2C APIs to improve performance
2088.detail: SPI and I2C transaction becomes slow after introducing locking mechanism.

2089.title: [wiring] Fix SPI macros polluting global namespace
2089.detail: `SPI`, `SPI1` and `SPI2` are defines in wiring. Such generic macro names pollute the global namespace and easily cause issue e.g. #2077

2090.title: [nrf52840] fix an issue with platform_user_ram.ld generation when path contains 'data'

2091.title: [hal] SPI: fixes potential deadlock on Gen3 platforms.
2091.detail: Gen3 Device may get blocked when priority of the thread doing SPI transmission higher than the thread doing USB `Serial` logging.

2094.title: FuelGauge: return error if it failed to read/write registers.
2094.detail: Returned value of FuelGauge's wiring APIs cannot indicate error on failed.

2095.title: [wiring] spi: an attempt to bring back compatibility with SPIClass
2095.detail: A number of libraries rely on the internals of our wiring SPI implementation (`SPIClass`). After introducing a proxy class in #2089, we inadvertently broke them.

2096.title: [wiring]: change I2C timeout in FuelGauge and PMIC to a more manageab…

2097.title: Compressed/combined OTA updates
2097.detail:
This PR implements support for compressed/combined OTA updates on Gen 3 platforms.

Notes:

- A bootloader update is required.
