- For now, only system and user part modules can be compressed/combined.
- This feature requires server-side support. We haven't yet deployed it.
- Unit tests are currently failing on CI due to missing zlib libraries. An update to the buildpack is pending.

2098.title: Add a new member to differentiate internal and wiring setSecurity
2098.detail: As per documentation,` setSecurity()` should be given a value belonging to `SecurityType` enum, but currently it expects a `WLANSecurityType` in the code, and hence results in compile error for `WLAN.setSecurity(WPA2)`

2099.title: Update the Particle server hostname wildcard to include the Device OS major version [ch53190]
2099.detail: Currently the default particle server key for UDP devices is `$id.udp.particle.io` and `$id.udp-mesh.particle.io`. The wildcard `$id` is expanded to the device ID. In order to support LTS and to be able to route all devices on a particular major version of Device OS to a specific Device Service, expand the wildcard `$id` to the `<device_id>.v<device_os_major_version>` so for a device `1234` at `Device OS v2.1.0` it would connect to `1234.v2.udp.particle.io`

2100.title: Boron LTE-M1 radio unresponsive when sending large data continuously
2100.detail: Boron LTE-M1 cell radio becomes unresponsive (by getting stuck at an AT command) after "large" data is sent continuously over muxer data channel

2101.title: [Gen3] USB bugfixes
2101.detail:
1. USB serial port state is not being reliably detected on Gen 3 devices. This easily causes a deadlock when writing data into USB serial port when there is no other side to read out the data
2. USB control requests fail sometimes partially due to ^^, there is also another issue whether extra control requests are forwarded

2102.title: [Gen 3] Modem warm bootup
2102.detail: Gen 3 cellular devices currently always power off and power the modem back on on boot. This affects the boot/cloud connection times significantly especially on platforms where poweron/poweroff times are noticeable.

2103.title: GCC 9 support
2103.detail:
Resolves various issues/warnings encountered when building with GCC9, switches over the CI to using GCC9.

Updates Workbench manifest with GCC 9 support as well.

2104.title: [boron] forward compatibility with 460800 baudrate on SARA R4
2104.detail:
We want to increase the baudrate on SARA R4-based devices to improve OTA times, however compared to all the other modems, `AT+IPR` setting on SARA R4 is persistent (!).

We need to have an intermediate release in 1.5.x line supporting both baudrates and changing the persistent value to 115200 in order to support downgrades from 2.x.

2105.title: [Boron] Radio unresponsive when sending large data or application desc msgs
2105.detail: Boron LTE-M1 cell radio becomes unresponsive (by getting stuck at an AT command) after "large" data or application describe message is sent continuously over muxer data channel

2106.title: DeviceOS 1.5.2
2106.detail:
Cherry-picks a number of commits:


- [Boron / B SoM] LTE-M1 (SARA R4) radio unresponsive when sending certain amount of data within a period of time [#2100](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2100) [#2105](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2105)
- [B5 SoM] Suspend program/erase opertion when QSPI flash init gives timeout error


- [Boron/B SoM] Forward compatibility with 460800 baudrate on SARA R4-based devices to support >= 2.x downgrades [#2104](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2104)
- [Boron/B SoM] Enables hardware flow control on SARA R4-based devices with appropriate modem firmware version [#2079](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2079) [cc7adb7c46ea82383a5f948ea1dc898270a27a3c](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/commit/cc7adb7c46ea82383a5f948ea1dc898270a27a3c)

We also have to bump bootloader version and its dependency, but to minimize impact for other platforms, we are only bumping the dependency for the affected platform: B5 SoM.

2107.title: [boron] fixes SARA R4 power on sequence in light of recent baudrate c…
2107.detail: When changing the default baudrate to 460800 on LTE Borons/BSoMs we didn't account for some power on conditions in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2102

2108.title: DeviceOS Release 1.5.3
2108.detail:
1.5.2 + Asset Tracker support.


- [Gen 3] Add API to read OTP hardware version and model information
- [Asset Tracker] Alternate I2C interface on D8/D9


- [Asset Tracker] Improve external RTC accuracy


- [Asset Tracker] Hardware flow control should not be disable for revision 0 devices
- [Asset Tracker] Suspend program/erase opertion when QSPI flash init gives timeout error

2110.title: Fix the power leakage issue when putting Cellular device …
2110.detail: Cellular modem is not completely turned off when device is going into sleep mode.

2111.title: [hal] Forbid BG96 falling back to 2G network
2111.detail:
BG96 falls back to 2G network even if we force it to connect to Cat-M1. We found that `AT+COPS=0` will reset `AT+QCFG="nwscanmode"` from `3 LTE only` to `0 Automatic`

```
AT+QCFG="nwscanmode",3,1
OK

AT+COPS=0
OK

AT+QCFG="nwscanmode"
+QCFG: "nwscanmode",0
OK
```

2112.title: [hal] Forbid BG96 falling back to 2G network
2112.detail:
BG96 falls back to 2G network even if we force it to connect to Cat-M1. We found that `AT+COPS=0` will reset `AT+QCFG="nwscanmode"` from `3 LTE only` to `0 Automatic`

```
AT+QCFG="nwscanmode",3,1
OK

AT+COPS=0
OK

AT+QCFG="nwscanmode"
+QCFG: "nwscanmode",0
OK
```

2113.title: [Gen 3] System thread wakeup on cloud data
2113.detail: With threading enabled system thread is only scheduled to run every 100ms, or when a task is posted into its queue. This negatively affects OTA times.

2114.title: Asset Tracker support
2114.detail: Merge of `v1.5.3-tracker.1` to `develop`. This PR also bumps module versions to 2.0.0-alpha.1 and fixes some warnings in system version tests.

2115.title: [Gen2] Fix buffer overrun in modem hal
2115.detail: Modem software version of `DevStatus` is allocated 16 bytes overall, but the modem version itself is 16 bytes, so it is missing an additional byte for the null termination. Similarly, other functions in modem hal are to be checked for buffer size before writing into them.

2116.title: Fixes the issue that FuelGauge doesn't work as expected after being woken up
2116.detail: SoC (State of Charging) is not updating after device being woken up.

2117.title: Update mbedTLS to 2.22.0
2117.detail:
This PR updates mbedTLS from 2.16.2 to 2.22.0. The submodule has been updated to point to the tip of this branch: https://github.com/particle-iot/mbedtls/tree/particle-2.22.0.

For reference, below are diffs of our patchset applied to the upstream mbedTLS 2.16.2 and 2.22.0 releases respectively:

- https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbedtls/compare/mbedtls-2.16.2...particle-iot:particle
- https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbedtls/compare/mbedtls-2.22.0...particle-iot:particle-2.22.0

2118.title: NTP-based internet test
2118.detail:
1. Gen 3 platforms do not have internet test at all
2. Using 8.8.8.8:53 over TCP may not be ideal as it's TCP and most devices nowadays use UDP for cloud comms and it skips DNS step
3. The logic around resetting network interfaces due to a number of failed cloud connection attempts is broken and only works somewhat correctly with TCP-based devices (Photon and P1 only)

2119.title: Process 'CEREG: 0' URCs on R410M
2119.detail: A registration URC like `CEREG: 0` is not processed by Electron LTEs, and hence even though a `CEREG: 0` is received by the device, the device still blinks cyan assuming it's connected to cloud, and does not attempt a disconnection process.

2120.title: [Gen3] Hide wifi wiring API that are not supported
2120.detail: Wifi wiring calls that are either unimplemented or unsupported might cause confusion to customers who are trying to use them (may be because they are likely supported on different platforms)

2121.title: [Gen2] Replace sprintf with snprintf in modem hal
2121.detail:
Compile error when building Electron after updating to gcc compiler 9.2.1
```
error: 'sprintf' may write a terminating nul past the end of the destination
```

2122.title: [Gen2] Fix sprintf compile err on gcc9
2122.detail:
Compile error when building Electron after updating to gcc compiler 9.2.1
```
error: 'sprintf' may write a terminating nul past the end of the destination
```

2123.title: 32/64-bit time_t compatibility and RTC HAL refactoring
2123.detail:
`time_t` in newer versions of ARM GCC are now 64-bit, breaking dynalib ABI compatibility.

https://github.com/mirror/newlib-cygwin/commit/4de8754bac676fc7f29082ccf8281b1c73ce629e

In particular GCC 9.2.1 now breaks ABI compatibility in all the dynalib functions that use time_t or any compound types that contain `time_t` within them (e.g. `timeval`).

2125.title: Implement sleep function for UART peripheral.

2126.title: Use newlib-nano headers, FreeRTOS _impure_ptr hooks
2126.detail:
When building DeviceOS with ARM GCC toolchain, we link with a variant of newlib (an implementation of C standard library) called nano, which has certain trade-offs to reduce the code/RAM size.

In order to support thread-safety for a number of libc functions, we are allocating a so-called reentrant structure for each thread. This is a FreeRTOS feature which we have enabled on all the platforms because we've seen various crashes due to absence of that.

There is currently a number of problems:

1. We are only linking with nano version of newlib, however when building we are not specifying that in CFLAGS, which causes us to use incorrect include paths, which increases size of some of the libc structures. One of them is as you would expect the reentrant structure mentioned above. With nano version it's ~100 bytes, with full libc variant it's over a 1000. We are erroneously allocating more than needed and on top of that the nano version of newlib would allocate even more things dynamically as needed
2. WICED, see particle-iot/photon-wiced#36
3. Incompatibility between newlibs in WICED and DeviceOS (see particle-iot/photon-wiced#35)
4. Each DeviceOS module (system-part1,2,3, user module) has its own reentrant structure and any module except for the system part where FreeRTOS resides does not actually have thread safety if some libc function is not being used through dynalib, as the module-local `_impure_ptr` pointer residing in RAM will not get changed on thread context switches. We need to add hooks into other modules, so that we can do that from the system part with FreeRTOS.

2127.title: Reset the device after applying an update while in listening mode
2127.detail: https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1899 introduced a regression that prevents a Gen 2 device from resetting itself after applying an update received via YModem.

2129.title: Implement sleep function for I2C peripheral

2130.title: Implement sleep function for SPI peripheral

2131.title: Fix firmware updates via control requests
2131.detail: Result codes returned by `Spark_Finish_Firmware_Update()` have changed in `develop` and firmware updates via control requests no longer work.

2132.title: [Gen3] Implement sleep function for PWM peripheral

2133.title: Implement sleep API for ADC on Gen2 and Gen3 device

2134.title: Fixes the issue that gen3 devices cannot be woken up by RTC.

2136.title: Implement sleep function for external flash

2137.title: [build] Fixes monolithic build on photon
2137.detail:
`third_party/miniz` is not linked when linking `hal` module, which causes the following error:
```
firmware_public/hal/src/photon/compressed_resources.c:33: undefined reference to `tinfl_decompress'
```

2138.title: Add SPISettings while keeping __SPISettings as an alias for wiring layer
2138.detail: __SPISettings naming is not compatible with Arduino layer

2139.title: [ublox] Do not run AT+COPS=0 when performing warm bootup if already registering/registered
2139.detail:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/388478/85690172-830efc80-b6fd-11ea-8824-cabee43c6d48.png)

Despite being registered, an `AT+COPS=0` call under some conditions may take substantial amount of time, which will prolong the bootup times.

2140.title: Some changes in order to run no fixture tests under test runner / CI
2140.detail:
Currently test runner expects tests to be in integration folder. As a quick workaround for now we've added a spec file to no_fixture test suite and symlinked it to integration.

This PR also contains a number of fixes for no_fixture tests.

This PR also bumps version to 2.0.0-alpha.3 in order not to mess with existing alpha.1/alpha.2 releases on CI.

2141.title: [gen3] syscall: our newlib variant implements rename as _link + _unlink
2141.detail: `rename()` does not actually call into dynalib-exposed `_rename()` due to `HAVE_RENAME` not defined with our variant of newlib supplied with ARM GCC toolchain and it's actually implemented as `_link()` + `_unlink()`: https://github.com/mirror/newlib-cygwin/blob/master/newlib/libc/reent/renamer.c#L43

2142.title: Allow resetting the device via a low-level vendor-specific USB request
2142.detail: When testing Device OS in automated scenarios, we frequently need to recover devices under test from some blocked state caused by, for example, the network registration process.

2143.title: Add unit tests for SPISettings
2143.detail: To add unit tests for `__SPISettings` renamed to `SPISettings`. See [PR2138](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2138)

2144.title: Support for super APN based on Twilio ICCID

2146.title: [Boron LTE] Muxer resumption to be checked at multiple baud rates as needed
2146.detail: Older cell radio firmware versions of Boron LTE support only `115200` baud rate where the newer versions support `460800`. When we resume with warm boot up, we need to check more than one baud rate to resume session correctly.

2147.title: Enable the buck converter of PMIC by default.
2147.detail: The buck converter might be disabled occasionally by the PMIC itself while the MCU is stopped by pulling down the EN pin, in which case charging cannot resume after MCU powering up.

2148.title: HAL APIs backwards compatibility support.
2148.detail: Older user application that invokes HAL APIs directly compile against new Device OS will fail.

2151.title: [gen3] bootloader updates through MBR
2151.detail: It's currently possible to brick a device if it's reset or loses power during the bootloader update.

2152.title: Workaround for Gen 3 devices not connecting to the cloud in non-automatic threaded mode
2152.detail: The system loop on Gen 3 modifies the value of the `SPARK_WLAN_SLEEP` flag, which may prevent `Particle.connect()` from initiating a connection to the cloud when the app is running in threaded mode.

2153.title: [gen3] cellular: parser should not be accessed without a lock
2153.detail: AT parser is accessed without a lock on Gen 3 cellular platforms.

2155.title: BLE cannot restart advertising when it is asleep.
2155.detail: BLE cannot restart advertising when disconnected by peer device if sleep mode is enabled

2156.title: Expose os_queue_peek() function, make sure that queues and semaphores can be accessed from ISR

2157.title: [Gen 3] Default SPI drive strength -> high, API to modify GPIO drive strength
2157.detail: Currently the drive strength for SPI on Gen3 is set to STANDARD, that is causing issues when running multiple SPI devices (to run at default higher SPI bit rates).

2158.title: Add parameterized 'timeout' to 'pulseIn' function
2158.detail: The 'pulseIn' function has a static 3 second timeout, I added another version to mimic Arduino. This has third parameter that specifies the number of microseconds to wait before timing out. Link to open issue is in 'Reference' section.

2161.title: ensure client member vars are initialized before use

2162.title: Supports waking up from STOP/ULP mode by USART/Wi-FI/Cellular on Gen3 platforms

2163.title: Supports waking up from STOP/ULP/Hibernate mode by analog pin on Gen3 platforms

2164.title: Only run AT+COPS=0 if currently de-registered, to avoid PLMN reselection

2165.title: [Gen3] Workaround when unable to obtain DNS servers from remote
2165.detail: Sometimes the device may not the DNS servers from the remote in which case we don't progress further.

2169.title: [gen 2][electron] fixes timestamp wrapping at boot
2169.detail: Every other release the Gen 2 Electron logging timestamp seems to wrap at boot, starting at very high numbers.

2172.title: Support woken up by analog pin on Gen2 platforms.

2173.title: Support woken up by USART on Gen2 platforms.

2174.title: [Gen3] Read IMSI when a (multi-IMSI) SIM switches IMSIs
2174.detail: Detect IMSI switches when not registered, and read IMSI with which the radio is registered with the network immediately when registered.

2175.title: [BG96] Set QCFG commands after every COPS=0,2
2175.detail: BG96 falls back to search on 2G (if LTE-M is not available) even if the respective commands `QCFG` are set in initialization to work on LTE-M only

2176.title: Clear OTA slots after updating firmware modules
2176.detail: The bootloader prematurely clears OTA flags in the DCT before ensuring that the firmware modules have been successfully copied from the OTA section to the internal flash.

2177.title: Replace COPS=2 with CFUN=0 (or CFUN=4) to prevent longer registration times

2178.title: Allowing the ALT server public key to be set in DCT programatically
2178.detail:
The documentation for `System Config [ set ]` suggests that the public server key for a device (including the host and key) can be updated from user applications as follows:

```
System.set(SYSTEM_CONFIG_SERVER_KEY, newKeyBytes, newKeyString.length());
```

This works as expected on Photon but was never updated for UDP devices.

2179.title: [Gen2] Detect IMSI switches
2179.detail: On Gen2, detect IMSI switches when not registered, and read IMSI with which the radio is registered with the network immediately when registered. Update `_dev.imsi` which stores the IMSI in work.

2180.title: Gen3: fixes USART wakeup source for the ULP mode
2180.detail: Gen3: device might exit from the ULP mode immediately when USART is specified as the wakeup source

2181.title: [wiring] print: exclude printable objects from an overload taking integral and uint convertible types
2181.detail:
For printable types (e.g. `IPAddress`) that also happen to be implicitly convertible to an integral or unsigned integer type (e.g. `bool`) `Print` overload printing integers will take precedence over the overload taking `const Printable&`.

For example:
```c++
Serial.println(WiFi.localIP());
```

This will print only `0` or `1`, instead of an actual address.

2182.title: [wiring] cellular: mark CellularSignal::rssi and CellularSignal::qual as deprecated
2182.detail:
These are old APIs that don't account well for RAT (Radio Access Technology).

`getStrengthValue()` and `getQualityValue()` with `getAccessTechnology()` should be preferred going forward.

https://docs.particle.io/reference/device-os/firmware/electron/#getstrengthvalue-

2185.title: MVNOv2 Fixes
2185.detail: A number of issues found while bringing up the new MVNOv2 .

2186.title: Gen2: supports network wakeup source for Electron specifically.

2187.title: Define C++-compatible pin map for Argon
2187.detail:
The Particle `pinmap_defines.h` headers establish pin IDs like `SCA` with a `#define`, meaning that any stand-alone use of the token `SCA` gets replaced with a number by the preprocessor. Other Arduino-based platforms don't do this. Because of Particle's headers, Particle apps cannot directly use [some Arduino libraries](https://github.com/pololu/tic-arduino) that use a token like `SCA` internally, such as:

```
enum class TicPin
{
  SCL = 0,
  SDA = 1,
  TX  = 2,
  RX  = 3,
  RC  = 4,
};
```

2188.title: [Boron] Fix warm bootup on R4-based devices
2188.detail:
When warm booting into a state where SARA R4 modem is registered on the network and there is an ongoing PPP session on the data channel, we fail to interrupt/resume it and start another one. This usually showcases itself in the logs as:
```
0000002548 [net.ppp.client] TRACE: State READY -> CONNECT
0000002554 [net.ppp.client] TRACE: State CONNECT -> CONNECTING
0000002544 [ncp.at] TRACE: > AT+CIMI
0000002560 [ncp.at] TRACE: < XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
0000002565 [ncp.at] TRACE: < OK
0000003591 [ncp.at] TRACE: > AT
0000004616 [ncp.at] TRACE: > AT
0000005641 [ncp.at] TRACE: > AT
0000006666 [ncp.at] TRACE: > AT
0000007691 [ncp.at] TRACE: > AT
0000008715 [ncp.client] ERROR: Failed to enter data mode
0000008716 [net.ppp.client] ERROR: Failed to dial
```

According to the documentation SARA R4 modems do not support `~+++` escape sequence to exit PPP session. `+++` is supported, but `ATH` doesn't interrupt an ongoing PPP session and we are left in some weird state where we receive both PPP frames and AT command responses.

2189.title: Stream definition should be Arduino-compliant
2189.detail: The definition of `Stream::readBytes` is not fully Arduino-compliant: it [should accept both a `char*` and `uint8_t*` for its buffer pointer](https://www.arduino.cc/reference/en/language/functions/communication/serial/readbytes/). Particle's default compiler settings won't allow the cast to happen automagically, which means some dependent libraries don't compile. Sadness.

2190.title: [hal] core: expose functions to fetch serial/secret through dynalib
2190.detail: Certain applications might require access to device serial and secret, currently it's only possible to do so with monolithic builds.

2191.title: [electron] network: abort poweron/initialization sequence
2191.detail:
> When the cellular modem is powering on for Electron it will potentially block for a long period of time during initialization and waiting for the modem to register onto the network. In bad cases, where network registration is not possible, this may block the system thread for up to 5 minutes.

> Cellular.off calls a cellular_cancel function to abort a connection attempt. This allows the system thread to return out of the network registration phase, become more responsive, and process the Cellular.off.

> However, if the modem is caught during its initial init/power-on sequence cellular_cancel will be skipped and the thread will block until either success or five-minutes till failure before powering down the modem. It appears the cellular_cancel is protected behind a check for active connection attempt that misses the init which will be followed by a connection attempt.

2193.title: Test: add test case for I2C restarted transaction.

2194.title: [wiring] fastpin: use function with static variable to overcome initialization order woes

2196.title: Gen3: SPI.transfer() supports accepting const void* parameter.

2197.title: Gen2: fix the electron power leakage issue when device is asleep.
2197.detail: If the Electron is powered on but the modem is not initialized (by calling Cellular.on() or Particle.connect()) before entering sleep mode in the MANUAL mode, the modem persist on and it will consume additional ~15mA after device entering sleep mode.

2198.title: [Electron] Recovery mechanics if modem becomes unresponsive
2198.detail: Electrons can get blocked for substantial amounts of time whenever the modem crashes especially on devices with R410 in conjunction with socket operations which have very high timeouts.

2199.title: OTA protocol v3
2199.detail:
This PR implements the OTA protocol v3 and adds support for resumable firmware updates. The protocol is heavily based on SCTP and thus some familiarity with [RFC 4960](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4960) will be helpful to understand it better. The SDD for the protocol can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KZu6N6qjIyq_wf3I7vg1AKuuoJmN0D98rs3Xog9rXvc/edit).

Both features (the protocol and resumable updates) can be enabled/disabled independently at compile time via the platform feature macros `HAL_PLATFORM_OTA_PROTOCOL_V3` and `HAL_PLATFORM_RESUMABLE_OTA`, although, at present, resumable updates require the new protocol in order to work.

Other internal features and refactoring introduced in this PR:
- The system code responsible for firmware updates is now isolated in the singleton class `system::FirmwareUpdate`. Legacy APIs (`Spark_Prepare_For_Firmware_Update()`, etc.) now use the new class internally.
- Last error message API (see [system_error.h](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/ota_v3/ch55392/services/inc/system_error.h)). The intent is to provide meaningful error messages to the server in failed CoAP responses – for diagnostic purposes.
- New classes for encoding/decoding CoAP messages: [`CoapMessageEncoder`](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/ota_v3/ch55392/communication/src/coap_message_encoder.h), [`CoapMessageDecoder`](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/ota_v3/ch55392/communication/src/coap_message_decoder.h).
- The new [`SimpleFileStorage`](https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/ota_v3/ch55392/services/inc/simple_file_storage.h) class allows saving/loading an arbitrary structure to/from a file in a way optimized for LittleFS.
- New high-level classes that mock the filesystem and cloud protocol's message channel APIs to simplify unit testing.
- CC310 backend for mbedTLS has been refactored to better support operations defined by the mbedTLS' message digest API (such as cloning contexts).
- Helper classes for SHA-256 and HMAC-SHA-256 computation have been moved to services, so they're now can be used outside the context of BLE control requests.
- Maximum OTA chunk size is now determined by `MBEDTLS_SSL_MAX_CONTENT_LEN`. Note that this PR still uses 512-byte chunks.

2200.title: Tracker: an easy way to configure Wi-Fi/GNSS/FuelGauge as a wakeup source

2201.title: Add printf attributes to appropriate wiring functions, change Time::now() to use time32_t
2201.detail:
1. Stream-based objects providing `printf()` and `printlnf()` are not generating `-Wformat`
2. `time_t` printing with `%d` causes crashes sometimes and `%lld` format specifier is not supported in newlib-nano

2202.title: Fix issue with serviceUUID not returning UUID when there is an array
2202.detail: If the peripheral device has an array of service UUIDs on any of the individual types, then none are returned for that type.

2203.title: Add characteristic discovery to BleService
2203.detail: Allows for hierarchical discovery of characteristics inside services.

2204.title: HAL: add always_inline attribute for deprecated APIs
2204.detail: If the deprecated APIs are invoked in c files, they might not be inlined by compiler actually, which would encounter "undefined reference xxxx" error.

2205.title: [wiring] Network: introduce isOn() and isOff() APIs to enquiry the modem power state

2206.title: Disconnect from the cloud before going to sleep
2206.detail: By default, the Sleep 2.0 API leaves the protocol layer in whatever state it was before going to sleep and continues to use it after waking up from sleep without checking whether the session with the server is still valid.

2207.title: Set pin mode for PMIC and fuel gauge interrupts
2207.detail: Interrupts for the fuel gauge device were not firing after attaching handlers, mainly on the tracker platform.  An MCP23S17 GPIO expander is used to receive the input from the fuel gauge and it's defaults were not set for the interrupt pins to accept inputs with pullup.

2208.title: [u-blox][Boron / B SoM] PPP workaround for SARA R4 ConfReq behavior
2208.detail: SARA R4 PPP implementation is peculiar and for unknown reason after IPCP is already up, it sends up an _empty_ ConfReq. If we follow the standard to the T, we are supposed to bring IPCP down and restart negotiation. This increases warm bootup cloud connection times significantly.

2209.title: [Wiring] Remove warning for publish scope deprecation
2209.detail: Deprecation notice exists on Particle.publish without a scope, although there is no need for a scope now.

2210.title: [Gen3] Fix LED behavior in case of network failure in Cloud Connecting state
2210.detail: When cloud _connecting_, the RGB LED doesn't go back to (blinking) green when de-registered from network, or when having DNS test failures

2211.title: [gen3] Allow UMNOPROF SIM_SELECT to default back to SW_DEFAULT
2211.detail:
3rd party SIMs that are not detected with a UMNOPROF, do not default to the SW_DEFAULT profile (0), but get stuck in an init loop in Gen 3.

On Gen 2, it will default to SW_DEFAULT profile, but it will take 8 tries before it does taking up unnecessary time.

2212.title: [Cellular/Wiring] Remove rssi and qual from Cellular.RSSI()
2212.detail:
Remove `rssi` and `qual` from `Cellular.RSSI()`

Additionally, 
- Printing `Cellular.RSSI()` will now print signalvalue,qualityvalue
- New API call - `Cellular.getSignal()` as an alias for `Cellular.RSSI()`.

2213.title: [u-blox] older modem firmware does not have UMNOPROF=100 available [ch64670]
2213.detail:
- R410 - Gets stuck in loop where UMNOPROF=100 was not sticking, but erroring out instead, on older modem firmware
- R410 - Mostly an issue for Gen 3 with external SIM support on Boron/B SoM, switching between Kore AT&T vs. Twilio Super vs. 3rd Party SIMs could get stuck on the wrong UMNOPROF.
- Gen 3 Modem version detection was running too late for where it needed to be used, and could potentially return an invalid version number instead of 0.

2215.title: [Cellular] Fixes PMIC reducing current on warm boot and causing modem brownouts
2215.detail:
There is a number of problems in the DeviceOS power management subsystem:

1. There is a race condition between DeviceOS and PMIC while in DPDM detection. If DeviceOS modifies 'Input Source Control Register REG00' before DPDM finishes (as it also modifies it), it may be left in an inconsistent state with low input current limit, as updates to the PMIC registers follow the pattern:
    1. Take current register value (which may contain a transient setting)
    2. Change necessary bitfields
    3. Write back
2. When powered by VIN (so USB DP/DM lines are floating), we are still performing DPDM detection on every boot, which will temporarily lower input current limit to 100mA

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/388478/95887506-1d2caa80-0daa-11eb-9e8f-511241d1bd8c.png)

2218.title: [Electron] Workaround for modem HAL relying on system networking code to re-attempt initialization
2218.detail:
There are two problems which have some common roots. If the power-on sequence on Electrons fails (and there are two stages in it: power on and SIM initialization, additional initialization), a specific set of actions needs to be taken by the _system networking layer_ to get the modem HAL into a proper state.

1. We are relying on a hack to get the system layer to restart poweron initialization when `MDMParser::init()` fails to initialize and requires a modem reset e.g. to set UMNO profile. This used to work somewhat until we've introduced reliable modem power off in one of the Sleep 2.0 PRs, which now causes the modem to be hard powercycled almost immediately after we've reset it through an AT command.

```
   219.818 AT send      14 "AT+CFUN=15,0\r\n"
   219.828 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
0000219828 [system] INFO: Sim Ready
0000219829 [system] INFO: ARM_WLAN_WD 1
0000249833 [system] WARN: Resetting WLAN due to WLAN_WD_TO()
0000249833 [system] INFO: Clearing WLAN WD in disconnect()
0000249838 [system] INFO: Clearing WLAN WD in disconnect()
0000249843 [system] INFO: OFF 1
[ Modem::powerOff ] modem is on unexpectedly. Turning it off...

[ Modem::powerOff ] failed
[ ElectronSerialPipe::end ] pipeTx=0 pipeRx=0

[ Modem::resume ] = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =
[ ElectronSerialPipe::begin ] pipeTx=0 pipeRx=0

[ Modem::powerOn ] = = = = = = = = = = = = = =
   280.173 AT send       4 "AT\r\n"
   283.484 AT send       4 "AT\r\n"
```

2. The second step in poweron (`MDMParser::init()`) was skipped whenever initial SIM initialization in `MDMParser::powerOn()` failed, because for some reason reinitialization is happening in `has_credentials()`

```
0000321278 [system] INFO: OFF 1
[ Modem::powerOff ] modem is on unexpectedly. Turning it off...

[ Modem::powerOff ] failed
[ ElectronSerialPipe::end ] pipeTx=0 pipeRx=0

[ Modem::resume ] = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =
[ ElectronSerialPipe::begin ] pipeTx=0 pipeRx=0

[ Modem::powerOn ] = = = = = = = = = = = = = =
   351.608 AT send       4 "AT\r\n"
   351.613 AT read UNK   3 "AT\r"
   351.614 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
   351.614 AT send       9 "AT+CGMM\r\n"
   361.819 AT send       6 "ATE0\r\n"
0000371820 [system] INFO: SIM/modem not responsive or SIM not inserted/requires a PIN.

[ Modem::powerOn ] = = = = = = = = = = = = = =
   372.136 AT send       4 "AT\r\n"
   375.447 AT send       4 "AT\r\n"
   378.758 AT send       4 "AT\r\n"
   378.764 AT read UNK   3 "AT\r"
   378.765 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
   378.765 AT send       9 "AT+CGMM\r\n"
   378.778 AT read UNK   8 "AT+CGMM\r"
   378.779 AT read UNK  18 "\r\nSARA-R410M-02B\r\n"
   378.781 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
   378.985 AT send       6 "ATE0\r\n"
   378.992 AT read UNK   5 "ATE0\r"
   378.993 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
   378.993 AT send      11 "AT+CMEE=2\r\n"
   379.003 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
   379.003 AT send      19 "AT+CMER=1,0,0,2,1\r\n"
   379.012 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
   379.012 AT send      15 "AT+IPR=115200\r\n"
   379.021 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
   379.121 AT send      10 "AT+CPIN?\r\n"
   379.129 AT read  +   16 "\r\n+CPIN: READY\r\n"
   379.130 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
0000379131 [system] INFO: Sim Ready
0000379135 [system] INFO: ARM_WLAN_WD 1
   379.138 AT send       4 "AT\r\n"
   379.148 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"

[ Modem::register ] = = = = = = = = = = = = = =
   379.150 AT send      10 "AT+CFUN?\r\n"
   379.162 AT read  +   12 "\r\n+CFUN: 1\r\n"
   379.163 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
   379.164 AT send      12 "AT+CEREG=2\r\n"
   379.175 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
   379.175 AT send      11 "AT+CEREG?\r\n"
   379.186 AT read  +   34 "\r\n+CEREG: 2,1,\"4118\",\"3376211\",8\r\n"
   379.188 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
   379.190 AT send       4 "AT\r\n"
   379.200 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
   379.200 AT send       9 "AT+CIMI\r\n"
   379.210 AT read UNK  19 "\r\n732123200003356\r\n"
   379.211 AT read OK    6 "\r\nOK\r\n"
```

(see https://app.clubhouse.io/particle/story/64669, https://app.clubhouse.io/particle/story/64668)

2219.title: [gen2][electron] modem brownout or unexpected reset causes system to think it still is connected [ch64465]
2219.detail: Electron was found to suffer from a modem reset while antenna was disconnected in low signal environment on battery only (and also with USB and battery). This leads to `C*REG=2` verbose mode + URCS being reset to `C*REG=0` non-verbose mode + no URCs, which causes the system firmware to not be notified that the modem has deregistered. NO_ACK publishes can continue to be sent into the breeze, and a user's firmware will not know `Particle.connected()` or `Cellular.ready()` are `false`.

2220.title: Fixes the issue that BLE.scan() might hang the device.
2220.detail: BLE may hang the thread that calls `BLE.scan()` due to unexpected scanning failure. Since the `BLE.scan()` is a blocking API waiting until a semaphore is given on scanning timeout event, in some condition the scanning procedure never timeout or a incorrect event is delivered from SoftDevice on scanning failure, in which case the semaphore cannot be taken any more.

2221.title: Fix CellularSignal deprecation messages

2222.title: Wiring BLE APIs consistency improvements
2222.detail:
1. `BleAddress` doesn't support validity check and invalidating object.
2. Scanning callback doesn't pass scanned result in reference manner.
3. `BleScanResult` should not access members directly

2224.title: BLE: Scanned/Connected/Disconnected/Data Received callback in C++ style
2224.detail: The existing wiring BLE APIs only support c style callback.

2225.title: Export some common stdlib functions from system parts
2225.detail:
1. Some stdlib functions are commonly used between system and user applications. They can be exported from the system through dynalib to avoid code duplication.
2. [wiring] Mutex/RecursiveMutex classes don't follow [Lockable](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/named_req/Lockable) spec

**See [CH65545] for more information and some charts.**

2226.title: System.on() can accept a std::function instance as callback

2227.title: [hal] sleep: restore waleup sources' interrupt priority appropriately

2228.title: [wiring] system: configure multiple pins as wakeup source at a time.

2229.title: [hal] electron: use AT+CPWROFF to turn off the modem completely
2229.detail: The Electron with SARA-G350 doesn't support powering off using the PWR_ON pin. The low level pulse of the PWR_ON pin being performed in current powerOff() will actually power on the modem.

2230.title: [system] network diagnostics for Gen 3 platforms
2230.detail: Network diagnostics/vitals are only enabled on Gen 2 platforms.

2231.title: [wiring] system: minor fix for sleep configuration method
2231.detail: `uint8_t*` in `SystemSleepConfiguration& SystemSleepConfiguration::gpios(const uint8_t* pins, size_t count, InterruptMode mode)` should be replaced with `pin_t*`.

2232.title: Query cellular signal while module tries to register
2232.detail: The device, at times, do not register and instead stay in "searching" mode. In this case, it's unclear to tell if the device is even receiving a cellular signal which is useful for debugging purposes.

2235.title: [Electron] Build system parts with LTO
2235.detail: system-part3 (2) overflows on Electron. We either have to move something out of it, or now that we've upgraded GCC, we can potentially enable LTO for a quick win.

2236.title: Signal values to percentage mapping
2236.detail: Current signal values to percentage conversion is incorrect depending on the values.

2238.title: Gen2: platforms calling sleep20 API to enter stop/ulp mode may block user application.

2239.title: [electron] modem: fix C*REG URC parsing
2239.detail: A regression got introduced in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2219 and C*REG URCs are not correctly being parsed.

2242.title: [system] Add support for wifi credential erasing in WiFiSetupConsole
2242.detail:
Fixes #2240 

Adds support in WiFiSetupConsole for a credential erasing command.

2245.title: Allow for overriding TwoWire class's internal functions
2245.detail: The current implementation of the TwoWire class does not define its methods as `virtual`, therefore preventing any classes that inherit from TwoWire from overriding those functions.

2246.title: [gen3] bootloader: add workaround for MODULE_DROP_MODULE_INFO
2246.detail:
We've introduced an incompatibility in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2097 between older Gen 3 system-part1 modules and new bootloader in handling of `MODULE_DROP_MODULE_INFO` flag.

Prior to the change the expected behavior for the bootloader was to check the module header in the OTA section and look at the actual flags from it (where `MODULE_DROP_MODULE_INFO` would be present).

After the change, the expected behavior for the bootloader is to only look at the update module slot flags that are stored in DCT, however DeviceOS versions that don't have the change do not set the appropriate slot flag that would instruct the bootloader to drop module info when applying the update.

This breaks SoftDevice updates under following conditions:
1. Gen 3 platforms
2. system-part1 version is < 2.0.0-rc.1
3. bootloader version already on the device is >= 2.0.0-rc.1 (which happens normally during OTA update process due to dependency resolution)

2247.title: Use unique Particle prefix for LED defines
2247.detail:
What Bug or Missing Feature does this PR address? (A short summary is preferred over links)

Simple define names such as `LED2` have caused some users problems due to namespace collisions.

2248.title: [hal] sleep: allows the network to stay standby in HIBERNATE mode.
2248.detail: `System.sleep(SystemSleepConfiguration().mode(SystemSleepMode::HIBERNATE).network(SystemSleepNetworkFlag::INACTIVE_STANDBY))` doesn't make the device enter sleep.

2249.title: Support for DTLS connection IDs
2249.detail: This PR enables the DTLS Connection ID extension (described in [this](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-tls-dtls-connection-id-09) draft RFC).

2250.title: [Tracker] ESP32 support
2250.detail:
This PR adds WiFi scanning support for Tracker. All other APIs except for WiFi interface state management and scanning are not available as of right now.

This feature branch should work with both the stock 0.0.6 ESP32 NCP firmware available from the factory, as well as with https://github.com/particle-iot/argon-ncp-firmware/pull/18.

2251.title: Always inline fastPinGetPinmap to speed pin sets
2251.detail: For some users, calling `pinSetFast` or `pinResetFast` was noticeably slower on 2.0.0-rc.4 or later than on earlier releases.

2252.title: docs: fix simple typo, tecnhology -> technology

2254.title: [gen3] bootloader: workaround incompatibility that required intermediate update through 1.1.0
2254.detail:
Gen 3 Device OS release < 1.1.0 had an incorrect IRQ priority setting for POWER_CLOCK_IRQn (fixed in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/commit/040210e1e4e7f793f62b8cd2bb3e740ffc170d82) which caused SoftDevice to panic. A change introduced in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/1948 to disable this IRQ before jumping from the bootloader into the system part triggered this problem.

In order to resolve this problem we've introduced a dependency on 1.1.0 in the bootloader, so that SMH could first update system part to an unaffected version.

2255.title: Change the condition to disable hwfc on b5som
2255.detail:
During the B523 SoM development, the engineering samples have issues with RTS and CTS hardware flow control, we use the `hwVersion` 0x00 to filter out the PCBA version by disabling HWFC.

Now, we have another new B5SoM variant that has a new modem and the H/W version in OTP is 0x00, to distinguish the B523 and this new B5XX SoM, we have to combine `hwVersion` and `platform` in this case.

2256.title: [gen2] usart: fix D0 AF unconditionally being changed in hal_usart_end()

2257.title: Allow power manager to disable charging
2257.detail: The power manager may override user requests to disable battery charging.  While the user may set the charge state on the PMIC, the power manager may enable charge state silently.

2258.title: Wiznetif: report module power state.
2258.detail: The device may timeout waiting the ethernet interface to be off() when sleep is requested and the ethernet interface is present.

2259.title: Update disable charging feature in power management wiring and API tests
2259.detail: Power management tests were incomplete for a new battery charge disable feature.

2260.title: Increase the maximum size of event data
2260.detail:
This PR introduces the following changes:

- Increase the maximum size of payload data that can be sent or received in a cloud event as well as the maximum size of a cloud function's argument and a variable's value from 622 to 1024 bytes on Gen 3 platforms and from 622 to 864 bytes on Gen 2 platforms. On Gen 3 platforms, this change increases RAM usage by 1.4K.
- Extend the Hello message to notify the cloud of the additional session parameters: maximum supported size of a CoAP message, maximum supported firmware size, size of OTA update chunk, module version of the system firmware.
- Remove the events that have been superseded by the new Hello message fields (`spark/hardware/max_binary` and `spark/hardware/ota_chunk_size`).

2263.title: [Boron LTE] Fix external SIM getting stuck in init
2263.detail: Boron LTEs get stuck in initialization with third party SIMs, due to AT+CIMI (IMSI lookup) error in certain cases.

2264.title: [Gen 3] Fixes UART RX DMA transfer size issues
2264.detail:
Originally reported in https://community.particle.io/t/serial1-rx-randomly-dies-on-boron-2-0-1-red-sos-crash-with-second-serial1-begin/58888/10

There is a problem in how we commit received bytes while RX DMA transfer is still ongoing (https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/develop/hal/src/nRF52840/usart_hal.cpp#L279), causing ring buffer to get into an invalid state and subsequent RX DMA transfers to be configured incorrectly with very large sizes, which causes out of bounds writes.

2265.title: Send modem firmware version to cloud
2265.detail: Send modem firmware version string to cloud.

2266.title: [wiring] BLE: return false if expected characteristic is not found.
2266.detail: `getCharacteristicByDescription()` return `true` even if there is no characteristic is matched.

2267.title: AT parser and gsm0710 muxer custom log category support
2267.detail: Now that we have ESP32 support on Tracker, it's impossible to differentiate between NCP client / gsm0710 muxer logs that come from the cellular modem and ESP32.

2268.title: [gen2] speed up cellular modem powerOn time
2268.detail: We recently increased the AT_TIMEOUT from 1 to 3 seconds, which is causing a few extra seconds of power on time.

2269.title: [Gen 3] Fix warm boot; [Tracker] Cache ESP32 firmware version
2269.detail:
1. We've introduced a regression in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2217 and broke warm boot
2. During handshake with the cloud we need to send ESP32 NCP firmware version as it is one of the module, so it's present in the system describe. On Tracker during the cloud connection establishment it's not guaranteed that ESP32 is on, so we have to turn it on in order to query for its version, which prolongs the handshake process. What complicates things even more is that since https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2217 we'll also watch the current NCP state closely and power off immediately, so several sequential calls to query ESP32 NCP firmware version may have to power on the ESP32 and initialize it multiple times

2270.title: Disconnect from the server on OTA update errors
2270.detail: Before https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2199, a failure to apply an OTA update was causing the device to be reset. This PR restores that behavior on Gen 2 platforms and updates the v3 protocol implementation on Gen 3 platforms so that it breaks the comms loop on OTA errors causing a reconnection to the cloud.

2272.title: System power management inprovements
2272.detail: The battery state is not reported consistently.

2273.title: [gen3] disable some of the elliptic-curves not in use to save flash space
2273.detail: nRF52840 CC310 hardware crypto support for each particular elliptic curve takes about 700 bytes in closed source Nordic CC310 support library (see `ssi_ecpki_domain_*` symbols in the map file).

2274.title: Develop PoC for device-os-test-runner tool to validate minimum RAM SLO is achieved

2275.title: Fix default assignment for SPI chip select
2275.detail: The SPI interface default chip select state is set to `SPI_DEFAULT_SS` which may override user defined pin map controls over GPIO pins.  Normally the user will assign and manage their own chip select and not use the native SS pin from the MCU peripheral.

2276.title: Add new Kore SIMs to static APN map

2279.title: Make sure that ESP32 NCP power state is correctly initialized on boot
2279.detail: Tracker takes several minutes to enter sleep mode. The root cause is that ESP32 NCP power state is not reflecting the actual state on boot (which should be off).

2280.title: Allow clearing session data and running custom setup code in integration tests
2280.detail:
1. The integration test framework defines the `setup()` and `loop()` functions making it impossible for test applications to run custom code in those functions.
2. The system Device OS API doesn't provide a way to force a new session to be established with the cloud which makes it difficult to write tests around session resumption.

2281.title: [u-blox][gen2] COPS_TIMEOUT increased to 5 minutes
2281.detail: On u-blox modems, the COPS timeout of 3 minutes has been found to not be respected by the modem, sometimes taking up to 4 minutes or slightly more.

2284.title: [gen2, threading] Fixes Cellular taking up to 10 minutes to shutoff modem with Cellular.off() / System.sleep(config) if there is no cell connection [ch73242]
2284.detail:
On Gen 2, with Threading enabled, Cellular.off() can take up to 10 minutes when there is no cellular reception and the device is actively trying to connect to cellular.  This is due to the registration timeout of 10 minutes and the cellular_cancel() request not being processed.

The Sleep 2.0 API also has a similar issue and can cause the device to take a long time to enter sleep or other powered down states.

Gen 3 devices are not affected.

2285.title: Modify mapping for LTE signal values to percentages
2285.detail: Current mapping is not reflective of the data and performance obtained from the field units.

2287.title: Add support for BLE 5 PHY_CODED (long range) scanning and advertising
2287.detail: Obtaining adequate wireless transmission range between BLE devices is a challenge in many use cases. BLE 5 introduced a new transmission mode called PHY_CODED which trades off speed in order to increase noise and error resistance. The current version of Particle DeviceOS does not provide any API to engage the PHY_CODED mode when advertising or scanning.

2288.title: Enable LTO for Photon system firmware
2288.detail: We're out of flash space in system-part2 on Photon.

2289.title: [network] quectel: ignore CGEREP errors, send data mode break sequence multiple times
2289.detail:
Restoring network connection from warm bootup on Trackers does not work reliably and fails sometimes.

Two problems have been identified:
1. `AT+CGEREP` returning ERROR response
2. Failure to exit data mode in the data channel

2290.title: Fixes abnormal battery charged behavior and adds a test for battery state deducing.

2292.title: Added i2c buffer size to Wire interface
2292.detail: If a custom buffer for i2c is used these functions will give libraries a better ability to determin the i2c buffer size.

2293.title: Particle.unsubscribe() doesn't preserve system subscriptions
2293.detail: `Particle.unsubscribe()` clears system subscriptions to cloud events along with the application subscriptions and disrupts functioning of IOTA updates.

2295.title: Inhibit Cellular URCs before going into sleep
2295.detail:
When we specify `.network(Cellular)` as a wakeup source when calling the system sleep API, we leave the modem running. When there is URC coming from the modem, like when Cellular moving from tower to another, it wakes up the device, which is unwanted. From the user's view, the device may be woken up frequently.

This PR also fixes issues:
1. Tracker specifically, which is when Cellular is specified as wakeup source, on waking up the on-board ESP32 module is turned on unexpectedly.

2297.title: Querying the value of an empty string variable causes an error
2297.detail: Querying the value of an empty string variable via the HTTP API causes an error.

2299.title: feature/ch72988/workbench-buildscripts-v1.10.0
2299.detail: `.workbench/manifest.json` uses an older version of the `buildscripts` dependency

2301.title: [Gen2] Add cellular registration intervention commands to Gen2
2301.detail: Add cellular AT intervention commands to Gen2, to improve/speed up registration process. This is particularly helpful in scenarios where the radio struggles to connect to an invalid operator.

2302.title: Gen3: prohibit access to external flash over XIP
2302.detail: Accessing the external flash, mainly the OTA region, via XIP it may fail to parse it correctly under some not entirely clear circumstances.

2303.title: [Gen 3] Fix micros/millis/unixtime becoming non-monotonic / Make I2C bus reset less destructive if performed in the middle of the transaction
2303.detail:
1. [Gen 3] Micros/millis/unixtime may become non-monotonic (especially with hot/cold ambient temperature) due to unaccounted clock drift between 32KHz RTC and `DWT->CYCCNT`
2. [Gen 3] Non-monotonic micros may cause internal I2C HAL timeouts to expire early and cause I2C HAL to perform bus reset in the middle of the transaction.
3. [Gen 2 / Gen 3] Current I2C bus reset procedure is destructive if happens in the middle of the unfinished transaction and may cause erroneous data to be written into the I2C slave. Devices populated with BQ24195 PMIC (cellular) or AM1805 RTC (tracker) may very well end up in a broken state (e.g. powered off)

See also https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/issues/2291

2304.title: Reduce cloud/CoAP keepalive time for wifi
2304.detail: Some users report compatibility problems with wifi routers with 30 second timeout intervals

2305.title: Gen2 cellular changes to support R510: ch76511

2306.title: Fixes the issue that the Particle.disconnect() doesn't clear the auto…
2306.detail: `Particle.disconnect()` doesn't clear the auto-connect flag if it is called before the cloud connection is established. Running the simple example app below the device will always try connecting to the cloud.

2307.title: Gen2: fixes the issue that the cellular modem is reset unexpectedly.
2307.detail: If the WLAN_WD expires during device is connecting to the cellular tower followed by user requests to cancel the on-going cellular operation, the modem might be reset still.

2308.title: Restores the modem state after device is woken up.
2308.detail: For sleep 2.0 API, if the modem is powered on, but not establishing connection, it won't restore the modem power state after device is woken up.

2309.title: Gen2: network connection is established unexpectedly.
2309.detail:
1. If the modem is just turned on by `Network.on()` and there is something wrong processing the modem events to cause a WLAN_WD to fire or somehow the `SPARK_WLAN_RESET` is set to reset the modem, device will try connecting to the network after the modem is reset.
2. If the modem is just turned on by `Network.on()` and system sleep API is called to make device enter sleep mode, after the device wakes up it will try connecting to the network. (Gen2 with all sleep API and Gen3 with sleep 1.0 API)

2310.title: System: make sure that the power source being USB host is well detected
2310.detail:
This issue can be easily replicated on Tracker. 
1. Attached both battery and connect device to computer via USB cable
2. Unplug the USB cable and plug back again
3. The power source is detected as `VIN`, instead of `USB Host`

If there is a power source attached to the DC jack, pluging back USB cable won't update the power source either.

2311.title: [ci] remove build directory after finishing the build job

2312.title: Add an integration test to validate network/cloud connection time SLOs
2312.detail: This PR adds an integration test to validate SLOs around network/cloud connection times. The exact thresholds are TBD.

2313.title: [photon/p1] wlan: make sure to close all sockets when deinitializing WICED connectivity subsystem
2313.detail:
Entering listening mode on Photon and P1 does not invalidate current sockets, while at the same time `wlan_restart()` will call into WICED to deinitialize LwIP stack, which invalidates netconns that are in use by WICED sockets and our socket layer.

Performing socket actions on a handle that has a reference to invalidated WICED socket/LwIP netconn may cause a crash.

2314.title: [ci] fix MarkupSafe weirdness
2314.detail:
CI fails when installing `gcovr` and its dependencies. See e.g. https://g.codefresh.io/build/609bcf2539bf357f8705df27

2315.title: Add an API to get the maximum supported size of event data
2315.detail:
1. The maximum supported sizes of an event's payload data, variable value and a function call argument no longer depend solely on the Device OS version and there's no way to determine their values at runtime in the application code.
3. The constants defined in protocol_defs.h (`MAX_EVENT_DATA_LENGTH`, etc.), although undocumented, not necessarily reflect the actual limits either.

2316.title: Add system watchdog API for user applications
2316.detail: Applications (tracker) must instantiate their own version of RTC drivers to manage the watchdog.  While the device OS handles synchronization of time and general RTC functions, it does not expose the RTC watchdog features, if any.  Application code size may be reduced by not having the additional/redundant driver for things that device OS may already handle.

2318.title: [Gen2] Support for SARA R410 05.12 firmware
2318.detail: The SIM select functionality for Kore ATT defaults the MNO profile to 198 (which does not support ATT band 5) which for older radio firmware defaults to UMNOPROF:2 (which supports Band 5 along with other ATT bands) [ch78344](https://app.clubhouse.io/particle/story/78344/r410-05-12-umnoprof-s-kore-att-equivalent-now-defaults-to-198-instead-of-2)

2319.title: [Gen3] 05.12 - Refactor logic that hard codes UMNOPROF for Kore ATT
2319.detail: Refactor logic that hard codes UMNOPROF for Kore ATT

2320.title: Print debug info in integration tests
2320.detail: Verbose logs in integration tests are disabled by default.

2321.title: 3.1.0-rc.1 fixes
2321.detail:
1. `primary_phy` in default BLE advertising parameters is not initialized
2. `EXFLASH_00_ConcurrentXipAndQspiUsageStress` causes a fault due to XIP region protection being enabled
3. Just in case re-enable URCs when initializing the modem on Gen 2
4. FastPin timings in no_fixture tests are no longer met due to different GCC 10 optimizations - relax them.
5. U201-based Gen 3 devices fail to respond right away after the AT muxer channel is resumed, we should wait for them to do so before returning control to the caller
6. `WIFI_15_entering_listening_mode_and_enabling_softap_closes_active_sockets_cleanly` should run background loop when threading is disabled, otherwise the device won't enter listening mode
7. Remove connect time SLO from `integration/slo/startup`. A separate more advanced one was added in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2312
8. Workarounds for GCC 10 incorrectly optimizing naive `memset()` implementation in Gen 2 bootloaders (at least Electron) causing an infinite recursion.
9. `integration/slo/startup` application binary assertions should account for higher P1 flash usage compared to Photon because of `USE_SERIAL_FLASH` in `FLASH_ModuleInfo`.
10. Adds signal strength/quality to `integration/slo/connect_time` and adds a hack to output the stats JSON over USB instead of using cloud publishes to avoid hitting publish limits :sigh: (cc @joegoggins)

2322.title: [Gen 3] 256KB application support
2322.detail:
Refer to the [SDD](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DvOFlKDMDqB1JotDDHTFnWLNPyqYZ9ZADfSXr4W8P9U/edit)

NOTE: this PR also enables LTO on all Gen 3 platforms when building system parts.

**NOTE: do not use current version of CLI to flash new 256KB binaries over DFU, this will fail**

2323.title: [build] force -Wreturn-type to always trigger an error
2323.detail: Starting with GCC 9 not returning a value from a function declared to return non-void type will cause a hardfault. This is easily overlooked in applications where warnings are not promoted to errors by defaults.

2326.title: feature/toolchain-bundleignore
2326.detail: We need a way to specify files and directories which should be excluded from the toolchain dependency bundle used by the local compiler (as used by Particle Workbench, etc).

2327.title: [Argon / Tracker] ESP32 MAC and firmware version caching; [Gen 3] Fixes non-MBR-based bootloader updates
2327.detail:
1. Some changes in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2302 are now affecting the boot times of ESP32-based devices (mainly Argon) where ESP32 on bootup may be powered on and off multiple times to query version/MAC address.
2. Non-MBR-based bootloader updates are broken after https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2302

2328.title: Prevent ICCID errors by using CFUN=4 instead of CFUN=0
2328.detail:
ICCID is not obtained when queried through `particle serial identify` in listening mode
```
blah@MacBook-Pro ~ $ particle serial identify

Your device id is e00fce68835b20e067d53c87
Your system firmware version is 3.0.0
```

2330.title: [nrf52840] platform: we only need to erase user application when building in modular
2330.detail: Monolithic builds are broken on Gen 3 platforms.

2331.title: Add ability to set and scan extended advertisement size (when using Coded PHY)
2331.detail: Now that 3.1 supports Coded PHY, we should also support scanning for advertisements that are up to 255 bytes instead of 31 bytes.

2332.title: Free malloc'ed memory
2332.detail:
Seems like a bug that the memory is allocated with malloc but never freed. I didn't run a test to check if there was an actual memory leak, so I might have missed how it's freed. I did test that this new code compiles and the function works as expected (re-ran the `ble_scanner_broadcaster` tests)

---

2333.title: [ci] generate public CF url in slack notification
2333.detail: `$CF_BUILD_URL` generated by CF contains a private URL requiring CF sign-in even though we have public build logs enabled on CF.

2334.title: [u-blox] Handle erroneous -1 AcT response from CEREG and COPS commands on R510
2334.detail:
The SARAR510 modem can potentially report a -1 value in the Radio Access Technology (RAT or AcT) field of at least two AT commands: `AT+COPS?` and `AT+CEREG?`
This value results in an incorrectly parsed cellular access technology that breaks the signal strength reporting in particle console.

2335.title: Do not reset the session on socket errors
2335.detail:
1. Network/socket layer errors cause the session data to be invalidated, which may lead to significantly increased data usage in low signal conditions.
2. Recursively calling into the MDM HAL from within the `HAL_NET_notify_disconnected()` callback causes a stack overflow on Electron (Device OS 2.1.0 doesn't seem to be affected). Stack trace:
```
...
...
...
...
```

2338.title: [gen3] ble: fix unintialized scan_phys in default scan parameters
2338.detail: `scan_phys` in default BLE scan parameters are not initialized.

2339.title: Use ncp_id from OTP to determine modem type
2339.detail:
Early boards with the SARA R510 did not have the Network Coprocessor Identifier programed into the OTP memory locations. To work around this SARA R510 was hard coded in the GEN2 modem hal and the GEN3 `platform_primary_ncp_identifier`. 

The latest gen 2 / 3 SARAR510 EVT devices have this data so the workaround should not be needed going forward

2340.title: [gcc] Enable -Wextra
2340.detail: There are many more diagnostics available in GCC which can be enabled with `-Wextra`, which can protect us against common pitfalls e.g. forgetting to initialize on of the fields of a struct, forgetting to `break` out of `switch-case` etc.

2342.title: Fixes the power leakage issue on the ESP32 module.
2342.detail: On the ESP32 based platforms, if it is running the application with MANUAL mode and then goes into sleep mode without touching the network/modem functionality, it will draw ~300uA, which is violate the expected ~80uA.

2344.title: [ota] Additional state for firmware update checks, new API System.updateStatus()
2344.detail: `System.updatesPending()` can only return `true` or `false` and it's impossible to tell whether `false` means that an update is indeed not available or that the system hasn't performed a check for updates yet.

2346.title: Clear module slots in DCT when preparing for an OTA update
2346.detail: When system resets are disabled via `System.disableReset()`, it is possible to flash the device OTA multiple times without it resetting itself to apply the first received update. Module slots that are stored in the DCT and trigger the bootloader to copy the module's data from the OTA section to its destination section in the internal flash are not cleared in this case, even if the received modules occupy the same area in the OTA section, which may result in a corrupted firmware update.

2347.title: Refactors system describe json generation to reduce size, removes invalid factory modules from it
2347.detail:
1. If factory module (whether valid or seemingly valid) is flashed onto an Electron and it is running < Device OS 3.0, such module configuration will overflow the maximum supported CoAP message size and will cause an assertion failure, which causes a reset.
2. There is no automated way of catching system describe overflows under such conditions

2348.title: [services] Fixes jsmnerr_t issues in jsmn
2348.detail:
(based on https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/tree/fix/jsmn-library-updates)

Due to usage of `-fshort-enums` we were exporting `jsmn_parse()` which in fact was only returning an `int8_t`, preventing parsing of relatively large JSONs. This is now fixed in the upstream version of jsmn library (returns in `int`) and also in our "fork" contained within Device OS sources in services.

We will sync up with the upstream jsmn at a later point.

2351.title: Ignore files in lib directory during build
2351.detail:
If the `lib` directory contains a normal file (in my case a Bazel BUILD file), local compilation with Particle Workbench fails with:
```
> Executing task: make -f '/Users/andrew/.particle/toolchains/buildscripts/1.10.0/Makefile' compile-user -s <


:::: COMPILING APPLICATION

user hal-dynalib services-dynalib system-dynalib rt-dynalib wiring communication-dynalib platform wiring_globals

make[3]: *** [../build/target/user/platform-6-m/supply_ventilation/Adafruit_GFX_RK/src/glcdfont.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** [user] Error 2
make[1]: *** [modules/photon/user-part] Error 2
make: *** [compile-user] Error 2
The terminal process "/bin/bash '-c', 'make -f '/Users/andrew/.particle/toolchains/buildscripts/1.10.0/Makefile' compile-user -s'" terminated with exit code: 2.
```

2356.title: Avoid freeing memory in detachInterrupt
2356.detail: When `attachHandler` is called with a function pointer (or a pointer to a member function and instance), it allocates a `std::function`. When `detachHandler` is then called on the same pin, it calls `delete` to free that memory. That causes a heap error if you try to call `detachHandler` on this pin from an ISR. The same is true for attaching and detaching system interrupts.
