2364.title: Update pip to last compatible with Python 3.5

2365.title: [u-blox] SARA R510 support extras
2365.detail:
- [feature] Rebasing multiple times has caused some missing code for R510 support of CEDRXS
- [bugfix] Two bugs fixed while testing backports of R510 support for 2.3.0
  - [u-blox] mitigate bug with R510 v3.15 that ERRORs with UGPIOC=23,10
  - [u-blox] R510 bug, modem doesn't respond to PWR_ON to turn off modem
- [enhancement] use ncpId() consistently
- [enhancement] prevent R410 flags from affecting other modems before initialization

2369.title: Increase particle connection timeout to 9 min for on-device tests where applicable
2369.detail: On-device tests fail at Particle.connect() in certain locations as network coverage varies

2370.title: Enabling building of GCC platform as a standalone shared library with no dependencies on e.g. Boost
2370.detail: We want to simplify unit testing of libraries or applications that rely on Device OS APIs.

2371.title: Increase BLE operation timeout.
2371.detail: BLE device may assert due to timeout when it is connecting/discovering services while the peer device just enters the sleep mode.

2372.title: fix the issue that BLE setup fails on Wi-Fi platform.
2372.detail: BLE setup process fails on Wi-Fi platform. We directly call into the NCP client's `connect()` function and bypass the system network manager. We need to disconnect the connection after Wi-Fi credentials is verified to succeed the setup process, otherwise, the network manager won't do that for us due to the improvement that has been introduced in netif.

2373.title: [R510] AT command timeouts after warm boot
2373.detail: Some of R510 warm boots take longer than expected and failing SLO criteria. In one of the runs with debugging enabled, it is noticed a run that took 115sec during warm boot (expected <30s) was blocked at ATI9 command for 90sec (which is default AT command timeout) and was causing the additional delays. It's next command though, works.

2374.title: [gen3] hal: zero out invalid user modules
2374.detail:
Devices may present invalid user modules in system describe which can appear as some other type of module with potentially a set of invalid dependencies which cannot be satisfied preventing OTA from working correctly.

This happens because we ignore integrity or any other checks when making a decision on whether to include read-out module data in system describe. This is more problematic with Gen 3 devices running 3.1.0+ with 256KB applications as the compat (128KB) module header location would be in the middle of the larger binary. If by chance bytes at that location contain something seemingly valid (e.g. correct module type), this erroneous module would be reported in the describe message. If there is additionally a seemingly valid dependency, this is going to prevent product updates from happening, as DS will not be able to satisfy it.

2375.title: [wiring] acquireSerialXBuffer() support
2375.detail: The default 64-byte USART RX/TX buffer may not be sufficient for some applications.

2376.title: Fixes copy-constructor woes in Wiring BLE API; Migrate BLE tests to be runnable under device-os-test-runner
2376.detail:
1. BLE Wiring copy constructors are broken and cause an infinite recursion
2. Current BLE tests need to be run manually.

2377.title: CoAP Blockwise transfer for Describe messages [sc-89923]
2377.detail: This PR adds initial support for CoAP blockwise transfers (see [RFC 7959](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7959)) that allow sending large CoAP requests and responses that would not normally fit into a single UDP packet. For now, blockwise transfer is only implemented for Describe messages.

2378.title: Store test coverage to an HTML report
2378.detail: We're not using Coveralls anymore to store and track test coverage. Going forward, we want an HTML coverage report to be available in CircleCI.

2379.title: [Gen3] Feature to disable listening mode

2381.title: Fix hardfault handler to SOS again

2383.title: Fix compilation errors on Linux
2383.detail:
This PR fixes compilation errors on recent Linux distros with GCC 11 and updated system header files.

The following dependencies were updated:
- Boost to [1.78.0](https://www.boost.org/users/history/version_1_78_0.html).
- Catch to [2.13.7](https://github.com/particle-iot/Catch2/tree/v2.13.7).
- FakeIt to [2.0.9](https://github.com/particle-iot/FakeIt/tree/2.0.9).

2384.title: Panic handler updates
2384.detail: Applications want to have the ability to override the panic handler such that customer panic handlers can be implemented in user space.

2386.title: Remove WiFiTesting mode and Setup over Serial1
2386.detail: Dead code used on Photon (no longer supported on head of Device OS) was hanging around, so it got a haircut

2387.title: [gen3] hal: only skip modules that fail integrity check from module info
2387.detail: We've introduced a bug in https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/pull/2374 in the condition used to skip 'invalid' modules from module info. Due to the behavior of `fetch_module()` it actually returns additional validation flags apart from the ones being requested (in our case only `INTEGRITY` check is of concern).

2390.title: Thread/interrupt safety for system_event_t subscriptions, support for unsubscribing
2390.detail:
1. `std::vector` is used for storing subscriptions in the system layer
2. `system_subscribe_event()` is not thread/interrupt safe and can easily trigger an issue if for example a button interrupt (which is generated directly from an ISR) is generated while the subscriptions list is generated
3. There is no way to disable a subscription (`System.off()` exists, but does not do anything)

2391.title: [gen3] Add GCC feature 'build-id' into the system part1 and user apps

2392.title: Enables stack overflow detection in all builds

2393.title: Add LOG_C_VARG logging macro to support vargs from user apps

2394.title: Add in os introspection functions to wrap the FreeRTOS functions

2395.title: [CI] Migration to CircleCI
2395.detail:
As title says. Updates CI scripts to run on CircleCI and adds circleci/config.yml. The builds are now performed in the release-style manner similar to Concourse with release scripts building platforms + device-os-test-runner building tests. The artifacts are collected on CircleCI, see https://app.circleci.com/jobs/github/particle-iot/device-os/611/artifacts. The scripts are somewhat crappy, but this PR has minimal changes from existing Codefresh/Concourse pipeline, we can always refactor things later.

_No custom Particle orbs were used as public org on CircleCI does not have access to those._

This PR also supersedes #2378 and adds HTML coverage report to artifacts.

The base image for buildpacks has also been updated to Ubuntu 20.04 and host (not ARM) GCC has been updated to GCC 11. See references (those repositories have also been migrated to CircleCI).

There are a couple of problems with how CircleCI executes workflows (e.g. unable to fail a job and still force-run another one), but this is what we have to deal with.

The only remaining thing is potentially adding support for building and pushing buildpacks.

2396.title: Move over legacy makefile-based unit tests to CMake

2398.title: [gen3] BLE: introduce wiring APIs to change ATT MTU.
2398.detail: Currently the desired ATT MTU is set to maximum by default. The ATT MTU exchange procedure is performed automattically once connection is established. But the procedure may failed for some reason and user application has no way to update the ATT MTU to a higher value.

2399.title: Make system_version.h compliant with C; Coalesce FreeRTOS task list internals into single location

2400.title: linker: Add GCC feature 'build-id' into monolithic firmware
2400.detail: This PR is to complement #2391 to add GCC feature build-id for monolithic firmware.

2401.title: [gen3] adds SystemPowerConfiguration::socBitPrecision(uint8_t bits)) API [sc-94643]
2401.detail: When loading a custom FuelGauge battery model, the SoC calculation may use a 18 or 19 bit model.  This must be recalled by the system FuelGauge class for use in properly calculating SoC.

2402.title: testing
2402.detail: What Bug or Missing Feature does this PR address? (A short summary is preferred over links)

2403.title: Wl branch
2403.detail: What Bug or Missing Feature does this PR address? (A short summary is preferred over links)

2404.title: Register without waiting for CSD connections [sc-96611]
2404.detail:
Currently on our 2G/3G/Cat-1 devices, we require CSD and PSD connections to be registered before we start a data connection. So if one won't connect, likely the CSD connection... it will block the device from connecting. 

Early on in Electron development I believe we waited for CSD connections so that we could dial out and receive calls to potentially wake on RING indication, but this has never been implemented and currently cannot be used with current SIMs.

2405.title: Listening mode should be allowed to enter when safe mode is requested.
2405.detail: If Wi-Fi credential is missing and safe mode is requested, device cannot enter listening mode to allow user to configure Wi-Fi credentials. As result device cannot finally connect to the cloud and stay in safe mode.

2406.title: Improves reliability of a few wiring/no_fixture tests
2406.detail: - wiring/no_fixture SYSTEM/THREAD/TIME all had some intermittent tests

2408.title: [app] BLE provisioning mode for manual testing
2408.detail: This PR adds an example app which uses the BLE provisioning mode APIs

2411.title: [gen3] Dummy setup code should not return error
2411.detail: API call to get device setup code `get_device_setup_code()` returns an error when dummy setup code is set, although it's a valid case.

2412.title: [test] fixes integration slo/connect_time
2412.detail:
Integration test `connect_time/slo` was failing intermittently on various devices for a number of reasons:

1. The test is designed to run cold boot and warm boot 10 times each, and take the 75th percentile result to compare to the SLO for each test case.  If any individual test failed, it would count towards the total number of tests as a failure, even if the individual test was one of the 25th percentile outliers.
2. Every test in the test runner suite has a 10 minute timeout value, so if the device `waitFor()` timeouts exceed that, the test will result in a failure and we won't know what was really failing in the test.
3. The test was running 10 test cases, and looking for a 75th percentile SLO which is not evenly divisible within 10 test cases, so the math was actually calculating the 70th percentile instead of 75th.
4. If a test failed before setting the `stats` object, the resulting test would be saved as 0s which is technically passing.
5. `stats.coldBootCount` and `stats.warmBootCount` were not incremented if the test exited early.
6. Javascript `.sort()` defaults to alphanumeric string sort and will not sort integers properly
7. There was a potential index error with where the 75th percentile was calculated `const i = Math.floor((values.length-1) * p / 100)`
8. The cold boot test was attempting to power off the NCP before it was on.  This was causing longer power off delays due to no AT interface being available.  R510 was resorting to a lengthy emergency hard power off sequence.

2414.title: Updates C++ standard version to C++17 (gnu variant)
2414.detail:
1. Updates C++ standard version to C++17 (gnu variant)
2. Fixes branch name escape logic for CircleCI/Docker.
3. Bumps `nrf5_sdk` to a version with C++17-related `register` fixes.

2415.title: [test] improves wiring/no_fixture_long_running NETWORK_XX test timing
2415.detail: `wiring/no_fixture_long_running` NETWORK_02 and possibly 01 or 03 can fail when a device takes longer than expected to register.  We test connect_time cold/warm boots separately with a 75th percentile criteria after 8 runs.  Here, we only run through once and it would be kind of lengthy to run this test 8 or even 4 times.

2416.title: [test] fix listening network tests
2416.detail: NETWORK_00 and NETWORK_01 tests which are in the beginning of the test suite depend on the previous tests to establish a cloud connection. If a cloud connection was not established successfully in the previous tests, these tests immediately fail.

2417.title: [test] communication/functions communication/variables fixes for large describes

2418.title: feature/sc-100324/ci-build-cross-platform
2418.detail: Device OS' build system drives local compilation of user firmware in a number of Particle's user-facing and internal developer tools - most notably Particle Workbench. Currently prior to releasing, the build system is tested on Linux / Ubuntu which means bugs and regressions are much harder to proactively catch on other supported platforms (Windows and macOS).

2419.title: Return relevant error from control request to enter listening mode
2419.detail: In the case where listening mode is not allowed in the user firmware, the device-os returns `SYSTEM_ERROR_NONE` instead of the relevant error, which when propagated to the particle-cli results in a timeout.

2423.title: [gen2][supply secure] Communication
2423.detail: Gen2 Supply Secure for Communications module

2425.title: [gen2][supply secure] hal, hal-dynalib and some unit-tests

2427.title: Update dependencies doc to reflect ARM GCC version requirements

2430.title: Update ARM GCC dependencies document to 10.2.1

2434.title: chore/ci-less-frequent-cross-platform-build-checks
2434.detail: Cross-platform build system CI checks are running more frequently than we'd like or need.

2437.title: [gen2][supply secure] build, misc, modules, main, newlib_ nano, platform, rt-dynalib, ci

2440.title: [gen3] wifi: add dhcp dns info to wifi config

2441.title: Use a custom content type with CID packets when resuming the session
2441.detail: A [CID](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc9146) packet carries no indication of whether the device is reconnecting to the Cloud or continuing to talk over the already established session.

2443.title: [gen3][esomx] Define E404X platform
2443.detail: E404X Hardware needs to be supported in DVOS

2444.title: chore/sc-101315/ci-test-build-system-apt-timeout-retry
2444.detail: We've seen a few sporadic failures over in the `test-build-system` CI workflow related to `apt-get install` connection timeouts (ex: [1](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/particle-iot/device-os/631/workflows/0b0a1203-6b3a-4c2f-bfca-300479c67190/jobs/9312), [2](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/particle-iot/device-os/615/workflows/936ff079-bef8-475c-a092-47f07ea82b2a/jobs/8872))

2445.title: [deprecation] Adds warning to some deprecated API's that will be removed in Device OS 5.x
2445.detail: There are a number of uppercase HAL APIs that were deprecated and renamed to lowercase.  We would like to remove these uppercase APIs in Device OS 5.x, however customers do not have any way currently to know they will be removed in 5.x.

2446.title: [deprecation] PRODUCT_ID macro
2446.detail:
- Users would like to be able to use the same binary for multiple Products with the same functionality.
- Internally we would like to not be bound to how many Products there can be.

2447.title: [deprecation] remove setup_done flag and add deprecation notice
2447.detail:
This PR removes the setup-done flag, and adds deprecation notice when the dct setup-done flag is used.

1. Attempting to set this bit via particle CLI or BLE will not have any impact on the device behavior. The setup_done bit can be modified only via user app.
2. Setting this via user app causes the following deprecation warning. Starting Device OS 5.x, the setup_done bit and the relevant HAL flag will be completely removed and will cause a build error.
```
Setup Done flag has been deprecated since Device OS 4.0 and has no effect on device behavior. This will be removed in Device OS 5.x causing build error!
```

2448.title: [gen3] fixes hardfault during low level USB peripheral initialization under an atomic section
2448.detail: When logging from ISR is enabled and use the Serial1 as the log interface, device runs into SOS. This is because that SD APIs require SVC interrupt to be enabled, whereas logging from ISR will prehibit the SVC interrupt and device has a chance to call into SD APIs and then hardfault.

2449.title: [ci] minor update sc-101315/device-os-manifest
2449.detail: The manifest schema was updated with a new platform field (`baseMcu`) which caused the local `.workbench/manifest.json` overrides file to fail validation.

2450.title: feature/sc-101084/e404x-platform-toolchain-manifest
2450.detail: Local compiler toolchain does not recognize the new `esomx` platform

2451.title: [Gen3] Device unable to enter listening mode with button press
2451.detail: Listening mode cannot be entered through MODE button press with system threading enabled

2452.title: [gen3] hal: fix power leak on Boron
2452.detail: Boron entering hibernate mode after startup in MANUAL mode consumes ~700UA current, which beyonds the expected <100uA.  The root cause of the issue is that the modem uart is initialized on startup, while the system sleep API checks that the cellular interface is off so that the modem off procedure is not performed, thus, the modem uart is kept on.

2454.title: [Gen3] WiFi resolve tests need retries
2454.detail: WiFi.resolve() tests sometimes fail when run with a new connection

2455.title: [ci] chore/sc-101315/test-build-system-tune-timeouts
2455.detail: We've continue to see sporadic failures over in the `test-build-system` CI workflow related to `apt-get install` connection timeouts ([example](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/particle-iot/device-os/712/workflows/f301cf74-1c81-4335-bc52-891fd8547e2c/jobs/11952?invite=true#step-103-122))

2456.title: [E404X] Determine flash part at runtime
2456.detail: The ESOMX, B404X, B524X, T404X and other SKUs will need to support multiple different flash chips in order to avoid dependencies on a single supplier. Historically we have handled hardware variations using OTP, but we cannot use that as we will not know the flash variant at boot. The exflash driver will need to discover what flash part is attached, and update the driver to communicate with it accordingly.

2457.title: feature/sc-102452/update-device-os-workbench-manifest-json
2457.detail: `.workbench/manifest.json` uses an older version of the `debuggers` dependency

2458.title: Adds support for BG95-M1, BG95-MF, BG77, and EG91-NAX [sc-102979]

2459.title: [gen3][esomx] ESOMX board support on HIL / Concourse
2459.detail: HIL / Concourse need to be updated to support the esomx platform. There are various build scripts used by these tools to compile firmware and tests that need to be updated

2462.title: Allow overriding the platform ID on the GCC platform
2462.detail: This PR adds the ability to override the platform ID of a virtual device via command line arguments.

2463.title: [tests] Change PWM pins to better match e-series pinout for E SoM X. Fix other tests
2463.detail: There are many device-os-test-runner failures for the new esomx platform. Most are pin and PWM related due to the new platform pinmap. This PR does not fix all of them (yet)

2464.title: Enable OTA updates on the GCC platform
2464.detail: The GCC platform only supports on-demand OTA updates which prevents us from using it for testing multistage and product updates.

2465.title: feature/sc-98414/toolchain-buildscripts-v1.11.0
2465.detail: We'll need to use modular debug builds for the Device OS `v4.x` and `v5.x` lines in order to improve end-user UX and to ultimately support the `p2` platform

2467.title: [gen3] port newlib stdin/stdout/stderr memory leak workaround
2467.detail: Our newlib may leak memory when stdin/stdout/stderr fake streams are used.

2469.title: [tests] Fix broken tone and servo tests for p2 platform
2469.detail: 5.0.0-alpha.1 tests showed tone and servo tests failing on P2. The failures are due to errors introduced when rebasing changes for esomx support.

2470.title: [p2] Flash supports page write and other fixes
2470.detail: 1. To improve firmware download speed, we need to make use of `FLASH_TxData256B()` 2. We're using 80MHz in the P2 flash clock configuration while MX25R32 requires up to 60MHz clock speed. 3. Minor fixes for SPI unit test **NOTE: This PR requires updating the prebootloader!**

2471.title: feature/sc-106677/stop-ignoring-device-os-scripts-directory
2471.detail: Our developer tools require a series of scripts to support `p2` flashing and debugging (e.g. `init_km4.gdb`). Currently those files live within the `./scripts` directory and are ignored when creating the toolchain dependency bundle

2472.title: [linker] make sure that FreeRTOS task/timer symbols are coalesced in bss section, disable LTO for FreeRTOS sources as well
2472.detail: Due to refactoring of linker files in #1953 (and those changes actually coming after P2 merge) we lost a quirk in linker files which coalesced FreeRTOS task/timer symbols into a single location in .bss for some of the tooling that we use (#2399). This also wasn't really working with LTO enabled as is the case with Gen 3 system part builds.

2473.title: [p2] [wifi] allow setting common country code and channel plan in P2
2473.detail: With the P2 previously we only supported setting the wifi country code to "US".

2474.title: [p2][wifi] Add more complete WiFi network configuration information for P2
2474.detail: Provide more complete wifi_config information to the  `WiFi.wifi_config()` method

2475.title: feature/sc-106692/devtools-bundleignore
2475.detail: With the addition of the RealTek SDK, the Device OS' toolchain bundle's filesize has grown to ~292M (up from ~49M)

2476.title: [rtl872x] DCache alignment requirement
2476.detail: Buffers being used by DMA or between KM0 and KM4 should be 32-byte aligned, and the length of it should be multiple of 32 bytes, otherwise, data in SRAM might be corrupted.

2477.title: [rtl872x] usart: flush DMA FIFO data when required
2477.detail: RTL872x DMA peripheral is not transferring data out of its internal FIFO (previously having transferred it in there from UART) into the destination buffer if FIFO contains less than 4 bytes, no matter the burst size, FIFO or other setting.

2478.title: allow ethernet detection on P2
2478.detail: Ethernet detection was disabled on P2 until now

2479.title: Deprecate tinker fqc
2479.detail:
All of the `tinker-fqc` app functionality has been rolled into the base `tinker` app. There is no need for the app anymore so it should be removed. It was unnecessarily inflating the size of the combined release binaries as well, since it was being built for every platform even though it was only strictly needed for P2.

Another problem solved in this release is that `tinker` was no longer able to be compiled with the standalone `application.cpp` file. 

The last major change in this PR is the creation of a `third_party/coremark` module. A fork of the public coremark repo was made, then a submodule added referencing our `particle` branch that has the modifications needed to run coremark in the P2 FQC CPU test. Functionally things are the same, but the coremark code is no longer included in the tinker app dir.

2480.title: [tinker] Fix tinker build for non-p2 platforms

2484.title: [rtl872x] usart: UART_DEV2 (Serial1) actually works with DMA, no need to use interrupt mode
2484.detail:
Well, as title says. For some reason the SDK is missing definitions for DMA hardware handshake identifiers for UART2_DEV (Serial1), so we had to use interrupt mode for Serial1. Apparently if we just add them (there is an obvious gap in the numbers), everything works just fine.

**NOTE: If shorting TX/RX together on boot the device will enter boot ROM. Is there any way to disable this?**

2491.title: [p2] Simplify burn in LED blink, work around System.millis() reset
2491.detail:
The P2 burn in process is supposed to indicate how long it has run by blinking the LED every 1s. An alternating green/blue pattern indicates the tests are still running and passing.
 
For burn in hours X:
x >= 72h : 6 green blinks 4 blue
72h > x >= 48h : 7 green blinks 3 blue 
48h > x >= 24h : 8 green blinks, 2 blue
x < 24h : 9 green blinks, 1 blue

The current LED blink logic is convoluted, and relies on the `System.millis()` value monotonically increasing. Unfortunately there is also a bug right now where it resets sometimes, which causes the LED logic to break and stop blinking all together.

`C5` shares a PWM channel with the RGB LEDs (channel 0). When running the PWM long running tests, the RGB led would interfere with the tests, causing them to fail.

2507.title: [p2] attachInterrupt() should not configure input pullup/pulldown/nopull
2507.detail:
From [Docs on attachInterrupt](https://docs.particle.io/reference/device-os/api/interrupts/attachinterrupt/):

> NOTE: pinMode() MUST be called prior to calling attachInterrupt() to set the desired mode for the interrupt pin (INPUT, INPUT_PULLUP or INPUT_PULLDOWN).

P2 implementation currently does not respect this and modifies the pin pull up based on the InterruptMode type (RISING/FALLING/CHANGE).

2512.detail: Device OS disables logging to the USB serial when the device is in listening mode in order to prevent mixing up the serial console and logging output. However, it turns out that messages logged via `LOG_PRINT()` and other macros for direct logging still get through and may garble the serial console output. This PR fixes that by disabling direct logging in listening mode.

2533.detail:
Tracker M only has one of the MCP23S17 interrupt pins connected to the MCU. In proto 2, some of the interrupt pins are moved to port B, so the driver must configure the expander to connect the interrupt pins together. This configuration was made as a compile time flag for definition in `hal_platform_config.h`.

2536.title: [wiring] ApplicationWatchdog: fixes potential 2x timeout required  to fire
2536.detail:
See [SC](https://app.shortcut.com/particle/story/109275/application-watchdog-running-for-double-time)

This is a bug/problematic behavior in ApplicationWatchdog: https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/develop/wiring/inc/spark_wiring_watchdog.h#L52
https://github.com/particle-iot/device-os/blob/develop/wiring_globals/src/spark_wiring_watchdog.cpp#L22

`checkin()` gets called after `ApplicationWatchdog` thread has been started and the thread went to sleep. This updates `last_checkin` and upon wake-up in 10 minutes in this case the condition `now - last_checkin` will not be `>= timeout`, requiring another sleep cycle.

2551.title: [gen3][rtl872x]increase i2c buffer for tracker[m]. fix acquireWireBuffer
2551.detail:
The tracker/trackerm platforms communicate with a handful of i2c devices on system startup. The system allocates and provides the default 32 byte sized I2C Wire buffers to the I2C HAL. The I2C hal is able to communicate and initialize the peripherals, all is well.

However, we have a new Quectel GNSS device that returns data longer than 32 bytes in its I2C responses. 

Normally, a user can allocate their own larger I2C buffers via defining a `acquireWireBuffer()` function. However, when the user app constructs its own `TwoWire` object and attempts to re-initialize the i2c HAL, the system code rejects it (in the case of the NRF hal), since it has already been initialized. 

see [SC-109914](https://app.shortcut.com/particle/story/109914/allow-user-app-to-override-i2c-buffer-on-tracker-trackerm-other-platforms-that-may-have-rtc-and-pmic) for details
